The remote and the software work beautiful together.The smart: while waiting for the cable modem to reboot, I clicked on settings, and the TV connected to my wireless network faster than a new Mac does. A click on the "smart tv" remote button, and I was in business. The YouTube app connected easily with my iPad, so I was instantly able to play videos I bookmarked. The TV software then remembers the videos you've recently played so you can go back to them easily. I'm looking forward to playing with the other networked features and will update the review when I've had more experience.The sound is clear and better than most built in TV speakers. The sound settings give you a limited amount of customization, and I wish it had a bass boost, but otherwise no complaints. I've been listening to both music and standard TV programs.The quality of the picture is what sold me on LG TVs over the other brands when I went to the store to check out the different brands. As a previous fan of high end Sony TVs, this one holds its own in terms of sharpness and detail. If you are wondering if getting full 1080 HD resolution on a 32" TV is worth spending a bit more, it is. Whether you are trying to read movie credits or seeing the details of the net behind home plate, those extra pixels mean a lot.The "Picture Wizard" makes customizing brightness, contrast and color easy. There is no absolute in picture preferences, so you can set it to what looks good to you. It might have just been an overcast day in Chicago when I was watching the Cubs game, but I turned off the Eco mode because it made the picture look too flat. This TV faces a window with a southern exposure, so maybe I was asking too much of it.One warning: the 60Hz does mean that there will be blurriness in some very fast moving sports or action films. There was only one time it made a difference when watching baseball, but it should be a consideration if you watch faster moving programs.Now that I've figured out the basics, I might read the manual to see what features I missed, but even if I don't, this is a great TV.

Reviews.Title: The TV that watches you!!!
Reviews.Author: Mr. Henry J. Saenz
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV several months ago from another vendor. I found out today that this TV sends your viewing habits as well as file names of videos watched via DLNA or USB stick to various LG servers. The option to turn this off is buried within the menu. If that was not bad enough, it collects information and sends it whether you leave this on(default) or turn it off. I have looked through the documentation that came with the device and the box and it is not stated anywhere that this device tracks your viewing habits and sends that information to LG for whatever reason. One of those features that manufacturers do not want you to be aware of. I wonder why? If you own this, or any other LG "smart" TV, I recommend that you look closer at the TOS that you must agree to, otherwise many functions of your TV will not work. You know, the TV that you OWN and is now reporting information back to LG.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic TV - My 2nd LG LED LCD
Reviews.Author: M. Schaeffer
Reviews.Content: The only complaint that I have about this TV is the remote.  While it is fine as a remote for TV, it is terrible as a text input device.  The remote should come with a keypad standard, but LG wants extra money for one.  I had an old USB keyboard laying around, so I plugged it into one of the TV's USB input ports.  The keyboard worked immediately, no TV reboot or driver install or other silliness required.  A keyboard is way better than the remote to input my usernames and passwords for the included Hulu and Netflix apps.  The built-in apps for these two services work great and are easy to use for regular Netflix and Hulu subscribers due to the resemblance of the app to the actual website.This is a newer TV than my other LG LED LCD, which is a 32" and doesn't have all the features as it is at least a year old.  Both TVs work amazingly well as a computer monitor.  I use both with my multimedia PCs instead of buying cable TV or satellite.  The picture on both my LG TVs is great, the refresh rate is imperceptible even during ultra-high-end graphics displays, the colors are vibrant, the apps on this one work well, the remotes for different versions of the TVs work interchangeably (could be good or bad depending on the number of TVs you have in a small area), and there are no dead pixels or any other technical imperfection that I notice.Extremely good buy for the money.  5/5 would buy again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, great picture, magic remote is magic
Reviews.Author: Andrew William Mitchell
Reviews.Content: I bought this 47 inch LG to replace my 47 inch Vizio. It's night and day. First the one shortcoming. The audio is frankly not very good (the only reason it loses a star). Now the good - everything else. The picture blows away the Vizio. One big problem I had with the Vizio was the screen was too shiny. Even the smallest amount of light was too much. No lamps, nothing. I could not watch sports on the weekend with the windows open so the shades had to be closed and my living room turned into a cave. This LG TV solved all of that. The apps are awesome and 100 times easier to use than the Vizio. Nothing intuitive about the Vizio apps. Setup, smart TV features, internet connection, all of it is so much better. Get the magic Remote that works like a Wii controller and you will be blown away. Well designed all around. I was pretty disappointed with my Vizio. The TV is five stars except for the audio, which I am running through my stereo speakers.

Reviews.Title: UN-FREAKIN-BELIEVABLE
Reviews.Author: Andy
Reviews.Content: This HDTV is incredible times 100! The picture is like watching real life happen before your eyes, the speakers while not great are more than loud enough with good quality.  Set up was so easy a Michigan fan can do it ;)  I searched an searched and Amazon had the best deal by $30 and the warranty offered was also cheaper by about $20 than anywhere is I looked.  I COULD NOT BE HAPPIER with this item. I can not imagine how another HDTV could be any better (unless it was free)...  It really deserves TEN STARS, but there are only FIVE! BTW: for comparison, my previous HDTV was a top of the line Sony 42" that is about 18 months old. SAM's Club had this and several other much more expensive HDTVs lined up with this one, all showing the same movie for comparison:  the LG was far better than units several hundred dollars more expensive.

Reviews.Title: Excellent LG Television!
Reviews.Author: Mysti
Reviews.Content: There are lots of other reviews that go into detail about specs and such so I thought I would just describe the things I like best about this TV and the things that I am not that fond of.Likes- Incredible picture: The first thing my husband and I did when we had it set up was pop in the Avatar blu-ray. The color and image depth made it seem different than other times we had viewed the blu-ray on another HDTV. Everything looked unnaturally sharp and so crisp it was more like we were actually a part of the movie rather than just watching something on a TV. We also noticed the sharpness in regular TV shows. They all seem to look like a nature documentary. The picture really pulls you in; it's something that I have not experienced when watching other HD Televisions.- Smart TV Features: Every night my husband and I have a ritual of watching the newest trending videos on YouTube. The YouTube app that this TV uses has nice, big icons for the videos which makes it easy to browse and select videos. We also enjoy watching Netflix.- Brightness options: Pressing the "Ratio" button brings up a miniature menu across the bottom of the screen to quickly adjust audio, video, and closed caption options. The Energy Saving feature allows you to set your TV to automatically adjust its brightness based on ambient lighting. For example, when we turn off the lights in the room, it automatically dims the TV. Even better, when you want to set the sleep timer, you can select "Maximum power saving" and it makes the TV very dim- good for those nights when you want to fall asleep to the TV.Dislikes- No Amazon Video App: Chances are, if you're on this site- you already know how great Amazon Prime is the amount of amazing television and movies available through Amazon Instant Video. Unfortunately, you will still need a gaming system or set top box to access Amazon's Video app.- Remote: It is gigantic, clunkly, awkward, long... I could go on. The worst part for me is the 4-point directional scroll buttons surrounding the "OK" button. These directional buttons are not very well defined which causes me to hit "OK" unintentionally about 50% of the time. This is extremely frustrating! You need to use these directional buttons when scrolling through the settings (to access all video and audio options) as well as to use the apps. And good luck typing in your wpa wifi password. It only took me 6 tries :(All in all this LG 42inch 1080p 120hz LED-LCD Smart TV is excellent. Even though I wouldn't call myself a "TV expert" it has the best looking picture that I have ever seen!

Reviews.Title: An Inexpensive Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Ryan B "Byrd"
Reviews.Content: Compared to other options this seems like a great deal.  I'd say that it is and I've really enjoyed the quality this TV can produce.  You can read all the specs in the description of the item and they are all very nice my only qualm is the quality of the WiFi.  We thought we could use this TV wirelessly to stream Netflix, YouTube or use the internet.  No matter what we did we couldn't get this TV to stay connected to our WiFi and the one time it did it just wasn't fast enough to keep up. The router is no more than 20 feet away and through a wall (and I can connect many devices even further through 2 walls).  We ended up getting an Ethernet and running it under the floor to our router and it all works fine now but that was a pain in the butt.If you're looking to use this TV wirelessly do not buy it, I can almost guarantee you'll need to connect it via Ethernet.Also, this TVs speakers are just as good as my laptop speakers which should speak oceans.  If you want anything close to a full sound you're going to need some speakers to hook up.Other than those 2 problems, I've had none. Crisp picture and great capabilities for the price (if you're willing to sacrifice the time/effort to run a cable).

Reviews.Title: GReat TV
Reviews.Author: Pinchy
Reviews.Content: I bought this t.v. in July and love every minute of it.Pros: Great picture quality. If a $1000+ Samsung is 100(on an a scale from 1-100) then this t.v. is a 90+. The picture is great after some messing around with the settings. Viewing angles are great from the side to straight away center. Built in wifi, and easy to use android remote for my phone/tablet. Smart t.v. features work great, from netflix to amazon. The dnla server capabilities are on par, if not better than, the ps3.Cons: Wasn't free and doesn't make sandwiches.I'm not sure I would pay $899+ for this t.v. I'd be tempted to spend the extra $100-200 and get a samsung. I, however, got this for $699 and couldn't be happier. 55" led smart t.v. with built in wifi for $699 is a steal. Not to mention how impressed I still am with the picture.

Reviews.Title: Would be great if it would hookup to wifi consistently
Reviews.Author: Jason Tan
Reviews.Content: This TV is pretty awesome. The only problem is that it is very inconsistent in hooking up to the internet which can be super frustrating.  Last night I had to spend 15 minutes turning it on and off before it would hook up to the wifi.  All my other devices hook up instantaneously which makes it even more frustrating.  Chatted with LG support this morning and they suggested checking to make sure the software is up to date and maybe doing a hard reset.  We'll see.  Hopefully it will help.  In the meantime it's very disappointing not to be able to use the coolest feature on the tv.

Reviews.Title: WOW
Reviews.Author: Lee Barret
Reviews.Content: I buy a tv by using a criteria list. A. The Picture quality. B. The Sound Quality. C. The Extra features.I looked at 25-30 TV's on the showroom floor. After reading about this tv online I made a point to look for it. I had to ask a sales person who said that they sell a ton of the LG I was looking for. There were 3 Tv's that were facing in a different direction than the others. And Standing 100+ ft away I noticed this TV. I told my wife look at that fricking picture on that tv, I hope it is the obe were looking for.......YEP!!! It was... Wow! Now I would have bought it on just the pic quality. But the Sound quality is as good as my home theater systems, and when I observed how many features it had....Wow.Jackpot!So i rate my critera as follows:  A.10  B.10  C.10

Reviews.Title: I am finally impressed
Reviews.Author: B. Dail "Starlight"
Reviews.Content: I have needed a new TV for a while but hated spending the money because frankly, I was not impressed with the set I had (a so called great tv that constantly needed fixing and you could barely understand a word they said.  I finally gave in after the warranty expired on the other set and started looking around.  After much shopping I seemed to keep coming back to this set and I am so glad I did.  The picture is incredible and LG sends an email telling you how to enhance that, you can understand every word and the levels seem to stay the same on every channel unless you decide to change it.  The colors are gorgeous and I am actually watching the shows instead of trying to understand what they are saying while I do other things. The "smart" part is really fun and even at my age I am having fun and learning how to work everything.  The set up was a breeze.  I plugged it in and connected it to my cable box and went "wow" when I looked at the picture.  I really believe that this is not only the best buy but the best HDTV I have seen to date.

Reviews.Title: Really love this TV
Reviews.Author: dingus_staid
Reviews.Content: From the (admittedly moderate amount of) research I did, this TV had the best price for all its features and specs.  The picture is great, the Netflix and amazon Prime Video software are REALLY handy, and the sound is way better than I expected for TV speakers.

Reviews.Title: NOW has amazon prime app
Reviews.Author: DS "Say something about yourself!"
Reviews.Content: What follows is my original review but a month or so ago I got an email from Amazon that the Amazon Prime app was available, I installed it and it works great.  I put the Roku on another, not smart, TV in the bedroom, so I'm good.  Some other reviews mention the sound, which I'll admit could be better, but all together this TV is a great value.This TV was easy to install and getting to Netflix was easy (press OK on the remote to bring up the keyboard) but tech support (which was the best I've contacted in decades, really terrific) confirmed there is no compatible app for Amazon Prime.  So, I had to buy a Roku but the techie gave me a credit to help pay for it so...  Maybe I should have JUST bought the Roku for my old TV?

Reviews.Title: Turns off and on constantly
Reviews.Author: Christel C. Berg
Reviews.Content: Had it for about a month, then it started turning itself off and rebooting. Makes a loud popping noise when it happens. Seems to be getting worse.

Reviews.Title: A Solid Purchase!
Reviews.Author: S. R.
Reviews.Content: This is the second LG HDTV that I have owned.  My other is a LG Cinema Screen 47LM8600 47-Inch Cinema 3D 1080p 240Hz Dual Core LED-LCD HDTV, which got a mixed review from me.  Aesthetically, this is a beautiful television set. Very thin and unusually light in weight.  Set up was relatively quick with onscreen menu prompts that guide the user every step of the way.  The picture quality is impressive to say the least.  Although, I would recommend minimizing the TruMotion feature to eliminate the unnatural "sped up" motion during moving sequences.  I would also suggest playing with the picture and audio settings to achieve the desired settings that work best for whatever environment this unit resides in.  The factory settings, although adequate, can be easily improved upon for superior quality.  An issue I had with my previous LG 3D HDTV was a bizarre "ghosting" effect during fast motion, especially during dimly lit scenes.  Despite repeated attempts to correct the issue with LG technicians, the problem persisted.  Thankfully, I am happy to report that no such ghosting issue was observed with this unit.  It is possible that LG was aware of the problem with previous models and have since made adjustments.  Whatever the case, it is a welcome bonus for this reviewer.  The sound capabilities seemed fine for this reviewer's perspective.  It is a well known fact that many of today's HDTV's are lacking in the sound department given their slim size, but I found this unit's sound system to be above average.  The only quibble with this unit, and it is a personal one, is the magic remote control that LG uses for many of their HDTV units.  It is frustrating at times given that it too sensitive to movement and rather hard to use when navigating through the various menus.  Again, this is matter of personal taste, but I much prefer a standard remote control.  Overall, this was an excellent TV unit that exceeded this reviewer's expectations on almost all levels.

Reviews.Title: Problem after problem...
Reviews.Author: Kim
Reviews.Content: Pro- the picture is very nice. We like many of the features, and we soon got used to the remote control.Cons- it would not stay connected to our wi-fi, a repairman came to change the motherboard, and it still did not fix it.We went to take it back to Costco, and they stopped selling the TV and if I wanted another TV that have a browser on it, it would cost me another $150...sigh.So we decided to keep it, and just use an ethernet cable.Soon, our internet usage skyrocketed. We are limited to 150GB a month, and on average us about 50GB a month. But the last two months we hit our 150GB useage in the first 15days of our billing cycle!!!  That means it jumped 6 times normal usage?We contacted HULU and Neflix and checked all the settings and they are at low.LG tells us to unplug and press the power button for 30 sec.Yet when we experimented and only had one device connected to the internet for one day each, the TV was pulling 13GB in one day!!!  Everything else was .5-1GB. a day.I am past the Costco refund policy, and now can't even watch the smart part of the TV!!!for over $800 we are stuck watching DVD's....And now I find out that they are tracking not only what we watch, but our private USB file names too?http://doctorbeet.blogspot.ru/2013/11/lg-smart-tvs-logging-usb-filenames-and.htmlsorry, but when I first got this TV, I was really happy with it. but boy oh boy, time will tell won't it, because I am thinking I should have just bought a simple $300 flat screen TV and then got a Blu-Ray DVD that streams Netflix and HULU for $100 and saved a lot of time and money.

Reviews.Title: 120HZ at its finest.
Reviews.Author: Benjamin R. Roberts
Reviews.Content: I searched long and hard for the perfect TV, and I've found it.  The sound and the picture are bar none to any other 120hz TV I've seen on the market at this price point.  I've had the 55" for about 3 months, and I love it.For anyone wondering about the "TruMotion" and afraid that it's not really 120hz, but an upscaled 60hz, that's not the case.  TruMotion is a feature on the TV that allows you to adjust the blur and sharpness of your refresh rate.  This is a 100% 120hz set. (My 55")The only reason it didn't get 5 stars is because of some of the features in the Smart TV function fail sometimes.  Very rarely when you're watching YouTube or Netflix, it fails and locks up, causing you to have to reset the TV by turning it off and back on.  This can be fixed by a firmware update.  I've already installed one that is sent directly to my TV to download, but LG just hasn't made an update to fix this issue yet.Pros:Great Picture.Great Price.Tons of adjustable settings to give you the experience you want.The ability to control all HDMI inputs with a single remote through LG's SimpLink.Cons:Semi-gloss on the screen causes slight reflection.  Not a big deal if you don't face it towards windows.YouTube, Hulu, Netflix, Amazon Prime lock up sometimes, but this can be fixed with any future firmware updates.Overall:I'd give this TV a 9/10, and I'm super happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Great!  We love this TV
Reviews.Author: Charles A. Wartchow "Electrophoric"
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical about flat screen TVs, and LED TVs, but this is great.  I miss my giant, 200lb tube HDTV, which had the best picture that I've ever experienced, but this is a great TV.  LG is a good company, for sure. It's been reliable, and it was easy to set up (10 minutes?).  We use wireless, and the SMART TV functions (Netflix, Amazon) work well.

Reviews.Title: Great if new
Reviews.Author: steve_jones1990
Reviews.Content: We originally bought one with a defect in th back. It was only supposed to be a scratch but we discovered the tv couldn't pick up wifi. We had to buy a second tv and return the original.We love our new tv though.

Reviews.Title: Excellent picture and features but audio is sub-par
Reviews.Author: Jeff Jennings
Reviews.Content: Excellent picture and the Smart TV has lots of choices.  The audio distorts quickly as volume increases.  Good picture in glare and from side view.

Reviews.Title: a very smart purchase to make, 100 percent satisfied
Reviews.Author: Bryan B.
Reviews.Content: this tv is normally soo much more at the store. the picture is very clear and the quality excellent. it comes complete with a ton of smart features such as netflix, amazon instant if you are a prime member, facebook, and so much more. it picks up any device and can show photos and video from that device without any plugging in. it has great sound as well. we keep it on a table about 7 feet from where we watch and the sound is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: ibcingu
Reviews.Content: I searched high & low on the internet for a 32 inch LED tv to fit the space in my wall unit.  Visited lots of websites & read lots of reviews.  Finally settled on this LG.  Very happy with it.  Extremely east to set up & connect to my cable, WI-FI internet & WII.  Definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Good value for money - but expect to put the work in
Reviews.Author: Fraser
Reviews.Content: Ordered this as a warehouse deal, after reading enough reviews to know that it was a solid but not spectacular choice. Overall, the picture is great - IF you know how to adjust it. As many others have noted, Trumotion leads to a pretty miserable case of soapoperaitis if you don't turn it down/off. Unfortunately, because of how the settings menus are structured, it can seem that turning Trumotion off doesn't fix the problem; it's difficult to discover that internet content (Netflix etc) is controlled by a separate settings menu from that controlling bluray/cable input. You have to push the cryptic "Q. Menu" button to fix it, not the more sensible "settings." Once that bottleneck is sorted out, this tv is perfectly respectable. Wireless etc. work great. Very good value, if you're willing to sweat through some menus to get it.

Reviews.Title: Exceeds expectations
Reviews.Author: BdV
Reviews.Content: The item arrived one day earlier than expected.  Set it up and began to enjoy the many features of this tv.  Excellent picture, great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: Great TV - Great price from Amazon
Reviews.Author: S. Landry "Happy Amazon Customer"
Reviews.Content: Only had the TV a few hours - great picture quality. Really like the wireless smart TV apps. Easy set up with easy to understand on screen instructions.

Reviews.Title: LG hit one out of the park with this series of Smart TVs
Reviews.Author: T. Summers
Reviews.Content: This is my second LN5700, with the first being the 47LN5750 (same as LN5700 except it comes with the LG magic remote) which I bought for my daughter to use in the family room in her new townhouse.  I was so impressed with the TV that I decided to buy one for my place.  Mine had to fit an existing cabinet which made it more challenging.  It turned out that the 39 inch model (39LN5700) would fit my cabinet.  Out came the 150 pound Toshiba 32 inch Flat Screen that had occupied that space for 12 years and in went the LG.  This was absolutely the best decision -- better picture and functionality.  It was really eerie when I was watching one of the Mecum auto auction shows and the camera panned the engine compartment when, coincidently, I was up next to the TV.  It was so lifelike, I felt that I was peering into the engine compartment at the show!  To save a few bucks, I purchased the 39LG5700 from Pinnacle Deals (in "Like New" condition) through Amazon for $404.95 and $19.50 shipping.  Great price for a great TV!With a little digging I found that I was eligible for six months of Netflix for free.  This was available even if you were already a subscriber to Netflix (they just add the 6 months to your account).  I signed up for the free month before filling out the 6 month freebie. so I may be getting 7 months totally free.  I believe that the bigger TVs get a year free. Below is a copy of my "Chat" transcript with LG you may find useful if you are interested in following up on the Netflix promotion:"Customers can get up to one year subscription to Netflix, courtesy of LG, if they buy a LG Smart TV qualifying model between July 28th through August 24th. Customers must redeem this promotion no later than October 21, 2013, and activate no later than November 3, 2013. Some models have a 1 year gift subscription and others have 6 months subscription depending on the model number.This information is specified under the following link if you go to "QUALIFYING MODELS" %LF:ForcePage% [...]One-year subscription models:47GA7900, 55GA7900, 47LA6900, 50LA6900, 55LA6900, 50LA6970, 55LA6970, 47LA7400, 55LA7400, 60LA7400, 55LA8600, 60LA8600, 84LM9600, HECTO.Six-months subscription models:42GA6400, 47GA6400, 50GA6400, 55GA6400, 60GA6400, 42LA6200, 47LA6200, 50LA6200, 55LA6200, 60LA6200, 55LA6205, 32LN5700, 39LN5700, 42LN5700, 47LN5700, 50LN5700, 55LN5700, 47LN5750, 50LN5750, 6 0LN6150, 60PH6700, 60PN5700.Please visit [...] to begin the redemption process. Once you enter your serial number and your purchase is verified, you will be asked to upload a scan or photo of your original receipt. You will also be asked to provide certain basic personal information, including an email address so that you can receive your Netflix promotional code within a few days.Upon receiving your unique code, visit [...] enter your code and click 'continue.' From there, you'll be prompted to create a new Netflix account or sign in with your existing Netflix login information.To access Netflix on your new LG Smart TV, click the Netflix icon, select "Member sign in," and log in with your Netflix account information.If you have any issues with this process, you may contact by ACB Promotions to the phone # 877-333-9203, they are the ones in charge of handling this Netflix promo."This seems to be a rolling promotion with one rebate opportunity following another.  As a result, don't let the above dates scare you off.  Just fill out the forms or call the toll-free number -- or both.  I bought my 39 inch LG on September 3rd and I received the 6 month free Netflix promotion the day after I applied on line (September 13).

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Royce
Reviews.Content: Best picture I have ever seen , Sound sucks I wish it was blue tooth capable. I can interface the TV with my LG phone. (WAY COOL)

Reviews.Title: Better Than Expected
Reviews.Author: Tracy Pardue
Reviews.Content: I don't usually review products but felt the quality of this TV warranted a review.  This TV is replacing a 210 pound true flat 32" inch set.  First, this TV weighs 28 pounds. Much easier to lift into the dedicated space above the fireplace.  Picture it, fireplace with gas logs below, two foot separate the TV nook from the fireplace, so no heat issues.  The TV fits beautifully in the  39" wide nook. Amazon lists the dimensions of the box, not the actual TV. I skipped by this TV many times during my searches due to this reason.  Lesson learned, always read the manufacturer web site for actual specifications. Setup was almost like the TV was guiding my fingers from power on until done.  Super simple.  Out of the box the picture was great, sound is running through a pioneer VSX-D814 receiver and the video to sound has no lag, unlike watching some TV'S that look like a cheap kung fu movie.  The sound from the TV speakers is good when listening to pandora and muting the receiver.  I will do a sound out from the television when I get time but for now I am satisfied with the current setup. Wireless setup was simple, entered my network password and was connected to the net.  There was a software update available which installed in the background automatically while I watched television.  I highly recommend this LG TV.

Reviews.Title: Bad purchase
Reviews.Author: lonette
Reviews.Content: TV is shutting itself on and off as we speak!  It's going back to Amazon! Others have complained about this problem in their reviews.... guess I should have listened!

Reviews.Title: 47LN5700-UH (2013 Model)
Reviews.Author: vince sauseda
Reviews.Content: So i was kind of dissapointed when i figured out its not really "120 Hz", its just smoother then 60 i guess.Well i bought the tv in december 2013 and it is now april 30th well the tv was great, loved the picture it was bright looked good didnt really understand the settings,Now the smart tv thing that kinda sucked doesnt really have any good applications and all i use are amazon instant video and Netflix.Well the reason im here is because recently when watching netflix in the smart tv, it tends to blink randomly like my screen just blinks and it's awful i hate looking at it!So i dont use netflix anymore now i just use my xbox 360 or amazon instant video.So i hope this gets fixed soon cause this tv wasnt cheap.

Reviews.Title: Great Television
Reviews.Author: Crebon "Knowledge seeker"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this television from another store but, I wanted to share my experience. I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 because it didn’t come with a magic remote and Skype is an app but you have to use a LG specific camera instead of a USB. Also, there was a wifi issue.The setup was very easy. I configured the system for Wifi at first and tried to update the software but, the signal dropped out so, I connected via a LAN cable. This was no big issue for me. It might be for others. There are 3 HDMI and 3 USB ports on the left side. There is one HDMI port labeled ARC which I connected to my receiver.  This worked very well controlling the volume on my receiver without doing anything extra.I used the Hulu, Netflix, Pandora, and Youtube apps. They all work very. In fact, I disconnected my Chromecast. I connected a wireless usb mouse/keyboard combo to one of the usb ports and that worked ok. The keyboard input was a little laggy but, it was ok.  The video quality is beautiful and highly customizable for each input.  For me, Game mode seemed to have the best balance.The “Soap Opera” effect can be adjusted for each input as well. I was able to play video file from USB drive. Mp4 and MKV files played perfectly. I have don’t really use the built in speakers but, I tried them and they were ok.I did have a storm and even though it was surge protected, the television turned off and did not come back on. I opened a support claim with LG and they arrived the next day to evaluate. They came the following day with parts and replaced the two main boards. The technician advised me not to do a system update anymore because it can fry to boards. OK, I didn’t do it again but, the TV still functions that same without the update. I ordered the extended warranty just in case.Overall I’m very pleased.

Reviews.Title: In love
Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: This TV is great, big beautiful, clear.  Makes me want to watch more TV - probably not the best thing.  The only downside I can think of is that the SMART TV, which I was initially very excited about so I could watch some CBS shows over the internet on my TV (I don't have cable), is super super slow.  It just doesn't work.  So I am still stuck watching CBS shows on my tablet.  But I am going to go with laying blame on CBS for not supporting Hulu Plus and still loving this LG.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic TV
Reviews.Author: McMurphy
Reviews.Content: This smart TV is great! Everything is crystal clear! Here are a few pros and cons to possibly help you:Pros:- Smart TV integration- Easy to use- Great picture- Smart TV Apps are fast and simple- Energy Efficient- Does not emit a lot of heat- Video games look and play great- StylishCons:- Mine didn't come with the mounting screws for the base - tv connect. Customer support was less than stellar..

Reviews.Title: It's The Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: Castello "Rojo_P"
Reviews.Content: I am happy with this TV which I use in the bedroom hung high on the wall.The most outstanding characteristic of this TV is the picture quality. I calibrated it with an AVIA disk and a pair of blue glasses for movie watching, but the calibration settings listed in "Consumer Reports" actually looked a little better to my eyes. I am also pleased that I personally notice little of the motion control problem with the "TruMotion" feature turned off (I am a sports fan, and this was considered to be a slight problem for this TV). (Note that when "TruMotion" is on the TV displays a "soap opera" effect). Finally this is a smart TV with many different apps and that is a big plus (I appreciated having an app for Redbox streaming as I believe it is an up and comer and will be an outstanding service when more content is added).A few negatives. The picture is slightly compromised when not viewing straight on and the best picture is in front of the TV. If placed high you will want a tilting mount to tilt the TV down. The sound is nothing to write home about but quite acceptable. I also don't care for the remote control since the navigation arrows are poorly engineered and I constantly hit other buttons when navigating up or down.For those of you who are interested, "Consumer Reports" published calibration settings for 2 LG's in the 5700 line. I have tried one set on my 39" and it produced an excellent picture (at least a great start for tweaking).39"Picture Mode: Expert1Contrast (Picture): 90Brightness: 50Color: 56Tint: 0Sharpness: H = 5, V = 5Color Temperature: Warm2Backlight: 60Aspect Ratio: Just ScanMiscellaneous: Color Gamut = Standard, Gamma = 2.2, Black Level = Low, Real Cinema = On (All remaining settings set to OFF, or 0)50"Picture Mode: Expert1Contrast (Picture): 90Brightness: 52Color: 57Tint: R13Sharpness: H = 7, V = 8Color Temperature: Warm2Backlight: 55Aspect Ratio: Just ScanMiscellaneous: Color Gamut = Standard, Gamma = 2.2, Black Level = Low, Real Cinema = On (All remaining settings set to OFF, or 0)Overall this is a quality television and should provide many years of enjoyment.

Reviews.Title: great tv
Reviews.Author: Darlene A.
Reviews.Content: Really like this tv. Has a great picture and is easy to use. The one thing I don't like is that you can't adjust the sound to have more bass. Other wise am very impressed.

Reviews.Title: Great tv but maybe too smart fgor me.
Reviews.Author: Robert Musgrave
Reviews.Content: Excellent value , good tv needed to do manual setting on tv picture and shut off auto setting to achieve best picture for dark bedroom.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: JBF
Reviews.Content: Setup was a breeze, it has very clear picture and it's so easy to stream Netflix and Youtube videos.  The sound is good too.

Reviews.Title: Pretty Impressed.
Reviews.Author: Todd A. Stevens
Reviews.Content: I have had this unit for about 2 months now playing PS3 sports games, HD TV, and Netflix and am very impressed by the features/apps/performance and color.I dinged one star Because A) the remote that came with it is poorly designed and you always seem to press the wrong button at the worst time (could be by design to prompt you buy their magic wand thing) And B) the base seems flimsy and the sound could be better.Overall great value, may add-on sound bar later.

Reviews.Title: Wow..
Reviews.Author: Jay I.
Reviews.Content: I'm an not a videophile, nor will I ever claim to be. So, I will spare you the technical details that I researched to get this item and leave that to the great many other reviews seen here that include that information.ONTO MY UNTRAINED PERCEPTION -This thing is nuts. Having moved up from a  32'' old Sony LCD Flatscreen, I was thinking I'd get a better picture and bigger (50''), but wasn't expecting the level of clarity to be THAT intensely different.Went out and got some cool blue-rays to play on the day I got it and I couldn't be happier.Great picture, easy setup, smart-tv works great for me (but some others have had problems), aesthetically very nice and overall just an awesome purchase.My only minor knock is on the sound, it's loud enough, but can sounds garbled at high-volume. Not overly noticeable, but enough that you wouldn't want to crank it up too too much. But, like 99% of TV's on the market, if you want the audio to match the video, you'll need to invest in some audio equipment as well. Not a big knock on the TV in my opinion.Spending hundreds of dollars on a TV is never a great experience, but when you get the new one setup and give it some proper video to burn through, it's incredible how much of a difference it can make.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV for our kitchen viewing
Reviews.Author: RICHARD C BAROCCA
Reviews.Content: We are very happy with the performance of the LG 39LN5700. The picture is beautiful and the sound is fine for our set up where the TV is mounted above our china cabinet.

Reviews.Title: Good TV for the price.
Reviews.Author: Jerry Choate
Reviews.Content: I got it during the Labor Day Amazon sale. Getting $500 off this TV is awesome. It connects to network wirelessly. Does it every time. Has Netflix and Amazon prime. I connect to my Laptop via DLNA. Does a very good job at all of those.The sound is mediocre. Use a soundbar.The tv's webbrowser sucks. I can't watch streaming live feeds. I constantly get memory error messages. I don't do it often.

Reviews.Title: Nice Picture, Smart Features work great
Reviews.Author: Matthew R. Potts "mrpotts"
Reviews.Content: This is the second LG TV I have bought (my first one is 7 years old and going strong with heavy use) and I'm really pleased with LG TVs.  I should start by saying I am highly technical and really into my electronics so I set really high standards for the products I buy.Firstly, if you plan to use the smart features don't feel like you need to have the Magic Remote (which this TV does not come with).  I have an iPhone and the LG TV Remote app is AWESOME.  It has a keyboard which lets you type in web addresses directly from your phone (or entering any other kind of text when needed) which is a must if you plan on using the browser frequently.  The best thing about the app however, is the trackpad.  The app literally turns your phone into a trackpad like you'd find on a laptop to control a mouse on the TV and it works incredibly well.  Super fluid and really a joy to use.On to the Smart features...  LG did a great job in my opinion.  The Apps open quickly, seem responsive and altogether work really well.  I just bought a 65" Sony for my Den and though the interface is a little cleaner for its smart functionality, the features do not work as well as they do on this LG and it was literally over 4 times the price.  I was able to easily setup a media server on Macbook Pro using the free application Plex Media Server and I can now easily display my photos or access my music collection on the TV wirelessly.For the price of this TV, the picture is really great.  I do recommend turning down the TruMotion settings.  I have the de-judder set to 2 and it really calmed down the "soap opera" affect you will find on most the TVs being made today that are pushing 120/240HZ etc.  You can really go nuts and fine tune the picture on this TV to your hearts content.  I normally don;t like the Vivid picture setting on TVs but on this set all I did was set it to Vivid and turn down the try motion and I'm really happy with the picture.This TV looks really nice in our family room and I am really happy with it overall.  If it's anything like my previous LG, I expect to get many happy years out of this TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV and Amazon Service was Spectacular!
Reviews.Author: Guy S Haggard
Reviews.Content: This TV was a Christmas present to my college aged son and it arrived with the screen shattered in shipment. On Christmas day, I went on-line, clicked on return item, wrote a few words about the problem, and received an email within 10 minutes that Amazon would pick up the damaged TV and send us a brand new one.  Talk about hassle free!!!  UPS showed up at the door at 9:00 am the next morning to pickup the old TV.  Amazon overnighted a replacement TV that was received in perfect condition the next day.  My son was thrilled. Now compare that to if I had purchased the TV from a local big box store? Just to buy the TV would have been an all day ordeal fighting the crowds and lugging the 50" fifty pound box all over town.  Then do it again to return the damaged TV.  I would have had to lug the TV into my car.  Oops, the box won't even fit in my car.  I would have had to find a friend to help me take it back to the store, wait in a "no-customer service" line for hours, argue about who cracked the screen, then lug the new TV out to my friends car, and then lug it back into the house.  That would have been an all-day ordeal.With Amazon, I bought the TV in 5 minutes, it was delivered to my door in 2 days, I returned it to my door, and a new one delivered to my door in much shorter time than any other possible purchase option - with no hassle at all.  All my purchases will always be with Amazon in the future.  Amazon service was nothing less than SPECTACULAR!!!Oh yea, back to the TV. Great picture.  Unlike other smart TVs, this one actually has an internet browser built in so you can search the web on the TV and has hundreds of Apps.  Excellent picture.  Lots of inputs.  Excellent value for the low price.

Reviews.Title: Thank you Amazon Customer Service!
Reviews.Author: turns31
Reviews.Content: I originally got the 55" Vizio that Amazon was selling on Black Friday for $479 but when I received it I had noticed a big crack in the middle of the screen. I immediately called up Amazon and asked for a new one but they had told me they were sold out of that model. They then told me they could offer me a refund for the amount I paid but Black Friday was long over and I knew I wouldn't be able to find a comparable deal anymore. I then asked to speak to a manager and they told me to pick out another 55" with all the same features and they would price match it. So that's awesome. The manager told me to check out this model and said they'd price match even though the big $ difference. Over all an awesome customer service experience.Now to the TV. First off the box this thing comes in is huge. A good 10" longer than the box the 55 Vizio came in. It was a very tight squeeze to fit it in the back of my truck so take that into consideration. It was also packed much better than the other tv too.I do more research on products than just about anyone I know. I'm talking hours and hours. Reading hundreds of reviews from multiple sites. Do to the return ordeal I had very little time to actually research this tv. I looked at a few reviews and the features list and that was about it. So of course I was a little nervous before I turned it on. So far I've had the tv for a little over a week and I am very impressed.  Setup took less than 10 min and that includes connecting it to the wifi. It is replacing the 51" Samsung plasma I've had for the last two years.PictureVery very good picture. I've been to Best Buy, Walmart, etc and looked at all the big screens there and this one could compete with any of them. I know I'm coming from a plasma but this one is very bright. It does have the local dimming and I use that being in a poorly lit basement. The blacks are dark and the whites are bright as the contrast ratio would tell you. LG is known for their colors popping and this tv is no different. The picture settings are also pretty extensive. If you don't know what you're doing then the Picture Wizard thing can make it easy on you. I have no light bleeding issues from the edges like some others have talked about. Last Sunday I watched about 8 straight hours of football on it and was very pleased. Very bright, very smooth. It really doesn't need much of the tru motion effect as I have mine set to 2 which is below the default. I've also watched a couple blu rays and even played some PS4 games on it and still couldn't be happier. Unless you go 4K or 240hz, you're not finding a better picture on a 55" for under $1200 or so. My brother in law bought a $1000 Samsung Smart TV on black Friday and there's no difference in picture quality once the settings are adjusted properly. I actually like LG's interface better too.SoundI can't really provide much of a review on the sound because I have it hooked up to my 5.1 sound system. Right when I plugged it in I did turn up the volume just to see how loud is was and was impressed. I'm very picky about my sound but if you're not then this would be plenty for just a living room tv.AppearanceI really like the look of this tv. The bezel has a brushed black look to it around the screen. Also for being a direct lit LED it's fairly thin. I have it on the stand currently but plan to mount it real soon. Will look good either way. Very light for its size too. The screen has a slight glossy to it nothing that would prevent me from buying it. Pictures need gloss to provide more depth and a better picture for you anyway. There would be no light issues in a regularly lit living room.RemoteThis tv comes with a nice big remote. The Vizio remote was about half the size and much lighter than this one. It's not backlit but does have a nice glossy finish to parts and has all the smart buttons you'll need. No it doesn't have a keyboard on it but the tv will sync with any wireless keyboard you can find. Makes it much easier to use the smart features with one.Smart TVI haven't really used anything Smart on this tv because of my slow internet. I live out in the country so my speeds are real slow. I have looked around and watched some youtube videos and such and it was very easy to navigate. I don't have Netflix or Hulu so I can't really vouch for them.

Reviews.Title: I love my TV!
Reviews.Author: Jade Howard
Reviews.Content: This tv picture is clear and looks like its in 3D! I would recommend this product to anyone intersted in a clear picture

Reviews.Title: I have chosen wisely...
Reviews.Author: stvgrc
Reviews.Content: I shopped for months. Meticulously pouring over the technical specs (contrast, refresh, etc.). This TV has it all. Built in apps perform very well - responsive and well designed. Set up was a breeze. Menus are clear and easy to follow. Remote is simple and feels good in the hand. Just can't say enough. I mounted mine on the wall with the Cheetah Mounts APTMM2B Flat Screen TV Wall Mount Bracket for 32-65-Inch Plasma LED LCD TV. Super easy.

Reviews.Title: Exactly as described
Reviews.Author: B_Outdoors17
Reviews.Content: Very easy to install and setup  Light weight, clear picture.  Exactly as described.I bought it with the VideoSecu LED LCD TV Wall Mount and it fit perfectly.  I also bought Google Chromecast and use it instead of the SmartTV that comes with this TV.

Reviews.Title: Life is not Good!
Reviews.Author: Dane
Reviews.Content: The picture on this TV is amazing, but are a couple of issues with the performance . Like many owners of this model, I have had problems with my unit shutting off and on. I've already had it repaired once, by a LG tech. I'm not sure he really repaired it, only patched it until the warranty runs out. Do not be fooled by the picture, the quality is not there and LG knows it. LG should have recalled these long ago. I will never buy another LG product.

Reviews.Title: Mine crapped out, but I will review it's performance
Reviews.Author: elvin
Reviews.Content: Mine crapped out.  It's not a widespread issue so I won't discount any points on that.  Anyways..Pros:- Great picture- Lots of features- smart tv apps are good- lots of needed inputs.  3 HDMI, USB x 3, etc- Quality feelCons:- Soap opera effect on movies.  TERRIBLE.  Even when disabling true motion it was there.  Only way to somewhat negate it was to turn on "game mode".- Input lag is terrible.  Over 70ms from tests I've read/seen.  I game a lot so that is noticeable.  Will affect performance on games.  The 70ms is with game mode on.- bit laggy on UI sometimes- the controller is bad.  Button lay out is one of worst Ive used.Yes, so it was a decent tv as far as picture.  It is bad though when you take things into account.  What good is 120hz when you get soap opera effect on everything?  It's what it sounds like.. If you seen an american soap opera, you can see that it does not have that movie film quality to it.  This is what it does.  It is bad for competitive gaming.  Games will look good, but the input lag is too high.  I can't recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Good features, and good price. Bad lighting.
Reviews.Author: G. Messick
Reviews.Content: The colors on this tv look good, and it has a number of great features, although the blacks aren't impressive.  My biggest complaint is the lighting.  It does not look like a direct led lit tv; have noticed some inconsistent lighting, and I have a bright spot about 4-5" large in the upper right.  I highly recommend turning down or off the TruMotion for most viewing and go through the setup to set the colors and brightness/contrast.  Without setting the colors, it looked ok, but after setting it to the room, the colors are much better.  The wifi has good range and speed, the smart tv apps seem great, I just wish the lighting was better.  I can not really comment on the sound, as I have it connected to a surround sound system.With all the things this tv has going for it, I wanted to love it, but now I just regret not returning it.

Reviews.Title: Greaaaat TV out of the box!!
Reviews.Author: Sam Juan Gandy "Hero King"
Reviews.Content: Before this tv I never had a flat screen or even big HD tv. So i looked around and almost bought a Samsung, but they were out of the model I wanted. (I was ready to go big and get in on the Smart Tv Revolution.) So I  was checking out sound bars when the salesman got distracted and I saw this LG on sale.  I checked out the sound on it and it was hands down better than anything I had heard in the store.  And I really did not want to buy a soundbar after spending hundreds of $ on a TV! So after checking reviews I went back that night and took it home and set it up.  Now I can get around on a computer but am no pro, that's why I married a software engineer. Even with the wizard out of town, in minutes this tv was hooked up to wifi and I was in business.  Picture was great out of the box, as they have a Store Pic or Home pic option. Since then I have been watching YouTube videos and Netflix and movies on the tv and am beyond pleased.  It did crash  (froze) once while i watched a bit of the comedy channel on the web, on the TV.  But I had been flailing back and forth with the remote and its understandable. When my HD reciever and dish comes, I will not be watching  CC.com  on the TV.  Also you get free Pandora and I love that free feature.  The sound on that is fantastic, and I can hardly turn it up past ten--out of 100.  I would give this 5 stars and it deserves it but don't know why the TV froze that one time.  Back to Netflix: it hooked right into our account and loads movies in seconds. Also, watched about 25 YouTube videos in a row last night, loaded them super fast.  You can do internet searches via Bing and you probably want a wireless keyboard for that; I will buy one soon (logitech). I would like to use Google but not an issue at this point.  Most of the games that come with the TV are not free but not an issue since we have PS2 and a Wii...  Also, I was not happy i had to set up a stand on it but that only took a couple minutes.  A monkey could do it, or my dog. Also, I would like to say I have an LG refrigerator and it has horrible sound and poor picture but keeps food really cold.  Lastly-- looking forward to joining Hulu Plus and/or Amazon Instant, those will be very nice features to go with this great TV! Thanks LG!  **** warning: your viewing habits may or not be sent back to LG HQ!  If that bothers you, do your research. My computer already knows more about me than my wife, so what do I care what the TV knows? I'm just some dude watching football and Game of Thrones...

Reviews.Title: Love LG
Reviews.Author: Briggs
Reviews.Content: I've had this for around 6 months now and it's perfect. Zero issues and looks fantastic. The sound is good for what it is. I never thought I would use the smart TV feature until I tapped the icon that transfers video from my iPad to the TV. With zero setup there it was on my big screen. It also plays any video format I have put onto USB so far. We have many LG TV's in the family all with zero issues and that's why we keep buying them.

Reviews.Title: Pure Excellence at a Great Price
Reviews.Author: D MART
Reviews.Content: This TV is excellent. I ordered a VIZIO last week and it stopped working after only 3 hours. Vizio was a complete joke. I sent it back and was lucky to find a great deal on this TV. Its amazing and one of the best purchases I ever made. Amazon customer service was great of course as always. The TV boasts great color, brightness, and great shades of black. The Smart TV apps are lightning quick. I have another Smart TV and its slow. The processor in this TV is very quick. Overall Im very satisfied and to the people complaing about how crappy it is... go cry somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: LG 47 inch smart Tv
Reviews.Author: B. Hochstein
Reviews.Content: Great TV - delivered quickly and on time - and perhaps bet of all - LG customer service is excellent - three times I had some questions and three times they answered quickly - in fact they even sent me an email to confirm that I had the correct information -

Reviews.Title: Satisfied
Reviews.Author: GrrPrr
Reviews.Content: I considered upgrading my15 year old Sony 36inch behemoth television a year ago just before Black Friday.. Saw a great deal on a 60inch Vizio but could not pull the trigger. Slight remorse, but then there wasn't anything really wrong with my Sony. So I went on with life. Every so often I would poke around Amazon to see what was selling. After getting a slightly higher bonus check than I had expected I decided time to treat myself. I was actually surprised how quickly I chose this TV. I felt the price was right for the size tv compared to the other offerings. The reviews (both consumer and professional) seemed to indicate a quality product.The television arrived in two days (a little disappointed that FedEx just left it on my front porch) and I had it set up in less than hour. I did have trouble connecting my cable box to the set via coaxial. Thankfully I had some RCA cables. I did order an HDMI cable- definitely order one if you don't have one. It makes a huge difference. Though you apparently lose the ability to view the signal via the app when using the HDMI. I had the TV connected to my wifi in seconds. Another couple of minutes to register this TV with Amazon Instant Video and Pandora. I was off and running.Picture is fantastic. Especially after I tweaked it using the expert wizard. Sound is okay. Like others have said it is a little tinny. I figure to get some speakers since I am getting used to streaming music through the tv. I watched football all day long on Saturday with my blinds open on my big picture window. Not a hint of glare.I did have one issue. There was some type of pixel problem that created a single red vertical line across the screen. Called LG and someone was out within the week to replace the internal panel. I was very happy with the service.I also bought the magic remote but returned it. I did not like the feel and preferred using my cable remote to access the channel guide. For the smart services I use the LG app to maneuver the mouse and I get a virtual keyboard.I am very happy with my decision. Life is good.

Reviews.Title: Very Good Purchase for Home Office
Reviews.Author: Ronald Maniglia
Reviews.Content: The definition and clarity of the picture is superb with few needed customized adjustments. Some of the web features such as the browser are cumbersome to navigate using the provided remote but function as advertised. After connecting the TV by a CAT5 cable to my router, the configuration was seamless and automatic. With the speakers facing straight down from the base, the sound quality is better than expected and sufficiently loud. Since I am using the TV in my home office, I connected the Display Port output from my computer NVIDIA graphic card to one of the HDMI ports on the TV so that the TV serves as second monitor. The lack of a VGA port on the TV caused an initial problem in finding a cable to connect the graphics card.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV with great features
Reviews.Author: PT
Reviews.Content: I have been watching this TV for a while now and yesterday, I finally pulled the trigger on it from a local store because I had a 10% coupon. Originally, I wanted the 50" but decided on the 55" and I am so glad I did. The picture quality is amazing on this TV. I was coming from a 4 year old 47" LCD which went into our game room. The setup on this TV was fast and friendly and it connected to my WiFi without issues. Plenty of built-in apps and dozens more to download. with 3 HDMI inputs, it is plenty for me since I use my receiver to switch between Blu-Ray player, PS3, Wii and my cable box so only 1 HDMI is going into the TV. If you use a receiver for your audio, keep in mind that the built-in apps along with Netflix, Amazon VoD, Hulu, etc. will play through the TV speaker unless you get a optical audio cable and run it from the back of the TV to your receiver. The TV has the optical audio out jack.It also sees my desktop PC with all my movies, pictures and music. I was able to play all my movies which are in MKV, MPG and AVI formats without issue, streaming from my desktop via WiFi on the TV. I also plugged in a 1TB USB external drive with movies on it and it detected it and played all the content without issues.Make sure you download the LG TV Remote App for your Apple/Android device and use that instead of the TV remote. I don't particularly care for the remote that comes with the TV. Save your money and don't buy the magic remote. Just download the free app for your phone/tablet and use that.Also make sure you use the Picture Wizard from the menus to fine tune your settings. It helps alot on getting the best image for your TV.All in all, a great set and a great picture. Very happy with my purchase. TV has a very thin bezel around it and is light weight. I was able to pick it up by myself while I was setting it up. I originally wanted a plasma but unless you have a dark room, plasma TV's reflect alot of light because the screen is actual glass. This TV has a matte finish and there is no noticeable reflection on the screen, even when we have the blinds open in our family room where the TV is located. Plasma TV's are for a man cave/basement/media room where you have control over ambient light. LCD/LED TV's work best in bright rooms.

Reviews.Title: Great Tv - Beware of Fed X Shipper
Reviews.Author: E. F. Simons
Reviews.Content: I bought this  LG TV because I already have another and it is terrificOnly problem is with  Amazon using Fed X .. in this area they are unacceptable. Delivery by  Fed X is totally unreliable  in my  mountain community ..

Reviews.Title: Best Picture and Sound I've Ever Had....
Reviews.Author: Ron
Reviews.Content: This T.V. Rocks! My best friend has a Vizio smart tv with wifi but for him Netflix hangs up . Not all the time mind you but enough that I've noticed going to his house. So far this t.v. streams everything without a hiccup .ProsPricePictureSound (not tinny but very nice)StreamingEase of UseConsTook a while to get the best picture out of it but man does it rock nowRemote works but looks and feels cheap compared to my old one (Samsung)Doesn't take the dog out or make me bacon... mhmmmm....bacon....

Reviews.Title: Perfect Family TV
Reviews.Author: Tressa
Reviews.Content: I am a technological junkie my husband not so much and he even loves the TV. Everything in one and no need to switch between Wii and TV to watch Netflix, Hulu, etc. Picture is excellent. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: excellent...great buy
Reviews.Author: Douglas Marshall
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a second LED 1080p smart TV...I have a 55" LG and love it so I went with this one for the bedroom. Great buy...very pleased so far. Picture quality, sound and features are all excellent. Very simple, quick and easy set up..lots of features.

Reviews.Title: Amazing picture.
Reviews.Author: bak
Reviews.Content: Just purchased the LG 55LN5700 to replace a 13 year old 55 inch Mitsubishi Projection TV that finally died and absolutely love it.  Watched The Avengers through Netflix which utilizes the full 120hz and it was like I was in the movie, the picture was so clear. No motion blur at all. Sound is not the greatest directly from the tv but I have a surround sound system so not a huge issue for me.  Price was great. So far this is definitely a keeper for me.

Reviews.Title: Great price for a great TV/monitor.
Reviews.Author: Stephen Loving
Reviews.Content: I've always been 'loyal' to Samsung, and never owned a LG, but this 39" is almost $100 cheaper than Samsung's 40". So far, I'm impressed. The picture looks wonderful (to my admittedly untrained eyes; i'm not a videophile).What I like:-It's very slim and aesthetically pleasing-It's clear that LG put a lot of work and thought into the Smart TV aspect. The interface is great, but i'm entrenched in my Apple TV so I plan to ignore this feature.-A guided setup which I love, and makes it easy to make the picture look good without tweaking.-3 HDMI inputs. This is a necessity for me (PC, Apple TV, 360). For some reason, a lot of TVs come with only two HDMI inputs.A few minor issues:-Sound from the speakers is not that great. This is a fundamental conceit for slim TV's. It's good enough, though. The speakers fire directly downwards (apparently), and I have my TV hanging on a wall with nothing underneath it. If you have it inside a cabinet, the sound may be better, I dunno.-The 'True Motion' setting is on by default. It makes everything look like a daytime soap opera. I recommend turning it off. This isn't a con at all, because the setting can be easily disabled.Overall, I'm very happy and impressed by this TV. If you're looking for a TV around 39/40" for under $500, this should be your first choice.

Reviews.Title: Best 42-inch 120Hz 1080p LED-LCD for the price
Reviews.Author: PC
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a 40-42" LCD TV with a $500-750 budget. After doing a few weeks of research and examining many models closely I landed on this one as the best option in this price range.My most important consideration by far was picture, especially color and viewing angle. The 42LN5700 delivers on both, especially with Dynamic Color (DC) turned off. DC is on by default, and my initial reason for turning it off was that I saw blown-out red/orange colors on faces sometimes. Disabling DC fixed the face problem--it made other colors seem faded at first, but after a few minutes I could tell that they were actually more lifelike now, and DC had been adding too much saturation. (Your personal preference may vary though.)Regarding viewing angle, I regularly watch this set from a secondary kitchen location that is well beyond 45 degrees off center, and the picture still looks great. In my experience other sets tend to become greenish-gray much more quickly when viewed off-center.The only picture flaw with this set is that there are slight, very small dark patches in the far corners. I saw five examples of this model and they all exhibited this flaw, but I bought it anyway. No other 120Hz 1080p model at this size and price had perfect corners AND comparable picture quality otherwise. The issue is so minor that it does not bother me even though I am someone who is easily bothered by small things. It is only really noticeable on a pure white screen. Again though, your preference may vary so if the corners bother you then you may want to go with another model that may not have as good a viewing angle, or spend in a higher tier.I don't have particular demands when it comes to Smart/App features so I can't offer worthwhile comments on those. The only other flaw I can think of is that assembling the base stand requires a very long Phillips-head screwdriver to perform comfortably, so make sure you have one handy if you plan on using the base.

Reviews.Title: Great HDMI TV
Reviews.Author: Casper
Reviews.Content: Has a great picture and sound. Use is for Master Bedroom and have not found a need for surround sound to be added. I would recommend this LG model to friends and family. If I can find room in the Motorhome I will be ordering one for it also.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Amazon Costumer Service! Almost perfect T.V
Reviews.Author: Draven Romero
Reviews.Content: Amazon Customer ServiceI first ordered this LG T.V a couple months ago when it was priced at $599.99. I ordered it with Amazon Prime 2 day shipping. During the shipping process, the LG T.V. was delayed 2-3 times on it's way to my house. Then when it finally arrived it my city, UPS marked it as delayed and just left it that way. I was very patient because I knew that it must be difficult delivering packages in terribly snowy weather. After 2 weeks, I couldn't be patient anymore. My packaged was still delayed in my city and I wasn't hearing anything. I called Amazon Costumer Service. They worked with me and they called UPS on my behalf to find out what was going on. It turned out that they have somehow managed to lose the 47'' T.V.This was stressful. It was my first flat screen T.V. purchase and it was going horribly. I spent a lot of money for the T.V. and I didn't have the money for another one. The Amazon Customer Service representative understood this and she had another T.V. sent to me at no extra cost. It shipped out immediately with 1 day shipping from FedEx. I received the newly shipped T.V. with no problems at all.  Amazon Customer Service gets a 6/5 rating from me. I've been an Amazon customer for a couple years now and they went out of their way to make sure that I didn't lose out on a purchase. It wasn't their fault that the T.V. was lost in shipping, but they made up for it anyways. I have never received that level of generous Costumer Service from any other company. I hardly review products unless they are really good or really bad. In this case, I just had to tell people about the amazing Costumer Service that Amazon had given me.LG Electronics 47LN5700 47-Inch 1080p 120Hz LED-LCD HDTV with Smart TV (2013 model)Now, for the review of the product. I would give it a 4/5. It is an almost perfect Smart T.V. I have ordered it for my bedroom. It is my very first HD LED-LCD Smart T.V. I have been used to large SD TVs for my whole life, until now. I was just excited to be able to finally experience the new T.Vs.PROS- Price- Energy Efficient- Amazing picture- Great Sound- Convenient Entertainment Smart Apps- Built in Wi-Fi Connectivity- USB support for videos, music, pictures, etc.- LG CloudFirst off, the price was amazing. $599.99 for a 47-inch HD Smart TV was a deal breaker for me. I compared the specs to other T.Vs on Amazon and this had the most value for the price. Speaking of saving money, this T.V is also energy efficient. According to an Energy Guide that it came with, the Estimated Yearly Energy Cost is $10. This is based on an estimated 5 hours of use per day, 11 cents per kWh, and 95 kWH total energy use per year. I have an HD Smart TV now and I don't want to go back to the SD quality TV. The quality of HD videos, shows, and movies is just too great for me to ever consider going back to SD T.Vs. I have never seen such detail and vivid colors like this before. I noticed that some reviewers had some concerns on the sound quality of the T.V, but as far as I can tell, the sound that it offers is pretty good. It may have a volume difference, depending on the source of the media, but that really wasn't a problem for me.I'm not big on the many Smart Apps that the LG store offers, but for my entertainment needs, the ones that it came with are all that I need. I don't have cable. I only have my Netflix, Hulu, and Amazon Prime subscriptions because cable costs too much money. These entertainment apps work great on the T.V. I have no problems with them and they all stream in HD. The built in Wi-Fi connectivity is great too. I'm glad that I don't have to buy an adapter for it, so it saves me the trouble. My Wi-Fi router is in the downstairs flat underneath me (2 family flat and I live upstairs).  As far as I can tell, I haven't had any connectivity problems. You can also have the T.V to connect to your own server on your network and have it stream media files. It adds to the convenience.I love the USB support too. I wasn't aware of what it could do when I was making the purchase, but it impressed me. You can put your movies, shows, music, pictures, etc. on a flash drive and plug it in to the side of the T.V. Then you can access them at the LG Smart Share menu. I have tons of digital movies and shows. So far, I have tried several file formats. Those formats are .mkv, .avi, and .mp4. I haven't had a problem with any one of them. The LG Cloud is pretty neat too. They give you 5GB (I think) of digital storage. Then you can access your cloud files from the Smart T.V. I have uploaded my music to LG Cloud and I use the T.V to play it. Now I don't have to buy a speaker system for my phone. I could just use the T.V.NEUTRAL- Video lag from USB supportI would say that the video lag from the USB support is the only neutral aspect of the T.V. The reason why I consider it neutral is because I know how fix it when it happens. Sometimes, when a movie from the flash drive is paused for awhile and then played, the video would lag terribly. It would be out of sync with the sound and skipping. The fix is pretty easy. All I do is press the "back" button on the remote to exit out of the movie. Then I would just click the "OK" button on the movie file again. It would ask me if I want to "start playback from the beginning" or "continue where I left off". I would continue where I left off and then it would start back up and the lag would be gone. I have noticed that the lagging hasn't happened to me at all in a while, however.CONS- Remote buttons can stick- Delay in response time between remote and T.V- Menu can take a bit to getting used toThese are some really minor set backs from the T.V. The remote buttons do stick a little bit. Sometimes when I press buttons on it, they would get stuck when they are unpressed. There can be a 1-2 second delay in the response time between the remote and the T.V. I would just press a button and I'd have to wait a bit until I see a response from the T.V. The menu can also take a little bit to getting used to at first. When I first set the T.V up, the first thing I did was try to familiarize myself with the menus. It can look jumbled up and confusing at first. However, I got used to it after a little while.CONCLUSIONSo overall, I would give this LED-LCD HD Smart TV a 4/5. It is almost perfect. It has very few minor set backs, but it shouldn't stop you from purchasing it. I would definitely recommend purchasing a T.V from the Amazon website. They will give you great customer service if you ever run into problems with your order. I would definitely recommend getting an HD Smart T.V.  The quality of High Definition just destroys Standard Definition. The Smart features really revolutionizes the entertainment quality of the T.V. I would definitely recommend the purchase of this LG Electronics 47LN5700 47-Inch 1080p 120Hz LED-LCD HDTV with Smart TV (2013 edition). It will not disappoint you. This is a high quality T.V and it has me hooked. It is a great first HD Smart T.V. I will love all of the T.Vs that today has to offer if it's anything like this T.V.

Reviews.Title: Husband bought it, I love it- Perfect for mounting on the wall- very sleek
Reviews.Author: CarolinaMom
Reviews.Content: We recently moved into a new house where the TV is mounted above the fireplace.  Had to have a new one, so I gave this task to my husband.  He picked this TV and we are both very, very happy with it.  The picture is stunning in HD- and I like the fact that you can see it from most any angle.  The colors are bright and vivid- and it dims at night so it's not too bright given the ambient lighting.  Sound quality is fine- we'll end up hooking it up to our sound system anyway.  The "smart" features are very easy to use- we have NetFlix and Amazon and watch both via this TV.  Cannot say enough- don't look any further- this is your new TV.

Reviews.Title: Worked for 1 week.
Reviews.Author: Batman13
Reviews.Content: This TV worked for 1 week and then started to recycle off/on over and over again. Called LG and they had me contact a local repair shop. After a week and a half (they ordered parts) a service man came to my house and replaced the power supply and mother board. Brand new TV and has been already repaired. Good quality control LG....NOT!

Reviews.Title: Compo LG vs Samsung
Reviews.Author: Tim
Reviews.Content: I was replacing an older LG 37in LCD and initially purchased a Samsung 40in LED UN40EH5300 and was somewhat disappointed due to glare from sunlight/ambient light and sound quality. I went back to the "big box" and looked at a number of sets and decided to try the LG. I found that all LED's are a little "glossier" than what I was used to with the old LCD. Neither of the LED's were appreciably better in this regard and both sets have a downward firing speakers which affects sound quality.I decided to keep the LG for several reasons. The LG has a built in picture calibration utility which makes video setup a snap. Both the Samsung and the LG have a User Guide that is preloaded with the set software and also available as a pdf on the 'net. The Samsung is a single font and runs to 600+ pages printed. The LG is multi-font and runs about 250 pages...much easier to read. I preferred the LG Manual and also the LG on-screen settings menu and overlays. The remotes are nearly identical although the Samsung has backlighting. For on-set controls, the LG has standard on/off channel up/down volume up/down buttons on the right side whereas the Sumsung has a little "joystick" on the bottom.One thing I did like about the Samsung, it has two HDMI inputs on the back and one on the side. The LG has all 4 HDMI inputs on the side, which is kind of awkward. Both sets have component in and RF(cable) input on the back. The LG also has the remote sensor bottom/center on the front of the set so you may have issues with the center speaker, if you have a home theater setup. Both sets have optical audio out on the back. The LG has ARC. Setup on both sets was easy, including WiFi.Several people in these reviews have asked about Amazon streaming video. My LG set did a software update and it is available and I was able to register both sets with Amazon although I haven't had a chance to watch any video. Both sets have USB ports on the side and I found the the Logistech K400 keyboard/mousepad is plug and play on both sets.Note that these sets are dissimilar in the the LG is 120 hz and has a slightly larger screen. I was shopping to fit existing furniture so I needed a set 38 inches wide or less. The LG is about 25% more expensive. Physical size was more important to me than price.

Reviews.Title: Many Complaints of Defective TVs
Reviews.Author: Karen Long
Reviews.Content: After a month or so, this TV began randomly shutting off and turning back on.  After conducting a web search, I was surprised to see how common this issue is with LG TVs.  I am now in the process of dealing with customer service on getting it repaired.  For a purchase price of almost 700 bucks, I do not need this headache!Aside from that issue, I love the picture quality and features of the TV.UPDATE: The service company came out and changed the power supply free of charge.  So far, I have not had a recurrence of the issue.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice
Reviews.Author: JanePal
Reviews.Content: This is my first flat screen TV and I'm enjoying it.  The picture is good as is the sound. I chose this particular set beause the wifi is already installed.  I've gotten rid of my cable tv service and enjoy watching Netflix and Amazon. (and there are many more sites included)  I can watch the shows I want, when I want to watch them, and no commercials.  Right now I'm watching The Good Wife.  It's 43 minutes in length from beginning scene to last credits.  On tv that's called an "hour".  They can keep their 18 minutes of commercials.

Reviews.Title: What a TV
Reviews.Author: J. Montgomery
Reviews.Content: Like others have said, this TV is a beauty. It is well worth the cost, but beware, it is so nice that it will suck you in and make you watch TV for hours on end.

Reviews.Title: Great TV with a couple of missed features
Reviews.Author: Dr. Jay
Reviews.Content: Since receiving this TV, we are very pleased with the quality of the sound and picture.  And it is more responsive to channel changes than other digital TVs we have owned.A very useful feature is the LG remote app.  Being able to use a smartphone as a touchpad, rather than scrolling with the remote, is a great feature.We have found only two things which kept us from giving it a five star rating.  Most important, the Smart TV menu does not include Amazon Instant Video.  We have to stream it through a PC.And the audio output is either internal OR external.  On other TV you can have both and just mute the internal.We are hoping LG will modify the firmware to address these two issues.  Otherwise it is a great TV and we would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: Best money ever spent
Reviews.Author: Anthony Sorensen
Reviews.Content: This LG led is by the far the best TV for your money. Picture quality and sounds are awesome. not sure why ever complains about the sound. I have the sound barley up and its loud. Picture is amazing. black levels are really black and same goes for white levels. (with picture tuning in the settings first). the smart tv feature is nice. i didn't care for buying a TV with it but its an additional option that's fun.
