It did come with a free year of MLB premium streaming which is great. You cant go wrong with this TV

Reviews.Title: Smart TV IS NOT SMART!!!!
Reviews.Author: Sandra E. Nardo "REDHAT MAMA"
Reviews.Content: We purchased our Smart TV for Christmas. Well, it is defective! Yup,it is a STUPID TV. Why?  Because it can not remember our password for our WIFI! Each time we try to use the Smart feature, we have to re-enter our password. Very annoying and a pain in the neck.  So LG wants to repair our brand new TV. Supposedly a "Memory Board" might not be working,per Best Buy's call to LG.  So,LG does not stand behind their products.

Reviews.Title: Awesome value!
Reviews.Author: Meng Qi
Reviews.Content: This TV is a perfect fit for me.  I don't care about 3D, Smart TV, super-thin bezels, Magic Remote, voice control, or sound quality.  I have it hooked to a receiver, which takes input from a HTPC and a PS3.I tried 50LN5400 and I can tell you that LN5400/5700 are two very different TVs.  LN5400's CPU and GPU is from 2011/2012, and the software is pretty bad.  It has problems rendering the sharpness of fonts.  Texts look either blurry or oversharpened.  LN5700 has this year's CPU and GPU, and texts look crisp and beautiful just like on a monitor.  Also, the backlights of NL5400 are poorly placed.  There are dark patches on the screen.  The 5700 has almost perfect screen uniformity.  On an all-white screen you would notice some faint dark patches, otherwise you would notice nothing at all.  I suspect that 5400 is a TV from previous years rebranded as a 2013 model.Now about the 5700:Since the TV is direct-lit, panel uniformity is nearly perfect and there are no backlight bleeding which is a common problem for edge-lit TVs.  There were a few "dead pixels" and I was worried - they turned out to be dust particles.  I wiped them off and the TV has no dead pixel at all.Color saturation is great since the TV uses an IPS panel.  This is important for games and animes; they often look dull and grey-ish on other panels at this price point.I tried the magic remote at a store on a LA6900 and absolutely hated it.  Fortunately LN5700 has a regular remote, and it is easy to use.It is quick and simple to adjust picture settings.  I have it on game mode and turn off all artificial processing settings.  In the night I turn the backlight down from 45 to 27 or 30.However IPS panel does have poor blacks.  I guess I will have to put up with it until OLED becomes affordable.  Until then, this will be my last LCD/LED TV.Smart TV is useless but I do like the wifi capability.  You can update the firmware.  Occasionally firmware updates can bring massive performance increase.  I had a Panasonic DT50.  Colors were very inaccurate and ugly, but one firmware update fixed it.The assembly process can be frustrating, as some screws are to go deep inside sockets.  You need a thin screwdriver to be able to drive the screws.

Reviews.Title: Potentially a great TV
Reviews.Author: G. P. Stern
Reviews.Content: I purchased the LG 47L5700 locally to replace a several year old Sharp 46" LCD whose diffuser started delaminating.  Once hooked up, the first thing I noticed about the LG was: Wow!  That's an amazing picture!  Comparing the same HD content, the LG was in a whole different league as my old Sharp, even though both are 1080p screens.  The screen is glossier than I would like but this appears to be the trend with new LCDs (the Sharp was a very matte display).  The LG's smart functions seemed like a handy addition and the built-in WiDi (allowing one to display a WiDi enabled computer on the TV) was a nice bonus.  Unfortunately, after using the LG for a couple of weeks, I decided to return it.  There was nothing defective about it but for me, there were some issues that no setting on the TV could eliminate.Issue #1:  Very light / white areas are blown out and therefore detail in them is lost.  No amount of fiddling with backlight, brightness, or contrast settings would produce an image with acceptable light area detail AND acceptable brightness / vibrancy in the rest of the image.Issue #2:  Fast moving images on the screen produce a "banding" effect.  My assumption was that, this being a 120Hz screen, the fast motion blurring seen on my old Sharp would be absent here.  It is, but instead you get this odd artifacting that is by far and away less natural than blurring.  No amount of fiddling with the TV's TruMotion settings would eliminate this.  Setting TruMotion to low or off produced images akin to a 60Hz TV but did not eliminate the banding; higher TruMotion settings made images smoother, but made no difference with banding.  And of course, once you see it, you cannot ignore it.Issue #3:  This could very well be a common issue with edge-lit screens but I found that the backlight was uneven and there was light bleed at the very bottom of the screen.  The light bleed is noticeable on dark images and can be minimized by turning down the backlight, but then you start to run into part of the problem in Issue #1.Issue #4:  This may be a defect or within the normal range of things but the left side of the screen was slightly redder than the right (or perhaps the right side was bluer).Issue #5: The TV has a built in function called Picture Wizard that will walk you through a basic calibration.  I have found that when adjusted so that the sample image looks good, actual broadcast images will either be too dark or oversaturated.  Part of the problem is the sample image LG uses in the wizard; it looks like a picture of a classical painting of a man and woman.  There isn't enough area of red, green, and blue to be able to accurately adjust and by the picture's nature, doesn't represent a real world scenario.  A picture of people with different skin tones in a grassy area with plenty of blue sky would make adjustments much easier.I did not get the opportunity to use any of the TV's streaming apps but there are plenty to choose from.  I did try out the WiDi and it worked, but the TV creates it's own pointer which is overlayed on top of the one generated by the computer.  The computer's WiDi settings allow you to shut off the computer pointer which allows you to just use the TV's, but then you lose the context changes (i.e. the pointer turns into a hand when placed over a web link).Ultimately, as a TV, I have too many issues with this LG and returned it. It's quite possible that someone who mostly watches DVD or Blu-Ray would not run into most of these problems.  I wound up purchasing a Vizio E470-A0, also 47" but a 60Hz model without Wifi, smart functions, or WiDi.  A much better viewing experience.

Reviews.Title: wonderful TV
Reviews.Author: hossman01
Reviews.Content: An outstanding TV for the price. Hooking it up was very easy just plug in and follow the guide was complete in about ten minutes.The only down side is anything worth watching in the apps section is a must pay ie Netflix, Hula Plus ect. I bought a VGA to HD converter so we watch movies from my laptop thru the TV.

Reviews.Title: Too bad
Reviews.Author: sam williamson
Reviews.Content: This TV has a great picture, but the sound quality and the remote are horrible. No matter what sound sound settings I  use nothing seems to work . I won't  even go into how terrible the remote is, and refuse to pay $100 for the better one. Can you say highway robbery? The last LG product I will ever buy.

Reviews.Title: More then I expected
Reviews.Author: Kate Delzeit
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised and love the possibilities.  The apps are great, connectivity is awesome, easy to set up.  MAKE SURE you obey the instructions on unpacking the TV!!!!  I cannot stress this enough.  I lifted it incorrectly and now have a permanent cloud/shadow in my screen.

Reviews.Title: Worst Customer Service for broken TV
Reviews.Author: Heather Jackson
Reviews.Content: The TV has begun to glitch, it turns itself on and off constantly and I cannot find a fix. I understand TVs have problems but the low rating here is due to the customer service of LG. I have contacted them 4 times over the course of a week to resolve the issue (it's under warranty) and they have failed to be helpful. They refer me to servicers who will not handle the problem, to a locator team that will not contact me, and their motto seems to be "give us 48 hours to contact you" after which they do not contact you.

Reviews.Title: Solid Performer
Reviews.Author: Karen L. Prentice
Reviews.Content: This TV is a nice compromise between uber-large and smaller screens.  It offers nearly infinite adjustment to meet any preference and has an over-whelming array of features.  The remote is sufficient, but clumsy at times ~ but then, LG offers a web-oriented remote as an add-on feature.Some of the features that weren't highlighted in reviews that I found helpful is the antenna strength indicator in the OTA channels and options to decrease (or increase) the streaming size while watching internet sources.  (This can help with streaming issues as well as total download size if your connection is metered.)  I have not noted a decrease (apparent) in visual quality by lowering the stream size.  Very nice.There are plenty of various/redundant connections that will eliminate cable-switching.  I am very pleased with this tv.

Reviews.Title: What good is a Smart TV without Good Entertainment Apps
Reviews.Author: MikeinMN
Reviews.Content: I was going to buy a dumb TV and connect it to a Roku box, because I didn't want to rely on a TV manufacturer to keep up-to-date on the latest and greatest entertainment apps.  But at the end of the day, my desire to have fewer cords and fewer devices won out, so I bought this LG Smart TV.  The picture is fine, the backlight isn't uniform, but I'm sure I'd get used to it.  But what's got me about ready to pack it up and ship it back is the lack of an HBO GO app, and a comment on LG's user forum that they don't have an ETA for that app.  In my opinion, there is no excuse for a major TV brand to not have an app for the #1 premium cable channel.

Reviews.Title: Nice experience with smart tv and big screen.
Reviews.Author: sandeep koduru
Reviews.Content: Nice to watch with smart tv in big screen.all the apps are working perfectly.apps does not freeze.swithching between tv and apps is nice easy way

Reviews.Title: LG 55" TV was an awesome choice a great tv so far
Reviews.Author: Scott Hebert
Reviews.Content: Great TV love it so far it is an awesome choice hopefully will last a long time. Quality & clarity is top notch

Reviews.Title: great tv exprerience.
Reviews.Author: leeway
Reviews.Content: This was my second LG, first was just a little smaller, and not as smart!!  But still works fine. We enjoy all the smart stuff, especially the amazon prime.

Reviews.Title: One TV To Rule Them All!
Reviews.Author: Ghost Dance "Unfiltered"
Reviews.Content: I was a bit skeptical when reading the reviews as I know some reviews are paid posts and I am always on alert for fraudulent reviews and exposés. Nevertheless the picture on this set blew me away! I have never seen anything this detailed in my life (with exception to a 4k resolution tv) and it has changed our family's viewing experience.Even older movies and tv shows with standard resolution look phenomenal! We watched some old black & white "Twilight Zone" episodes on a local channel and it looked as if it was in 3D. The definition in remarkable. LED is without a doubt the way to go.The only "CONS" I have with the audio, for as much as LG claims to have optimized audio and different equalized settings, as an audiophile they all lacked through the tv speakers. We also own Vizio and Yamaha soundbars which I would recommend to anyone with these new TVs. Having tested a few and been around many others I can tell you it is difficult to get great sound from any TV. Even a cheap sound bar is better than most in stock televisions.The Smart Apps are fantastic, although a little slim. LG should open up more to google play and allow more Android based apps to work, however they do at least have the main video apps such as Amazon Prime Instant Video, Netflix, Hulu, Crackle, and Redbox amongst others. The Youtube app is handy as well for viewing todays crazy videos or (to inform some of you) some movies that the copyright license has ran out and does not apply from the 40s and 50s can be found there to view for free as well as some monthly freebies uploaded by various movie companies. Typically the same that are on Crackle.It goes without saying the more tech savvy you are, the more you will get out of this TV. But, the best thing is it is easy to learn thanks to a simply designed remote. The elderly and people who do not easily get technology should have no issue with this TV. Great job LG! Just fantastic!

Reviews.Title: Absolutely love this TV
Reviews.Author: Alexa
Reviews.Content: Everything about it amazing, internet connection is solid, all the apps are super fast.Picture detail & clarity is beautiful.This is our 3rd TV, originally it was between this and a Sony but we decided to go with LG.

Reviews.Title: Loud and clear!
Reviews.Author: Julie j Mayhew
Reviews.Content: I returned a lemon Samsung and hated its sound (it was always as loud as it could go and never loud enough- I felt 80) and crummy software upgrades. Samsung also had the lamest service and return policies. I'll never purchase another Samsung piece of junk again.I bought this LG and I LOVE it! It's loud and clear, easy to use the apps and I couldn't be happier! The volume never needs to be louder than 30 (out of 100) and I haven't had a single issue so far.

Reviews.Title: Watching it right now!
Reviews.Author: justin healey
Reviews.Content: This was a great purchase! Great picture, app menu is not clunky, very easy to use.  The sound is really good too, which is not common for the lower priced slim line lcd/led's. Get it

Reviews.Title: Great TV at a great price
Reviews.Author: Lynn Edgington
Reviews.Content: We needed a new TV for our bedroom, and since we had a LG 49" Smart TV for our living room that we loved, this was a no-brainer to order.  Not only great TV but a great price too.  Love the picture and sound and fits perfectly in our room.  Thought it may have been too big, but turned out it was perfect.Highly recommend this TV if you want a great HD TV and a great price with great picture quality and sound.

Reviews.Title: Great TV at a Great Price
Reviews.Author: Miriam Poholek
Reviews.Content: As always, LG delivers quality. This is a great Smart TV. Picture quality, Ease of set up, Ease of WiFi interface are all a 10 on a scale of 1-10. The apps are easy to navigate, easy to use and produce quality imagery. Pairing this with Amazon Prime is a no-brainer, as the Prime Instant Video library is outstanding (at least for someone like myself, who likes a little bit of old, new and in-between...catching up on the Hercule Poirot series!) I just purchased an LG Blu-Ray Surround Sound System that I will be installing this weekend, so I will update soon on the interface. Overall, I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: LOVE this model LG ....  BUT WHAT IS WITH THE PRICE INCREASE???
Reviews.Author: DeeGeeStPete
Reviews.Content: I have this model TV in the 60 inch and LOVE IT!! I wanted to buy the same model (LN5700 Smart TV) in the 39". The price - just last week (2/26/14) - was $474.36 and this week has gone up to $529.00 - a 10% March price markup. I guess I will now have to buy a different brand. I just can't make myself pay an extra $54 when I KNOW this TV was sold at the lower price just last week. Also, they are advertising this model as a "2013" which I assume means a new 2014 39" will be coming out soon from LG. That is another reason I'm grumbling about the price and it's hard for me to pay that extra $54 for an old model. I haven't seen any other comments about the price so others must be OK with paying the new March 10% increase for the old model. I guess the motto for me here is "if you snooze, you lose".UPDATE 3/13/2014:  When Amazon raised the price of this size/model AGAIN by $20 on 3/9/14, I decided to purchase from Dell.  Amazon has marked up this unit by +15% (or $75) in only a few weeks...at this price point!!!!  YIKES!Dell has this model (39LN5700) with free shipping at a lower cost - a no-brainer for me.  Amazon has been my GO-TO vendor of choice but I'm really disappointed with their pricing of this unit.  Amazon raised the price several times in a few weeks while other vendors did not.  I'm now thinking that I will have to comparison shop for all my other purchases rather than trust that Amazon has the best price. Very disappointing & buyer beware.

Reviews.Title: Nice picture, mediocre sound
Reviews.Author: john
Reviews.Content: Nice picture, sharp and good contrast, color and refresh rate produce brilliant pictures without blur. One star removed for no cables for hookup to sound bar or dvd player. Sturdy stand supports large TV providing a sound platform for this unit. Vendor customer service needs improvement.

Reviews.Title: Decent Features, but Double Fail
Reviews.Author: Cody Steele
Reviews.Content: We purchased two of these . The first arrived in good condition and the very minor scratches on it which made it a discounted item were worth the $120 savings from Amazon's Warehouse Deals.  We set it up, but a few days later it started to turn off on its own and would turn right back on. The next day it wouldn't even turn on and the red power indicator on the bottom just flickered like a dim candle rather than a steady glow.If you haven't had Amazon call you right away for technical support, I can't recommend it enough. The service rep was very helpful and we tried a couple of things. Then he said he would refund our money and we could see if another warehouse deal was available. There was so we bought a second one.  That one seemed like it hand' ever been opened and perhaps was discounted for a fairly worn box that it arrived it. Still $100 off for a damaged box? I'll take it!Sadly after. Unpacking and pealing all of the protective wrapping off it proceeded to power cycle off and on. Search the reviews here for this problem and you will see this is apparently a common problem. :( We returned the second one and decided not to try a third one.Instead, I went to a local membership store and bought the 40" Vizio M series tv. They had a $20 instant rebate which made it cheaper than Amazon and even new it was cheaper than the discount LG. Having experience with both, I would say that the pro for the LG was the screen setup wizard. Use that and your tv will be beautiful for your specific environment. What a great system! However after a slightly more tedious trial and error the Vizio looks just as good. The thing that makes the Vizio shine is the apps. They are better, higher resolution, easier access versions of all that came with the LG. For example the Netflix app allows you to use your profiles and the LG only shows the que from the first profile. This is great if you have a profile setup for your kids and one for yourself.I guess I wish I had read this review before buying two of these LG tv's myself...

Reviews.Title: Also works as a computer monitor
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Ed Tice"
Reviews.Content: I can't add much onto the other reviews.  I primarily ordered this to use as a computer monitor / HTPC display and have information for anybody else who wants to use it this way.  To see text clearly, set the sharpness all the way to zero.  Otherwise the image processing will degrade it.  Use the "Just Scan" mode and ensure that your graphics card is not putting out an underscan image.  Do the sharpness first before worrying about scanning issues as having a non-zero sharpness will look just like an overscan problem.  I suspect this won't apply to a high percentage of people but those who need this information will be saved a ton of time and effort.  The manual talks about a "PC Mode" but none actually exists for this display!

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV
Reviews.Author: Logan Ellison
Reviews.Content: This 47" is mounted in my living room and it's the main piece. When I got the tv it was an easy setup, I had it completely setup and on Netflix about 20 minutes after un-boxing it. The display is great, whether you are watching a 30 minute show, a 2 hour movie or playing video games through the HDMI inputs. The sound quality of the actual built-in speakers is pretty good and doesn't "need" a sound bar or external speakers. Hooking up external speakers isn't hard at all, all you have to do is run an optical cable to your stereo receiver or sound bar and then change speaker settings on the input menu and you're ready to go. Navigating on the LG Smart menu is a breeze too. To use apps such as "Pandora" or an app that has to be downloaded you have to creat an LG account but it only takes about 5-10 minutes. Overall I would give this TV a solid 9.6 and would recommend it, wouldn't even mind getting another for the basement. Well, I hope this helps with your decision and you find it helpful.

Reviews.Title: no complaints here
Reviews.Author: Eric J. Bauer
Reviews.Content: wish i would have gotten the 3D version just for split screen gaming but other than that its a great tv.

Reviews.Title: Just Great
Reviews.Author: Ruben
Reviews.Content: I wanted a TV for our bedroom, and went for this one because we like the LG branded TVs so after reading a few reviews we choose this one.Great image, very clear and soft with Blueray, HDTV or even standard TV.With lots of presets like for movies, games, etc. Great sound, the speakers are far better that the usual cheap ones on other TVs. Movie preset not only changes picture but also improves surround sound.Great internet access, so I got rid of the Chromecast dongle. Works the same without it.Great Android app (phone or tablet optimized) to control TV and even keep watching via Wi-Fi streaming (guess there's an app for iOS too... maybe)3 HDMI and 3 USB. Besides the standard antenna and RCA connections.I also like I can keep the wireless headphones plugged in and select if I want to listen output through speakers or headphones on TV settings.Great timer functions (on/off) and eco settings.to save energy.Planning on buying a bigger one for the living room.

Reviews.Title: Meets and beats expectations,
Reviews.Author: Chef
Reviews.Content: So far I can say I love the LG39LN5700 Smart HDTV. In fact, I loved it so much, I bought a second one and gave it as a gift. Set up is a snap with it's on screen display. You will love the picture. I also hooked up an LG NB3530 300 watt Sound Bar. Nice sound output in a bedroom of 350 sqft. I use the stand provided for the TV. As with anything plastic, when you are using screws, use caution and do not over tighten the screws. The stand uses 4 self tapping Phillips head screws to attach the stand to the back of the TV and 3 Phillips Head screws to attach the stand to the TV. Screws are provided with the TV.

Reviews.Title: LG (Life is Good) 47in., 120 Hz, LED-LCD Smart HDTV
Reviews.Author: Richard Earl Smith
Reviews.Content: Out of the box, with minor preference adjustments, this TV is an awesome choice for those with the need for a mid size TV.

Reviews.Title: LG Smart TV
Reviews.Author: arahey
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this TV. Easy to set up and picture is fantastic i've had it trwo months now not one issue.

Reviews.Title: Love this new TV
Reviews.Author: Nydia I. Pistoll
Reviews.Content: This is our first Smart TV and it has everything we could ever want.  Plus, it is easy to navigate.  We highly recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV!
Reviews.Author: D. Kiriaji
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love this TV.  The price was awesome and the TV has been a pleasure to watch.  Would highly recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: LG 55LN5700 HDTV with Smart TV
Reviews.Author: salsa babe
Reviews.Content: Picture is super clear. The kids love watching on the big screen. We've gone through 2 TVs in the past (one being a Sony) and this is by far the best.

Reviews.Title: LG Smart tv
Reviews.Author: Thelma Davis
Reviews.Content: Awesome quality. Would consider purchasing another television for the home. Would recommend product to family and friends. Enjoying looking at movies and other shows.

Reviews.Title: Love It!
Reviews.Author: savysal
Reviews.Content: This 47" LG fills my needs more than the smaller screen that I had. My husband had the base attached in minutes and the wiring. I paid more to get it shipped quicker because the picture went out on  the one I had. Amazon.com had it priced well and I believe I got a pretty good deal. Picture quality is sharp and the sound is great on the music channels without any components like I had w/my old TV. Would recommend to family and friends. Was shipped very quickly as promised.I am quite happy w/it.

Reviews.Title: Really nice TV!!
Reviews.Author: N. Knox
Reviews.Content: I'm no expert with TV equipment and can't discuss some of the finer technical points. However, I just installed and set up this TV and so far it's working flawlessly. Wow! Great picture, handsome appearance, easy set up (for us dummys) and great service from Amazon. I'm happy!

Reviews.Title: Great Quality TV
Reviews.Author: ndys2012
Reviews.Content: I have really enjoyed this television.  Sports, movies, and television shows all look great on it.  It's not a perfect picture by any means, but, for the price you pay, you get a great quality picture.  The speakers are a little weird in that you can't really hear people talking on TV shows or sports games because the background noise is louder, but I hook my TV up to speakers anyways, so that problem doesn't matter.  I would definitely recommend if it's in your price range.

Reviews.Title: nice TV, 47" LED smart tv
Reviews.Author: jeanky
Reviews.Content: The smart tv functionality of this tv is great, the picture quality is awesome, the speakers leave a little to be desired. Also wish I had realized the base doesn't swivel, which would be a good feature.

Reviews.Title: Very happy
Reviews.Author: Giuseppi Cusumano
Reviews.Content: we are very happy with the LG Smart TV. The picture is beautiful and clear, it looks like the people are in your living room

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV - Good price
Reviews.Author: David Pack
Reviews.Content: After going through the picture wizard setup, the picture is amazing. I've watched HD TV, blu-rays, game consoles, all the way down to kids cartoons. The picture is excellent! The apps are also plentiful. I connected the TV to my Wi-Fi and updated the software to the latest version. Both the Netflix and Youtube apps stream HD quality video with no buffering. I haven't used any other apps on the TV. I recommend this TV hands down best for the price!

Reviews.Title: Great TV, no complaints!
Reviews.Author: LynnHendrickson
Reviews.Content: We are very happy with this purchase.  We like the smart TV feature and would recommend it.  We haven't figured out how to hook up our surround sound yet, because this TV requires USB or HDMI ports for connections rather than the plug in adapters, but the speakers on the television itself are pretty good.  .

Reviews.Title: good tv
Reviews.Author: Jeff Gardner
Reviews.Content: bought as a main tv with smart features.  It functions well, but the remote that comes with it is difficult to maneuver functions and typing is painful

Reviews.Title: What A TV
Reviews.Author: S.
Reviews.Content: This TV replaces a plasma that we owned for 8 years and paid a small fortune for. I researched Smart TVs, and it came down to either this LG or a Samsung. After going to the stores and looking at both TVs and their picture quality, I bought this one over the Samsung. I'm glad I did. I've had no trouble. It's been in use for about 45 days. The picture is awesome, and with a little tweaking, the sound's pretty good. I'm not sure what some are complaining about when it comes to the sound. Sure, it's not that bass heavy, but most TVs without a separate sub woofer are. After some minor tweaking (settings) it is so loud, and it has a good sound. WiFi is flawless. Amazon Prime perfect. This has been one of my better purchases. Thank you LG and Amazon.

Reviews.Title: I Love it love it love!!!!!! I was a GOOOD Girl becuz this was an awesome Christmas present!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Chef-Joeette
Reviews.Content: Easy to operate. Picture is flawless and the size is perfect. There are so many internet features i am still trying to experience them all. Simple to hook up and begin using. And trust me i am not tech savvy at all. LOL I am so very pleased with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: YouTube Codes = A Cinema
Reviews.Author: Gloria G. Garcia
Reviews.Content: We get to see & hear YouTube videos like a personal cinema from my laptop. My sister uses her iphone. The codes are provided under the "Sign in & Settings" icon from the YouTube app, where you choose to either "Sign in" to activate or "Pair Device" temporary, giving you a 9 digit code to enter it on your device (laptop, tablet, mobile) where you need to be signed in to YouTube. Then click on the link "Connected TVs" under the "Account Settings" link from your YouTube account. After entering the code, you're given the option to name the new feature; such as, "Family Cinema," that will appear as a pop-up from the new clickable icon on the lower right hand corner of the video, next to the "Large player" icon. The new icon, "Play on TV," will then give you the option to click either on "My Computer" or "Family Cinema," for instance... don't click for computer (device) if you want your chosen video to be displayed on your Life's Good Smart TV.

Reviews.Title: Just what I needed.
Reviews.Author: akaMachine
Reviews.Content: Got exactly what I was hoping for. Picture and sound is great. Picture: Watched The Avengers in HD off my Amazon Prime as a starting test. Yeah....Wow!!!!  I would upgrade to home theater sound but I live in an apartment. Otherwise the sound is still great. The remote does take a long time for typing in the web browser or signing in but I'll either just upgrade to the magic remote or get a wireless keyboard and/or mouse. Those aren't complaints for an overall fantastic product. I've used the stand instead of mounting (apartment). Stand seems very sturdy and not worried at all about tipping over or coming apart. Bought a Google Chromecast at the same time. Installed into tv easy. "Cast" tabs off my desktop onto this TV with no problems (ex: lag and buffering). The reason I bought the Chromecast is that you can't play flash videos off the internet browser made into the TV (Thank You to others for your previous reviews of that feature). Not a problem. $599 tv + $35 GC= awesome deal. Paid for this Christmas present for me and my wife by cutting the $150/month for cable tv back in July. We are very happy.

Reviews.Title: Great Looking TV
Reviews.Author: S. Martin
Reviews.Content: This TV has the best picture I have ever seen (aside from ultra-HD).  It is easy set up for use with Netflix and Amazon Prime.  Most streaming material I have watched would favorably compare to BluRay in quality.  I have it in my bedroom and use the TV's speakers  which do a fine job with sound.

Reviews.Title: Loud - Soft Audio
Reviews.Author: WallyC
Reviews.Content: I have had my new LG 47LN5700 Smart TV for about a month and a half now and all things considered, I love it! One qualifier; it's my first Smart TV. When you setup (a breeze)  this tv, or one like it, don't be disappointed that the settings aren't to your liking right away. It will take you awhile, first to learn about the many settings, then tweaking them till you find a combination to your liking. You will probably never be completely satisfied because there are so many variables. Just find a place you like and go with it for a while. That's what I did.The reason I gave it 4 stars and not 5 is because of the audio settings. The tv speakers themselves are much better than I expected after reading some of the reviews. They will probably satisfy anyone other than an audiophile. The problem I have, occurs when streaming movies (and even some other video) from Netflix.  If you have a home theater setup with 5:1 surround sound, this probably would not be a problem to you. It's the range of sound from very, very, low to very, very loud, on streaming movies that gives me problems - and I'm sure I'm not alone in this. You can be watching a movie when all of a sudden, due to a loud explosion or gunshots or something else, the sound blasts you out of your chair and you scramble for the volume control. Then, in the next scene, people will be whispering or talking very softly and you can't hear them. Again, the trusty volume control. So, if you set the volume low to account for the loud sounds, you can't hear low or even normal sounds - and vice-versa. The reason for this, I think, is the way audio engineers set up the sound to fill a movie theater - which is a lot bigger than my living room.A fairly simple way exists to adjust the sound. It's called a Dynamic Range Compressor (DRC) or Limiter. It brings the high end and the low end closer together and then squashes it giving you better volume control. I think they could fix this with a simple software upgrade but LG, or Netflix, for that matter, have not seen fit to incorporate it - yet.  Wait, lest I speak to soon. I just downloaded a software upgrade from LG and it is possible they have fixed the problem. I'm sure they will sooner of later. That is why I gave 4 stars and not five. I started to give them 5 anyway. I just love this TV.

Reviews.Title: My Premium Apps are not working. No Amazon Instant Video, Netflix etc
Reviews.Author: Nicole Cockburn
Reviews.Content: Everytime i click 'premium apps', a message comes up saying that my TV will reset. After it resets, I click the "apps" button on the remote then a message comes up saying that I need to agree to terms of use. After clicking agree, I do not see my premium apps anywhere and I have to keep doing this process over and over with no premium apps. As a result of this I cannot access access needed apps like Amazon Instant Video, Hulu and Netflix. PLEASE HELP!

Reviews.Title: A Wonderful TV!
Reviews.Author: Sima
Reviews.Content: We had been looking for a new flat screen for sometime.  We chose this one based on our personal needs, and we have been thrilled with it.  It sets atop our electric fireplace, and the size is perfect!  Everyone can see the screen no matter where they are sitting.  The picture is wonderful, both color and clarity.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding TV
Reviews.Author: M. Girard "read a lot"
Reviews.Content: I was afraid to order a TV online because I feared damage in shipping. The packaging this set came in was extremely good. The packaging seemed to be as heavy as the TV itself and protected it well. I'm very happy I got a "smart TV." We enjoy using the apps for Pandora, Amazon, and Netflix (without having to have a game console hocked up).

Reviews.Title: Love this LG TV!
Reviews.Author: M. H. Lumpkin
Reviews.Content: Altho it has taken some getting used to, I love this TV - all the features and the clarity of the picture.

Reviews.Title: LG 39" HD TV Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Toni Perkins
Reviews.Content: I've only had this tv a few days and I am already in love with it. The picture is crisp and clear and the set up was very easy and took less than 10 minutes. I've read other review complaining about the sound but it sounds absolutely fine to my ears. Also tru motion is easily turned off if you don't like it (and I personally hate it). All in all, this was a great buy and I'm very happy with it

Reviews.Title: no remote with this set
Reviews.Author: khh
Reviews.Content: TV is fine. What I expected. What I didn't expect was that I would have to shell out another 80 bucks for the remote........that is just cheap of LG. Who sells a set without the remote!!!

Reviews.Title: Works great seems to be high quality
Reviews.Author: ken sizer
Reviews.Content: This tv really works nice, it's a little awkward using the remote it came with to search the web, but the tv  is clear, everything works as advertised it really seems to be a quality product. I like it!!!

Reviews.Title: Did not work.
Reviews.Author: Michael K Goldsmith
Reviews.Content: When we recieved it hook it up and would not turn off. Just kept flashing back to LG Life's good. Life was not good. But I do commend Amazon on their return process. Quick and easy and credited my account in 3 business days.

Reviews.Title: I am an older woman and not of great size. The box seemed a challenge at first
Reviews.Author: A. J. "adahl-Korean drama enthusiast"
Reviews.Content: I was really worried how I was going to manage puting this TV together. I am an older woman and not of great size. The box seemed a challenge at first. Then I devised a plan as to how to do it all and it worked beautifully. I was concerned about the set up as I had read numerous e-mails of what to do or not do. It was really easy! The TV is really Smart. The picture is wonderful. Clear and crisp of color. The sound, they claim is bad, but I am not having any problems hearing most shows. I think some movies and programs mess with the sound and have it lowered. I am very happy with this TV. I now have two LG's and am most pleased with the brand performance. I don't have a huge room and am glad I did not go with anything larger. I, at 72, did this all myself. Women do not think you can't do it. You can and should learn how to connect your own TV, DVD player and router. It is not difficult at all. Do no be afraid! Thanks Amazon for one more great product you have sold to me and delivered right to my door and into my living room. Bravo!

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: Richard Luci
Reviews.Content: The picture is very clear. Set up was easy but LG's support was only a phone call away. We may get a sound bar also and the magic remote but after 2 mos. we're very happy.

Reviews.Title: Happy with purchase
Reviews.Author: M. Widner "Huckleberry"
Reviews.Content: This TV (32") has an awesome picture that makes even non-HD shows look great.  Watching old black and white movies and tv shows is brought to life by some level of 3D sharpness and clarity.  It has an econo mode for energy savings and in dark bedrooms you can set the brightness to automatically lower so it doesn't blind you or annoy your sleeping wife.  The speakers are better than other models but still on the "in a can" sound.  This smaller model is 60hz as it appears to be 120hz for the larger screens.  The remote control does not light up but the buttons are easy to navigate.  Smart TV apps are easy to setup and is simple step by step process.  I am using Wi-Fi to connect and that was easy to do as well.  In summary, I don't really do techy reviews, because so many other people do that.  I am pleased with the purchase and am looking to replace my living room with this model tv but just larger size.  4 stars - down side - it should have a camera and mic built in and not some LG branded accessory attachment that is sold separately.

Reviews.Title: Just what I expected.
Reviews.Author: Brian T Berg
Reviews.Content: Great picture. TV is just what I expected from LG. I would recommend this product to anyone looking for an LED Smart TV.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy!
Reviews.Author: Razzoo
Reviews.Content: Purchased this about a week ago and really like it.  Picture is great and the TV offers a couple of ways to calibrate it.  You can go through and do it professionally or use the built in wizard setup and it does a pretty good job.  No complaints so far.  Looked at this and the Vizio M401i-A3 and the reviews for the LG were much better and recommended.  I have to agree.  Bigger TV and very nice features.  The apps work great and its is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Awesome smart TV with great picture!
Reviews.Author: John Silvernail
Reviews.Content: Great smart TV with tons of features and a great pictures.  Setup was a breeze and surfing the web on our TV is easy.

Reviews.Title: Decent TV
Reviews.Author: dhyard
Reviews.Content: Very nice color, excellent skin tones, the blacks are not very good though. The main problem is motion blur, when watching sports, a lot of the action is blurred and pixelated. Definitly not a 120 hz tv, as I have a couple Samsungs with 120hz and there is no motion blur. I noticed consumer reports complained about the same thing. This doesn't happen on all programming, on some things it wasn't noticeable, so it may or may not bother you. I ended up with the Samsung 6300 and couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: Awesome picture-takes tweaking.
Reviews.Author: Roger Fairres "Boog"
Reviews.Content: It has performed superbly so far; 2 mos. The picture is huge in our small living room. HD brings in awesome detail. The colors/contrast/tint take some tweaking; as each show in HD controls their pic with custom setup. Depending on the mood of the show. Picture still isn't perfect but it is very close. eg any normal setting had the show Castle blacking out all the low light side of the faces. Some day soon we will be needing a standard color chart broadcast; like the old Indian chief, or a Macbeth ColorChecker.

Reviews.Title: best bang for the buck
Reviews.Author: zeus
Reviews.Content: I got 42inch version of this TV mainly because it was reasonably priced and did not expect much from it. I have had it for less than a week and here are some of the features I liked:- Wi-Fi connectivity. I was able to connect to home network on the  5mhz band.- I can control most of the features on screen using my android phone- The YouTube app let's you pair tv with your phone and you can search and create playlist that is automatically played on the TV.- I can also use my wireless keyboard and mouse on the TV- It plays practically any media file I own from wav to mkv.- very stylish for its price level- superb picture quality. My only gripe is that the blacks are not so dark but that's expected from an LCD panel

Reviews.Title: I love it.
Reviews.Author: Nistic
Reviews.Content: I love it. You have complete internet and computer in your hand. Recommended to buythis led LG TV. Great product.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV!!
Reviews.Author: Karen
Reviews.Content: The picture on this TV is clear with vibrant colors.  The Smart TV is exactly what I was looking for.  I can easily Skype and access my Netflix and Amazon Instant Video all from one location.  I love it!!

Reviews.Title: Great TV. Nice picture and sound.  Standard remote is fine...
Reviews.Author: B L
Reviews.Content: Great TV. Nice picture and sound.  Standard remote is fine for what I use for (TV and Netflix).  One note - when putting ID, PW into Netflix app at first I tried figuring out how to get letters on remote, but found that just pressing the enter or OK button with nothing filled in it brought up a keyboard on screen so I could enter.  (Perhaps standard functionality but my first smart TV so I didn't know!).

Reviews.Title: Great TV for any bedroom or smaller living space
Reviews.Author: Matthew Novitsch
Reviews.Content: I love this TV and the integrated applications like Netflix, Amazon, and YouTube built in. The wireless connected to my home wireless network without any problems.

Reviews.Title: LG web browser works great with it's mobile app for smart phone.
Reviews.Author: David C Weekley
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV.  I bought it because of the reviews of the deep blacks it produced.  They were right.  Also it was the only one I could find with a browser for the internet.  I ordered it without the magic remote.  The regular remote was a pain.  However, I found that LG had a remote for the Iphone.  I downloaded it and it works great!!!  I can touch the screen and it works like a mouse to navigate on the screen.  Click on the area you need to type and web address and you can type from your phone just like you do for a text message.  It couldn't be easier.

Reviews.Title: TV arrived quickly and has a great picture
Reviews.Author: Wendy Delehanty
Reviews.Content: Great picture....still trying to get a grip on all the other features. TV arrived quickly and was easy to set up.

Reviews.Title: Upgrade.
Reviews.Author: Bellagio
Reviews.Content: Upgrade to flat screen. Great picture.Perfect size for my space. Easy to set up by myself.Would recommend LG to my friends.

Reviews.Title: This is a great bargain and I would buy the reconditioned version available!
Reviews.Author: Ray Waclawsky
Reviews.Content: I love this tv!This TV has everything you need to be on top of the SMART TV WORLD!Although it took me longer to configure all the details, it is great...picture, sound and user friendly!Using the remote for access to smart tv is a chore so, I would probably buy the magic remote if I used it more frequently.For me, I was able to access all the necessary login info using the original remote so, it is purely a choice and if you have the money to burn.I highly recommend this tv.

Reviews.Title: Definitely a fine TV.
Reviews.Author: wasuck
Reviews.Content: This is the first TV i've bought in a while- and i'm not disappointed. Good colors, decent sound, but honestly, the smart TV aspect of is works quite well. So there you go.

Reviews.Title: Great TV. If you can afford it, get sound system with it.
Reviews.Author: Tim M
Reviews.Content: After doing exhaustive research, I finally decided on this TV for our new home. It had great reviews and a great price. The TV did not disappoint... it has an incredible picture and looks great above our fireplace. I actually purchased two TVs - a 47" for the living room and a 32" for the den.The "smart" features weren't a requirement for us but it was a nice bonus. We don't use them often because our TV and Xbox have many of the same features, but the times I have used those features they've worked well.I love that the frame of the TV is very thin. It takes up less space and looks more modern.The only thing that needs improvement is the sound. It doesn't get very loud. It seems after a certain point no matter how much I turn it up, it really doesn't change much. 98% of the time it's not an issue, but once in a while a show is very low and when I try to turn it up it just doesn't seem to get loud enough. We can deal with it for now but I'll probably buy a soundbar in the future.

Reviews.Title: Great value LED Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Rich G
Reviews.Content: Great value LED LCD High-Rez Smart/WiFi TV.  Fine picture quality and very good WiFi and Internet access/apps.  It would be great if it had a means to connect a keyboard; on-screen cursor-move letter-pick keyboard is painful to use.

Reviews.Title: LG 50LN5700
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I love this TV. Incredible color. Excellent WiFi. No longer have to use a Roku to get netflix. Directly watch YouTube and many other internet services. Worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: LG All the Way
Reviews.Author: Christian Miller
Reviews.Content: LG is a great brand they make really good products. I expect nothing but the best from them and thats exactly what I got when I receved this smart tv. You can access the internet straight from the tv with wifi or a direct connection. It has a great picture and do so many diffrent things. I would highly recommend this tv to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: JohnD
Reviews.Content: Good TV, good price, good service.There was a bit of problem at first.  It was shipped to my town and the carriers tracking said the unit was damaged, and they were going to return it to the shipper, which they did.  After a couple of day and telephone calls everything was sorted out, and a second TV was shipped.  The carrier delivered to the the doorway, and into the house.  We unpack it and connect all the cables, and everything works.  Thank you Amazon.

Reviews.Title: LG 50LN5700 Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Slotdoc48
Reviews.Content: I really love this TV.  The only reason I gave it a 4 star is because of NO Audio Out connections like my older LG 42LD400 has.

Reviews.Title: TruMotion, No Thank You
Reviews.Author: Joshua Boyer
Reviews.Content: Its a great tv, once you do a little fine tuning in the settings. I didnt like the TruMotion, but it was easily turned off for the modes I want. Smart TV is also worth the slightly higher price. The sound is also pretty good.

Reviews.Title: Don't be afraid to buy this TV. I've read all the comments before buying it !
Reviews.Author: CESAR L.
Reviews.Content: I've checked everywhere to find the lowest price and I've found it here in Amazon after deciding for this make and model. It connects really easy to the Internet with its build-in wi-fi. My main concerns when looking for a Tv set is its sound and this set will blow you away, I cannot put my unit higher than 10 on its 100 volume scale because it's way to loud for me. Also it has different settings to adjust the sound. Mine is set where no matter how low the volume voices get priority sound wise. Color and picture look really nice, I can even dare to say it can easily compete with higher end tv sets, here you have a lot of settings to adjust picture and color. Something personal possibly available in other sets different than LG too, what  I like about this set is its "Now on Tv" which is a listing from Smart TV with all your cable programming listed with pictures frames so it makes really easy to chose the show or program you want to watch. Another feature is "vTuner" where you can listen radio from any country. I have this set for almost a month by now and let me tell you up to this time I am completely satisfied and I hope not to regret it later on if it gets broken within 5 years. I expect this set to last longer than 5 years.

Reviews.Title: 120hz...Confused as I Am?
Reviews.Author: William A. Stephens
Reviews.Content: Overall, I have been mostly satisfied with the sound and video. Although the picture is not as wonderful as that of my recently failed 8-year-old 42-inch Pioneer plasma, I have been able to obtain acceptable results by establishing different and easily accessible settings for the type of program to be viewed (sports, documentary, TV series, news, etc.).But I am concerned about the claim that this set features a 120hz refresh rate. The info bar which appears when the set is turned on states that it is 60hz, and I have been unable to change that after making every conceivable adjustment allowed in the video settings.Is this 120hz claim an error in the advertising appearing on Amazon.com, or a deliberate misrepresentation made by the manufacturer or distributor which Amazon.com continues to ignore? Incidentally, at least one other reviewer has reported this issue.If an adjustment is available to obtain 120hz performance, I would appreciate knowing about it. If this set is limited to a 60hz refresh rate, then I would have more confidence in Amazon.com's future advertising if this misrepresentation is corrected.ADDED 10/17/2013: All the above discussion re: 60hz/120hz refresh rate should be disregarded (see comments, which I have allowed to remain for the benefit of others as uninformed as I've been). Also, I raised my rating to 4 stars, which I consider quite high for a TV so reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: I love it....
Reviews.Author: jeff heath
Reviews.Content: This T.V. is pretty amazing... It was really easy to set up and is very user friendly. I am very happy with the picture quility.

Reviews.Title: 47" LG Smart TV a value
Reviews.Author: Robert F Vitale
Reviews.Content: Really sharp picture quality  , the features are easy to use. Vivid color is exactly that, vivid!!Smart technology a breeze to operate.A value for sure!

Reviews.Title: Nice TV for the price
Reviews.Author: greenapple
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a quality TV to replace a Toshiba...have had nothing but bad luck with Toshiba.  A friend recommended LG and we are very happy with the TV so far.  I would recommend this to others.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Guy Farber
Reviews.Content: I'm a casual TV watcher and I use a lot of the web services like Netflix, Amazon and YouTube. The picture is amazing and sharp on both DirecTV and web services, speakers are reasonable for a TV. Interface and speed of the apps is great and LG has an awesome controller app for the iPhone and iPad.  It has a sufficient number of HDMI and USB ports. Paying a bit more than $600 for this, in my mind, is a steal.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Smart TV. Excelente Televisor
Reviews.Author: Jose Arretureta "Jose Alberto"
Reviews.Content: This Smart TV is excellent for me. I was looking for a TV that would have Full HD 1080p resolution, web browser, Youtube (perfect synchronization with Android smartphones), Facebook, Twitter, etc, WiFi, USB & HDMI ports (3 ports every one), LED technology, Miracast & DNLA technology and it has all that I was look for.The USB ports can plays MKV video files with 1080p resolution perfectly. Even it can reads the subtitles in .srt format. You can watch all photos, movies and listen the music contents on your USB drive.The Miracast works perfect with the Wireless Screen of the Google Nexus 4 (Smartphone designed by LG).I love this TV and I recommend it highly.Este Smart TV es excelente para mí. Yo estaba buscando un televisor que tuviera una resolución Full HD 1080p, navegador web, Youtube, Facebook, Twitter, etc, WiFi, puertos USB y HDMI (tiene 3 de cada uno), pantalla LED, Miracast y tecnología DNLA, y tiene todo lo que me buscaba.Los puertos USB reproducen perfectamente archivos de vídeo MKV a 1080p de resolución. Incluso puede leer los subtítulos en formato .srt. Usted puede ver todas las fotos, películas y escuchar música contenidos en un Pen Drive.El Miracast funciona perfecto con la pantalla inalámbrica del Google Nexus 4 (Smartphone diseñado por LG).Me encanta este televisor y lo recomiendo altamente.

Reviews.Title: THE ONE TO BUY!
Reviews.Author: Jim Shores
Reviews.Content: I did my research and decided on this LG. I was in a Taco Mac the other day and realized that all 36 TVs they had were LG! Then I read the reviews. I have had it now for 2 weeks. It replaced a Magnavox that was 3 years old. Picture just wasn't up to par. This LG is great! Super sharp picture and the Smart TV aspect is super! It's has the wireless internet, it immediately found my signal and hooked up. We watch a lot of NetFlix's movies and it's just so simple to access them!! The speakers in the set are the weak point. I thought I could hook it up to a receiver I had for my surround, nope! It is an old system and did not have the proper connection for the Set. Not a problem, I went back and purchased the LG Sound Bar with the wireless sub. WOW! It sounds better than when I had my old surround hooked up! Spend the money and get the sound bar too! You will love the combination...I do!!

Reviews.Title: Great Set!
Reviews.Author: guamie
Reviews.Content: I have had an LG set when the lcd/led tv's started to replace cathode.  By todays standards what I paid for back then to what I have now is on a whole new planet.  This set is of course awesome & what Amazon was able to sell it for....incredible @ $464 well worth it.  I also use it as a comp monitor so much easier to read the screen.  No dissapointments as yet.  My original LG still works as good as new considering it is over 10 yrs old so the brand is solid in terms of quality and longevity.  The bells & whistles on the smart set is truly awesome, i use my apple mini computer on it along with the bluetooth keyboard / mouse so I forego the smart remote wich I bought seperately but works great for tv use.

Reviews.Title: I purchased this Tv based on the reviews
Reviews.Author: mommychi "mommychi"
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant purchasing a TV on-line. Best Buy did not have this model and it was the TV I wanted. I worried about shipping, breakage, etc.The TV arrived before the projected date. It was in perfect condition. The UPS driver put it inside my house.I did have it set up by The Geek Squad..All in all I love this set.Also, the price was awesome. Quite a bit lower than if I purchased it in an Electronic store.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price!
Reviews.Author: astuder58
Reviews.Content: Great picture and color, and super-easy to set up the smart-tv features even for someone not electronically gifted. As other reviewers noted, the sound is lacking--it improved greatly when I adjusted the settings on the tv, but I still chose to get a sound bar to go with the tv so I could get closer to a theater experience with movies.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: PL "PL"
Reviews.Content: This is one amazing TV. Picture is very clear. I have not payed any games on it but used it for over the air channel, netflix and used it with blu-ray and dvd player.  I have also used Youtube with it. For a 32 inch this is amazing tv with lots of feature and very clear picture. I also have iphone ap and I am able to control this tv with my iphone. Searching videos on youtube is fast as I can type what I want.I would also go for another LG 55 inch tv very soon.

Reviews.Title: What a difference this makes!
Reviews.Author: PorkChop "AnyPorkInAStorm"
Reviews.Content: I had a 32" Sony Bravia which was trouble from the word GO.  The screen would freeze intermittently which was the biggest problem.  I'd purchased the Sony for my living room and it turned out to be too small.  Fast forward three years later to present day and the LG 42".  I was just looking for a basic TV, where I could hook up a DVD player and the cable box.  I don't need 3-D and other peripherals.I'd expected to be able to see from a further distance (12') but this TV exceeded my expectations.My condo is open-plan with living/dining/kitchen, so I opted to wall-mount the TV with a swivel.  Wow, didn't expect to be able to see 16' feet away in the dining area, or in the kitchen, 10' to the side.  Just turn that swivel about about 50 degrees and it gives perfect viewing.I'm not using all the SMART features as of yet, but I'm just enthralled with the clarity and color intensity of this product.I paid someone to come and install this and it was worth every penny.  The screen itself weighs about 35-40 lbs, so no way could I have an done this myself.I'm hoping this TV will last me several years (at least as long as my last tube TV, 14 years) - I don't buy every new gadget so again, I expect the LG to be around for awhile.--------------Update November 25, 2013---------------This TV has been terrific - also I added an Apple TV since I have a Netflix account and it's so great to watch movies and programmes.One thing I didn't know about installing an Apple TV is that I needed wi-fi, so had to purchase a router (Cisco for @ $50.00, recommended by my IT department at work).  That was easily installed.Some have complained about the sound quality but I've yet to experience any issues.

Reviews.Title: Value and quality
Reviews.Author: Zoila
Reviews.Content: Fast service, satisfied with product. This was purchased as a gift and was delivered by the anticipated delivery date. Picture is sharp and the interface is relatively easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Love This TV!
Reviews.Author: Frank
Reviews.Content: I finally decided to replace my 32 inch Sony Bravia TV for a bigger and smarter TV.  I'm so glad I did!  The picture quality on the 47LN5700 is AMAZING.  However, I did turn off that True Motion feature as others have mentioned.  Also, the sound quality works for me, but then again I live in an apartment.  They've added Amazon Instant Video to their Apps menu which is a HUGE plus.  You can also control everything on it with the remote control app on the iPhone.  It would be way too frustrating for me to surf the web with the remote provided.  With the iphone app I can use the touch screen to move the mouse and keypad to type.  I definitely recommend this TV.  It's a great TV that doesn't break the bank.

Reviews.Title: Amazon Prime App now available
Reviews.Author: brian wickensimer
Reviews.Content: The amazon prime app has been a long time coming for this tv. However, this morning I received an update which included the app. I though t the tv originally shipped with the app, but it didn't. Now it is here. A perfect tv.

Reviews.Title: Great TV,but NO Amazon!
Reviews.Author: scpinhead "Stacy"
Reviews.Content: I really think this is a great TV but I am shocked to find out that it does not support Amazon instant video.I should have done more homework before I bought it,because I love Amazon and use it constantly.It seems like an unforgivable omission.I find it ridiculous that I can watch AIV on my kindle and my laptop,but not on the TV I ordered the videos from.Was this a conscience decision,or did someone really drop the ball here?It doesn't seem right to me that I now have to use a Roku to use the TV as I intended to use it.It still is a great TV,but I think someone made a huge mistake here,and it takes away from the whole experience.

Reviews.Title: The picture is amazing
Reviews.Author: Mari
Reviews.Content: We have Verizon Fios and swapped out a 50" LG for this one.  At times it feels like you are in the movie theater and the scene is right in the room.  Has to be the 120Hz.  I read reviews over and over and kept coming back to this LG.  Buy it and you won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: Great HD and smart TV for the price
Reviews.Author: crazy larry
Reviews.Content: This is a very good HD TV if you are in the market for a smaller TV. This is our main TV and fit in the cabinet we have. Most people will want a bigger screen but we don't need that level of immersion. I saw many criticisms of the audio quality but it is fine for our limited demands. My biggest complaint is the remote which doesn't control the DVR box channels. Also the wheel button to control cursor on screen is poor, as it is hard to move around and lacks an accelerometer. Overall we are thrilled with this LG product and chose it for smaller size, budget, and the fact LG manufactures its own panels unlike Samsung. I can't expect this much let alone more for $512 including shipping.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture, Easy Menus, Plenty of Connections
Reviews.Author: Dharmadog "Dharmadog"
Reviews.Content: This TV has a fantastic picture.  The remote and the menus are easy to use, and the TV itself is easy to set up, including getting the TV connected to a home network.  Everything is really self-explanatory and I didn't need to use the manual for any part of the assembly or setup.  All in all, I love it.  Couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: I'm happy
Reviews.Author: Jose Rojas
Reviews.Content: I'm not much of a TV watcher but I can tell the quality of this TV is awesome. It was shipped on time well packaged. It was amazingly easy to install. I would recommend this product to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: C
Reviews.Content: Everything i wanted and it came earlier than advertised.  I want to buy another one for another room in the house.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful TV
Reviews.Author: N. Greenfeld
Reviews.Content: This works great -- good picture quality, viewing angle, easy to set up, etc. I have no issues with the TV. But one note: we had a previous login with Netflix, and using the smart tv to get to Netflix shows a login screen, with no way to input letters. After a long time with customer service, we finally just got to the login name, hit OK, and up pops a virtual keyboard. Not documented, bad interface. Don't know if it's like this for other services. This has been the only annoying thing.

Reviews.Title: "Le Good!"
Reviews.Author: Wil Evans "Wil"
Reviews.Content: This how I gave the name to this product instead of it's old "Life's Good" or "Lucky Goldstar". Because it gives me the satisfaction I need when it comes to led hdtvs. And one thing more the price is affordable having a smart features like no ordinary TV. Two Thumbs Up. And I guess it was ahead than Samsung though they are both from Korea. The pictures are clear, remote control is easy to use, and you could really see the High definition in color.

Reviews.Title: Nice features and not so expensive
Reviews.Author: vishal
Reviews.Content: It was delivered on time as promised. I have been using this tv for a month now and I really like it.Initially I thought there was an issue with the sound system but after some settings it worked out well. The app collection is not that great but it has all what i use ie netflix, hulu and crackle. Quality is great! Yes you may find it difficult to handle smart features with the default remote but if you have a smart phone then just download the tv app and it becomes very much convenient.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: William Hunt
Reviews.Content: This TV is amazing totally meets our expectations! It is like a TV & computer in one. We highly recommend this TV!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Edward
Reviews.Content: I'm so glad we bought this model TV. I thought we had a great TV with our last 1080p set but this new LG showed us what we were missing. Easy to set up. I had the surround sound and all the rest of our additions  up and running in no time. The "smart" function is great. All-in-all A great buy.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Autumnjean
Reviews.Content: Perfect quality TV. I can even watch shows on the Internet. The only thing I don't like is the remote. The tv has Internet access but needs a user friendly replay by adding a keyboard or something. But over all it is awesome!

Reviews.Title: Great display, great value
Reviews.Author: Tracy J Shriver
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love my new HDTV!  I knew I didn't want 3D capabilities and that surprisingly limited my choices but this model met all my requirements and at a good price. I love the quality of the picture and that I can connect my iPhone to You Tube on the TV and play videos.

Reviews.Title: LG TV
Reviews.Author: Daniel Conard
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is very clear and crisp. Simple hook-up by far the easiest I have ever used. I will be purchasing another LG to replace the one that is my living room which is a different brand. I hope the bigger TV's are as clear and crisp as this 32".

Reviews.Title: What an amazing TV
Reviews.Author: S. Ball "sball"
Reviews.Content: This TV is amazing. Great picture, computer-like interface, and reasonable price. I have it connected to the internet. It is nice to watch Netflix just like watching a regular TV program. I have the smart remote, which I highly recommend. You point the remote at the TV and it senses where you are pointing. It's features are similar as a mouse device. It is truly a Smart TV.

Reviews.Title: So far it has been worth it. Impressive TV.
Reviews.Author: Alex Rohde
Reviews.Content: Almost everything on this tv has met my expectations. Its bright, the picture is fantastic, sound quality is not bad. The only thing that was disappointing was there is no red white audio (analog) out on this tv only optical out (digital). My external speakers that I bought a few years back only have the analog audio so I had to buy a digital to analog converter ($60) and an optical cable to hook up my speakers. It works most of the time but for some applications the audio is out of sync with the video, a problem that i think can be attributed to the converter.Most of the newer external speakers you can buy now are upgraded to digital sound so this might not be an issue for some people. The tv speakers are not bad if you dont have an external sound system. Just note that the tv speakers and an external sound system cannot be used at the same time on this tv. You can only use one or the other (but its pretty easy to switch between them).Also this tv does not come with the magic remote but if you have a smart phone you can get a free app that basically turns your phone into the smart remote.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: Michael J. Young
Reviews.Content: I lost my last 55 inch LG due to a lightning strike, the new 2013 model is definitely better. this smart tv is top notch TV for sure

Reviews.Title: Beautiful TV!
Reviews.Author: jaydee
Reviews.Content: This LG tv is crystal clear, was super easy to set up and the sound quality is great.  I'm not sure what some of the other reviews complained about the sound, because it's loud enough and very clear.  We love the clarity and brightness of the picture.  The 47" size is a really nice size.  Big enough to see everything but not massive.

Reviews.Title: Extremely bright and vivid
Reviews.Author: Gregory Rhoden
Reviews.Content: This new set has to be the best looking picture of any TV that I have ever owned.  I will be getting the larger version to replace my 7 year old plasma.  Numerous inputs, both wired and wireless network hookup, several apps including netflix (but wish it has amazon prime).  The TV is very very light as well, which makes it simple to wall mount.  The standard remote (not magic) works really well and is easy to hold and navigate.  For tiny speakers it is loud enough, though of course not very full.  It is excellent for a bedroom TV.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV, excellent service by amazon
Reviews.Author: BRobb
Reviews.Content: I gave this TV 5 stars because it was easy to set up, easy to connect to my home Wi Fi, and the picture is great. The only item i stil have a small problem with is that the sound on some channels (I'm on Cablevision) is way unsynced with the video. I adjust the delay on the TV menu and it helps, but since the inherent daly in the cable signal varies from channel to channel, it sometimes still is out of sync.Stil, the TV is outstanding!

Reviews.Title: Well...
Reviews.Author: av.online
Reviews.Content: I didnt look at TVs in a store this time, I shopped completely online.  I was pretty nervous, but quickly narrowed it down to Samsung or LG (always been a fan of Samsung computer monitors, until a recent LG purchase which blew my old monitors out of the water).  I ultimately chose two LG's.  Having not shopped at a store, I was somewhat surprised by how large this TV actually is (it replaced an older Westinghouse 32").  Everything is awesome about this TV, its picture is stunning.  The sound isnt even as bad as I was expecting based on reviews of LCD TV's in general.Why I knocked off a few stars...First, I initially hooked this TV up as an internet device only, in the bedroom for netflix while a living room remodel takes place.  Every now and then there is a very fast, but noticeable flicker.  I did a little research, im not to bad at google-fu, but most posts pointed to the issue being just changes in light to dark and the auto adjusts built into the tv.  I did a little menu exploring and turned those settings off, and the issue has not improved.  Im not sure if its just how TVs of this size work, there arent a lot of posts about it.  I dont know if there is something wrong with the unit, or its just how its supposed to be.  The second star is because LG is not exactly easy to work with.  I cant find any info on their site on what to do, how to fix it, or what to do about warranty or return/replace.  It was a big family expense.

Reviews.Title: OMG!  What a beautiful picture.
Reviews.Author: Jim Knapp
Reviews.Content: I wanted a new TV, but didn't want to spend a lot, so I researched and researched, and this was the best TV and at a great price.  I knew I wanted a Smart TV, but all the others were out of my price range by far.  When I found everything this TV has and does I just knew it would be quite expensive.  But I priced it anyway and to my surprise Amazon was running a special on it (the 39 inch).  So I checked around to other outlets and Amazon was by far the best price.  I mulled it over for a few days, still checking out a lot of other TV's but I would always come back to this one as the best TV.  It had the most to offer and is a SMART TV.  That's important.  And this one was the best priced too.  So I no longer could resist and bought it.  Then when I got it and plugged it in and saw the picture.  I can only say, "OMG!"  I've seen many other TV's but NOTHING can even come close.  The clear, and I do mean clear, picture is truly unbelievable.  And the color is so bright and vibrant.  I couldn't even ask for a better TV.  Thanks LG and thanks Amazon.  For all the details of this product, look for this: LG Electronics 39LN5700 39-Inch 1080p 120Hz LED-LCD HDTV with Smart TV  --- You really won't believe your eyes.

Reviews.Title: UPDATED: better (Right concept, implementation falls short)
Reviews.Author: M. ADAMS
Reviews.Content: Update: after jackin up the power on my WAP but more importantly having received numerous software updates, I have tweaked my rating from 2 to 3 stars. I rarely have connection stuttering problems these days, so given the value of this now somewhat reliable product, I am a happier customer...Original review:This would be a much better product if they had focused on getting some of the details right. I'm spoiled by Apple's system integration and user interfaces, so I get annoyed when I have to re-enter my Wifi password multiple times because the UI makes it easy to make typos. This wouldn't be such a big problem but the Wifi radio seems cheap and isn't well integrated with the OS. I can run the Netflix app on my iPad in the same room as the TV and there is never any hiccups on the ipad. However, the TV frequently needs to buffer and just randomly loses networking. I often have to reboot my router and then turn the TV back on, after which it streams fine. This does not happen on any of my mobile devices, my Roku, or my Smart BLUray player. Periodically none of the networking works mysteriously and then after a few minutes of fumbling, I am required to agree to the terms of service, after which the TV works okay again. The bottom line is that this is just a product that meets my needs but is kind of annoying. In other words, it doesn't "just work" which is the standard set by Apple. However, the price is right. I would not buy another of these in the future but would probably pay a little more for one with better hardware/software. Running a cable would probably solve a lot of my problems, but I bought this TV because I can't run a cable (through brick/stone).

Reviews.Title: Very Happy
Reviews.Author: J. Gordon
Reviews.Content: TV works as advertised. It looks good, has a good picture, and connected to my wifi network. I have three of these now.

Reviews.Title: Lasted a week
Reviews.Author: Harold Petersen
Reviews.Content: Bought it from Amazon warehouse, it lasted a week before the dreaded blinking red power light syndrome started.  TV was great up until then.  If you're really wanting to use the Wifi internet option look into purchasing the magic remote.

Reviews.Title: This is a good, not great, Smart TV - Where is the app for Amazon Prime Video
Reviews.Author: LeBron Fanatic
Reviews.Content: Pros:1) The screen looks great when light isn't reflecting off it2) The price3) It does a fantastic job of streaming Netflix - many of the HD shows for kids look better streamed from Netflix than from my cable boxCons:1) Where in the world is an app for Amazon Prime? The idea of attaching my Kindle to my TV set through the HDMI port i ridiculous. That's why I got a TV with WiFi in the first place!2) The LG app to control the TV is clunky. You don't need to purchase the "magic remote" but my iPhone and iPad keep having problems connecting to the TV. Once I delete/re-download the LG remote app, things work fine.3) I'd re-emphasize that the lack of a Amazon prime app is a big deal.Neutral:1) You can stream videos from your computer. The set-up isn't hard. But there have been times when the TV seems to have buffering issues, and the video pauses for a moment. So good, not great.

Reviews.Title: After Almost a Year, Not so great.
Reviews.Author: C Dignam
Reviews.Content: The paragraph below was written after my initial purchase. I also purchased an expensive power cord/surge protector along with this tv that was equipped to handle tv, dvd, a pc, printer, etc. About 2 weeks ago the tv started turning itself off and then on then off, etc. I would unplug the surge protector, unplug everything else that was on the power cord and plug just the tv into the surge protector. It just keeps doing it. I have tried everything you can imagine. A different outlet, a different more expensive surge protector, leaving it off, doing software updates. Nothing works, it just keeps turning itself off and on over and over. I'm not sure how much this fix is going to cost me but I'll let you all know what happens. Very disheartened because all the LG help desks on this issue seem to skirt the issue rather than address it or admit that this is a common problem.You don't need a magic remote for an LG smart tv. You can download a free ap and your phone turns into a remote/mouse making the arrow on the screen easier to mvoe around. I've only had the tv about a week but it was really easy to set up I didn't even use the directions. the picture on some channels hasn't been that great but I need to change my cable box to an HDTV cable box  the picture will probably improve when that happens. The sound on this little tv is better than the sound on my 42 inch Phillips in the living room.

Reviews.Title: Very good TV, works well in the space
Reviews.Author: Nathan Meyers
Reviews.Content: I had two problems to solve when I shopped for this TV:- Needed a smart TV that could subscribe to MLB.TV- Needed to be a nice-sized TV that wouldn't overwhelm our not-too-large living roomThe 39" LG smart TV solved both problems. It's an unusual "between" size - there's not a lot of choice in this size range, and I was pleased to find a smart TV this good and this reasonably priced in just the size I needed.The one negative is the sound, which I gather is pretty typical for modern flat-screens: two small speakers sending sound downward from the bottom of the screen produce fairly tinny sound no matter what adjustments you make. You can use the stereo jack or TOSLINK connector on the back to drive a home theatre amp or an external sound bar for much better results.Also like most modern TVs, this one does the automatic image interpolation that makes everything you watch look like a soap opera. Fortunately, that is easily corrected by turning off "TruMotion" in the video settings.I make very little use of the smart TV apps, but the one I do use - MLB.TV - I use a lot, and am happy with its quality.Bottom line: this was an excellent purchase that I expect to enjoy for many years.

Reviews.Title: IMPORTANT INFORMATION I MISSED....
Reviews.Author: TMI "tmi_darktower"
Reviews.Content: I own a Roku and have Direct TV.  I purchased this LG Smart TV to watch videos from the internet.  I thought I could browse the web and watch whatever I wanted as long as I had the correct subscriptions (HBO Go, etc).  I missed a very important piece of information.  This TV does not/can not access content that requires Flash.  I contacted LG and they have no information as to if/when they will have Flash available.  I have since searched for complaints on this issue and found this has been a long standing complaint for years.  To me this makes the TV an obsolete product and a waste of my money.  If you do not have a gaming station or Roku, etc, then the apps provided (Hulu, Netflix, etc) may make this a good TV for you.  Otherwise, it may be a bit disappointing for you....like it is for me.

Reviews.Title: Too bad there are only five stars in the rating system -- because this is a TEN!!!!
Reviews.Author: FHG
