Reviews.Title: LG Smart HDTV is a beautiful addition to our living room.
Reviews.Author: susan l. morabito
Reviews.Content: I'm still learning all the cool functionality; being taught to me by my teenage sons! The picture is so clear and makes images seem like they are right there with us. We are all very happy with our selection.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: Gerald W Stewart
Reviews.Content: The TV looks and sounds great with minimal setup effort.  This is my first HD experience in my home and I am blown away by the picture and sound quality.

Reviews.Title: Best for only or second tv!
Reviews.Author: Perusto
Reviews.Content: This 42" LG replaced a 39" tv yet fit in the same bedroom nook, making viewing better than before.  The price was so low the deal was irresistible.  The SMART TV feature is fun and opens worlds of viewing choices not found on regular tvs.  The 120Hz refresh rate is awesome.  This is my second LG tv.  I'm very happy with both of them.

Reviews.Title: Easy setup ,great sound
Reviews.Author: Peter L.
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with this set. It connected easily to my wifi system, the smart tv aspect is easy to use ,and,for a flat screen tv the sould is excellent.

Reviews.Title: Bang for you buck
Reviews.Author: Aaron77177
Reviews.Content: Awesome television. Clear picture. Very good quality from LG. Perfect sound! Don't need a sound bar!Can't believe the quality of this T.V. for the price. Smart features are all great. Wall mount capability is very strong and sturdy, doesn't move at all.Only complaint is that the internet is hard to search without the LG Magic Remote. But that's my only 1 single complaint!

Reviews.Title: Best deal on a TV anywhere ... 42" and smart for under 500.00 just try to top that ... I have looked and it cant be done !!
Reviews.Author: scott
Reviews.Content: This Smart TV is more than anyone could ever expect. There is so much to experience with the "Smart" part of the TV that it will be like forever until I have a chance to experience it all. I will NEVER look at TV the same again, and I will never own a TV again that doesn't have a "Smart" attached! This is the best thing that ever happened to TV ... every TV should be this way EVERY one ... LG you do it the best. I am happy with the smart tv but after having it for a while and seeing others around I am even more happy that I took the time to find out who does it the best  ... LG ... keep up the great work and I will never buy elsewhere !

Reviews.Title: Does everything I could ask for.
Reviews.Author: goofyfoot
Reviews.Content: Easy set up, great picture and adequate audio.  I'm not interested is streaming video or other apps, so I can't comment on them.

Reviews.Title: Great smart tv!
Reviews.Author: David Prouty
Reviews.Content: It's been great thus far.  Great picture.  We got rid of cable this year so nice to have just one remote with it being a smart tv and all, easy to get to Netflix etc..  Seems like a great value, even vs. a lot of the black Friday deals out there...

Reviews.Title: 47inch LG Smart HD TV
Reviews.Author: Steve Boyer
Reviews.Content: My daughter has a 37" LG HD TV and it has been a very reliable TV.  The price was just too good to pass up.  Very happy with the TV so far.SB

Reviews.Title: Excellent Picture, Great Value!
Reviews.Author: jackie314
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is excellent, and very easy set-up.You do have to experiment with the sound to get the rightsound for what you are watching, i.e., sports.

Reviews.Title: Good TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Dorene
Reviews.Content: Just purchased this tv. So far so good.  Picture quality and sound is good. Easy navigation.  Good buy for the price I paid.  Happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Lots of PERKS
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Why I love this tv1. I am not a super tech and I was able to set up the tv and get online with it in less than 10 after opening the package.2. I can watch Amazon prime and Netflix without adapters.. big deal to me3. I can plug in my external hard drives and watch movies with the USB port.4. The picture quality is amazing and it's now the best tv in the house.5. It has a convenient mute button for when the phone rings.6. Wide screen 32 inches seems a lot bigger than a regular 32 inch tvI don't purchase cable or satellite tv and I have been told by retailers that all the new tv's will pick up at least basic local television for news and weather but I couldn't get this tv to pick it up ANY channels via automatic tuning :(  That is my only disappointment and the resason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5.If anyone knows some secret trick to get that to work I would be thrilled to hear about it.Other than that I couldn't be more pleased.

Reviews.Title: Very good LED TV
Reviews.Author: George Izzo
Reviews.Content: Great picture, easy to use, requires a keyboard though. Sound is very good, but in 'cinema' mode the dialogue is not always audible due to the amplified background sounds. This probably fixable, I'm just not an A/V techie. The price was very reasonable, and shipment through Amazon was ahead of schedule, which is good.

Reviews.Title: Great tv!
Reviews.Author: Polabear
Reviews.Content: Great TV! Looks wonderful! Bought it for Black Friday, and I have to say it was the best deal I found! Shipping was fast, although the fedex guy made me carry it up my stairs out side of my house without offering to help, but that's not amazons fault. Haha

Reviews.Title: Great TV.  Great Price
Reviews.Author: dave higday
Reviews.Content: Very happy with this TV.  Took a while to set up with the remote but everything worked fine.  Easily synched with my wireless router.  I did not buy the magic remote.  You can navigate with the stock remote but its a pain.  The stock remote wheel is actually poorly designed.  You can easily hit other functions while using the directional buttons.  To flat, to close.  I priced this TV about everywhere and Amazon had the best price by far.  The picture is wonderful.  I think once I play with it I will enjoy the smart TV functions.  I am a bit worried about the security.  I am a little afraid to enter any credit card info into the system.  I am not sure what kind of security is built into the TV.  If someone knows feel free to say something in a review.

Reviews.Title: missing the screws to attach tv to stand had 3 for base manual says should also have 4 more
Reviews.Author: Dane G. Zahner "d"
Reviews.Content: opened it up and did not have all the screws to attach it together came with the 3 for base but did not have the 4 to attach it! so can not use presently:-( live in middle of nowhere so have to wait to get to town to get some.update amazon as always fixed it....thanks amazondane

Reviews.Title: Fantastic TV!
Reviews.Author: Christy "Christy H."
Reviews.Content: Fantastic TV and the clearest picture I have ever seen. Good price, it came quickly and I couldn't be happier with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great Deal for a great price
Reviews.Author: Carol Conway
Reviews.Content: I love this TV!  Very user friendly and great picture!  Great deal for the price.  Easy to hook up and follow installation instructions.

Reviews.Title: Easy set up, great picture
Reviews.Author: Cindave
Reviews.Content: Pros: Easy set up, got it just in time for the first game of the World Series (Fear the Beard! ;-). It has near perfect picture after just a few easy tweaks. The "Smart" part was not why I bought this but has been a pleasant experience. Quick access to Netflix, Amazon and Youtube is a great experience. The ability to use a free remote control app for my phone makes the web browser actually usable.Cons: As others have stated, the base could be better, and does not tilt to adjust angle. While the sound is adequate, if you want to hook up your old AV receiver, you will need an adapter since there is only an optical audio output.Conclusion: Great bang for your buck!

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Nick T "Nick"
Reviews.Content: I use this as an outdoor TV and am really impressed with the picture's ability to hold up in outdoor lighting. It's not the to of the line, but it's a great TV for the price.

Reviews.Title: I'm really happy that I bought this TV
Reviews.Author: Jason Taylor "j everett taylor"
Reviews.Content: It was very easy to put the stand together and attached to the tv, the ports are easy to get to, and setting up the cable box connection, internet connection and apps was a breeze with the automated setup on startup.  The picture quality is really great, and the sound is good as well.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for a good price
Reviews.Author: Chun Ly
Reviews.Content: This TV is great for what I needed.  Quality is very good for the price. I like the Smart TV functions. I just wish that LG allows using the Pandora app on TV. That is the one thing that is missing.

Reviews.Title: lg 42ln is a winner
Reviews.Author: D'Arcy Tomlinson
Reviews.Content: the lg is great...Great picture, easy to setup and use.The tv is perfect for the viewing room.Oh yeah the price was excellent.

Reviews.Title: Review of LG 42LN5700 42-inch 1080p tv
Reviews.Author: kathleen anderson
Reviews.Content: The set has a beautiful picture with all the bells and whistles.  No problems  setting it up. I Love it!

Reviews.Title: Ba Da Ba Da Da i'm lovin it!
Reviews.Author: jennifer goltz
Reviews.Content: So far so good. TV was easy to set up, connected to the wireless internet promptly, and everything works great. Netflix and Hulu Plus work great. Still trying to get used to High Definition TV.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good for a first HDTV
Reviews.Author: Groovy Java
Reviews.Content: The LG 42LN5700 has a good picture, although at times it doesn't seem quite bright enough; this might be fixable by tweaking a couple of settings, but so far some shows appear to be on the greyish, muted side. I haven't tried all of the Smart TV features yet, so I can't offer an opinion on those yet.One major flaw: although generally speaking, the TV is easy to set up, the stand is horrible, and I now have to live with a TV that is easy to tip over and sits precariously on its mount. The instructions are typical in that they tell you not to tighten the screws too much or too little. Even if I disobeyed the first of these commandments, there is simply no way to _securely_ mount the TV on the stand. The stand and mounting screws need an engineering overhaul and downgrade an otherwise satisfactory product.

Reviews.Title: excellent tv for the price
Reviews.Author: Former buyer
Reviews.Content: excellent tv for the price,unfortunately the first one that i received went black after viewing only 5 hours but i must commend amazon for their quick replacement and so far it's great

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: michael aboumrad
Reviews.Content: Never thought a TV could be this much fun. It does everything. I definitely recommend this product. And it arrived within 3 days of placing the order, can't beat that.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful SmartTV - Just wish it had input on side or front as well as on the back
Reviews.Author: A. ATHAN
Reviews.Content: Great picture, sound and features at a great price.The only thing that I would have liked to see on it is a front or side panel for the input cabling for dvd or wii player.

Reviews.Title: First Rate
Reviews.Author: KJ
Reviews.Content: Really great product for a great price. Super picture and high contrast. Arrived promptly and was easy to mount on a mobile tv stand.

Reviews.Title: Fine for the money
Reviews.Author: mark
Reviews.Content: Fine set The sound is better than my others. It needed to be tweeked, but it works fine not that the adjustments have been made.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Julie
Reviews.Content: TV has very clear picture, and we love the smart TV feature! The size is perfect for our master bedroom! We love it!

Reviews.Title: AWESOME!!!!
Reviews.Author: Darleen
Reviews.Content: The price was great and I believe in LG quality all the way. We have a lot to learn about this smart TV but I know we will love it.

Reviews.Title: Great tv
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: Great tv - great sound excellent picture well worth the money? Delivery was excellent set up was easy could not be more impressed

Reviews.Title: Great TV at a Great Price!
Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: The picture on this TV is amazing! The setup and menus are really easy to do and understand. My only complaint is the sound is pretty average...but I'm sure most people reading this review probably will connect it to a theater system.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Lorraine Steven
Reviews.Content: Picture is fab and price was the best out on the market.  Would highly recommend this television to all .

Reviews.Title: great tv
Reviews.Author: Marlyn
Reviews.Content: excellent picture and sound. i use it every day and it is cheap on energy. never had a better television.

Reviews.Title: Great purchase
Reviews.Author: Robert C. Calhoun
Reviews.Content: Great picture...The newer TV's are so much lighter they are simple to hang and install.  Very happy with quality of LG 47 inch Smart TV

Reviews.Title: Not as "finished" as some, but great picture and a bargain!
Reviews.Author: Leonard A. Robbins
Reviews.Content: Very happy with the purchase, easy to set up and great picture.  The price is what sold me and I'm happy.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: William
Reviews.Content: I've had this for a couple of months now and so far, so good.Great picture, and controls are easy to use once you get the hang of it.As with all of these thin TVs, speakers not as good as the picture.  If you want decent sound, plan on buying a sound bar too.

Reviews.Title: Great picture and sound for a great price
Reviews.Author: Greg Taillon
Reviews.Content: This is a great bargain for the size, image and sound. Very easy install but there is no documentation on how to use the Internet features after you connect to your wireless router(this was easily done just following the instructions). Internet features have changed greatly compare to what you can find on the web. Ex. a web search suggest that Pandora is not available on the LG TVs, but now it is.Need more information about the LG Plus service shown on the Internet screen. There was no documentation about it in the box. Overall we are very happy with the TV and hope it lasts longer than the crappy Samsung we had, which had a component fail causing it to burn a hole in the power Circuit board. We'll never buy a Samsung product again!

Reviews.Title: LG 42inch smart tv
Reviews.Author: shylo
Reviews.Content: Great tv but I should have researched the pros and cons of a "smart" tv before purchasing one.  I really don't need all of the available features.  Much too intrusive.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful picture!!
Reviews.Author: Pamela M. "Pam"
Reviews.Content: Needed a new look in the living room so I chose to replace the big, bulky projection tv.It worked fine and had a great pic, but I thought that this would be a great birthday presentto myself.I just love this tv! The picture is great! Only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was because ofthe audio. It stinks! After messing with it and still not satisfied I ended up hooking up thesurround sound. I only used surround sound for movies, but will need to use it wheneverI watch the tv. Just couldn't find a choice in audio that worked for me.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: William Cintron
Reviews.Content: Purshase the TV for the Netfilx App and I now I can browse the iternet and use Facebook and go on Amozon.com.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: JD
Reviews.Content: Amazing picture quality , good sound and smart tv is very quick way better then vizio best tv I've had.

Reviews.Title: Great Television
Reviews.Author: davi
Reviews.Content: Got this tv for a customer turned out the remote control did not work,but amazon took care of it. The customer loves the tv very much, it also plays movies via the usb. Perfect for a small room or dorm

Reviews.Title: My First LG
Reviews.Author: Ted G. Seel
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for the size. I use it OTA. It is very easy to set up for WiFi and smart TV features. Amazingly good picture, better than my Panasonic plasmas.

Reviews.Title: Tremendous Value
Reviews.Author: PClement
Reviews.Content: After doing plenty of research, while trying to stick to a budget, I decided to go with the LG 50LN5700.  I couldn't be more pleased. I was able to purchase the TV for $720.  The picture is brilliant and the TV is loaded with features.  The wireless connectivity provides access to loads of content.  Just a great TV for the price point.

Reviews.Title: No need for 3D TV!
Reviews.Author: Xeno99
Reviews.Content: I bought 50 inch 50LN5700 LG TV last week and I have been trying it.So far, I am loving it.There is a upgrade version of this LG TV which features 3D and much cooler stand, but it is also 150 bucks more expensive.As a person who tried 3D TV and have seen others who has 3D TV never using their 3D feature, don't buy 3D TV. It's a waste of money, even if it's only 150 bucks more. Alot of channels are starting to drop 3D features for their channels, including ESPN. This TV is perfect for those who wants a nice quality non-3D internet ready smart TV.Some of the features I like- Internet connection through WIFI. This allows me to connect to me wireless router and share between my PC using the home network. I installed the Smart Share software on my PC, which allows me to share my PC contents onto the TV. This was exactly what I needed.- I also installed LG remote app on my iphone, which allows me to move the pointer like a mouse on TV. This TV doesn't come with LG magic remote, but it isn't needed as iphone app is much easier to navigate.- I also have youtube app on my iphone connected with the TV, so that I can watch youtube on my TV when I choose a video on my iphone yotube app.There are many other apps in the LG smart world including amazon prime, pandora etc. I didn't download them as I don't use them, but just knowing they are available is quite nice.If there is con about this TV, it's the shipping. I use Amazon Prime and the TV arrive 3 days late.

Reviews.Title: Very smart TV
Reviews.Author: JLC1
Reviews.Content: I was worried about getting a smart TV, this one is easy to set up and operate. The only thing I could complain about is the built in speakers are not that great. Not to worry my surround sound system is ont the way, and when I receive it I will be rating it so stay tunned.

Reviews.Title: Good TV
Reviews.Author: pamelah
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with this TV.  It was easy to set up, has a good picture and the price was right

Reviews.Title: excellent TV
Reviews.Author: dn2525
Reviews.Content: Love it , I can watch Netflix or Hulu or amazon play games get my email or stud the web.  great picture the menu is very easy to use. best if all is the price .

Reviews.Title: Awesomee
Reviews.Author: Ndjason
Reviews.Content: Great amazing buy!!! Couldn't have gotten a better deal , picture is great , web browser works even better than on some PC's .One of the best decisions I made .Sound to me is great , even though some reviews says otherwise

Reviews.Title: Great lots of extra features
Reviews.Author: Couch Cougar
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is good and has a lot of new features. Easy to use for those of us who are not so techy. Would recommend to everyone. We placed in my mother-in-laws room.

Reviews.Title: decent picture. Have not used the wi fi feature yet.
Reviews.Author: thom cutter
Reviews.Content: need to scale the tv size to the room it is being used in. 42 inch was good but any bigger would probably distort in the size area we have. At 10 feet it is just about right.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous TV
Reviews.Author: A. Jeanie Whitelaw
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with this TV.  It is beautiful.  I am far from a TV expert, but I know what looks good.  And the picture is wonderful.  It was extremely easy to set up.  I do know a bit about computer, so the "Smart" part was easy.  It is a pain to have to use the included remote with the initial set up... but once you have all the stuff typed in, it stays so you don't have to retype.  EVEN if the TV gets unplugged :)  The only, and I mean ONLY issue I have it that, so far, I have found external speakers that I want to buy.  Well, let's say I haven't found external speakers that I want to spend so much money on... I'm using this TV, for the time being, in my bedroom and am not willing to invest in a true home theater audio system.  It deserves it and when the TV is moved to the living room, I will.  But trying to find inexpensive speakers with a subwoofer just isn't working for me.  Again, it is a beautiful TV and everything I had hoped to get... as long as it holds up :)

Reviews.Title: Amazon App Now Here
Reviews.Author: Julia M.
Reviews.Content: Seems this was one of the biggest drawbacks for allot of the reviews i read before purchase. As Brian states below the Amazon app came with the latest firmware update. Picture is very clear at our desired brightness. The frame around the screen is minimalist as also stated but honestly all i care about is the picture. The stand does not swivel but at this price point am not complaining. 4 stars not 5 because of having to buy an optical audio cable (B001TH7GSW to go from the LG to my Onkyo receiver to get my speakers to work with smart apps. All in all a good buy for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Mgirl "My Girl"
Reviews.Content: Love this new smart TV. Beautiful picture and sound.Easy to operate. I would recommend this LG TV.Good buy!

Reviews.Title: LG 42 inch LED-LCD HDTV with Smart TVB
Reviews.Author: Cami
Reviews.Content: This Tv has a beautiful picture.  Isn't as heavy as the previous oneI owned.  I am quite pleased with everythig:  cost, delivery and Dishconnected it for me.  I would highly recommend this brand of TV.I had never heard of LG, so asked Amazon and my daughter andgot good reports, so I am looking forward to many hours of enjoyingmy LG TV

Reviews.Title: Bang for your  buck
Reviews.Author: Cooking Fool
Reviews.Content: Dollar for Dollar this is the best out on the market. Easy to assemble, easy to operate.  Get one soon

Reviews.Title: Love It
Reviews.Author: Ellen P Millner
Reviews.Content: Read tons of reviews on several TV's before making my decision.  The reviews for this TV were consistently good so decided to buy it.  Then did an extensive search for the best price and Amazon had the lowest price by far.  Love the TV and I'm so happy I got it at such a great price.

Reviews.Title: Solid TV
Reviews.Author: mike
Reviews.Content: Amazing picture quality.  Sounds pretty good too.  The Smart TV options are little weak, there aren’t many good applications available, and next to nothing to for internet content that you can download and watch like Google TV.  Any media application are pretty much pay-for-use.  The Smart Link is pretty nice.  I like being able to remotely stream my media from my computer to the television.  However, the smart link seems to drop out pretty continuously, not while streaming thank goodness, but if I want to watch a movie I have to restart my Plex media server for the TV to “see” it, kind of a minor annoyance.  More than anything it a great picture, great quality, weak on the Smart Tv side.

Reviews.Title: LG 32LN5700 LED TV
Reviews.Author: ken54
Reviews.Content: Better picture quality vs. the Vizio M321i-A2. Don't understand why they didn't make it 120Hz. Guess TV companies aren't interested in putting the latest technology in smaller TV's anymore, yet they still serve a purpose. Wish the remote would light up or illuminate in a dark room. For me that should standard equipment in todays world, especially from one of the "Big" TV manufacturers.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: J. Larsen
Reviews.Content: Truly enjoy this TV. Had a 32 and went to this 47.  Now wish I had gone bigger.  Great set.Has even now dropped in prize.  Received in three days.

Reviews.Title: Sa far best TV I have ever purchased.
Reviews.Author: Mercedes "cucuyo"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV just after the POS Samsung I bought just two years ago stop turning on (out of warranty of course). I did not spect much for price but I wanted Smart TV. I was wowed from the moment I turned on - the picture quality is amazing and the features of the smart applications even better. I wish it had ability to download apps I want and are available in later models like amazon instant and I wish the sleep setting was easily set from remote directly...what was that remote designer thinking? But other than that, I'm quite happy with my purchase...let's hope two years from now I'm not back here and this TV lasts as it should.

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: Charles L Fields
Reviews.Content: It is a little slow on the start up but give good picture and comes with icons for most of the better know streaming sites like Prime, Netflix, Hulu, etc.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Roger
Reviews.Content: Great TV for what I need. I already have a plasma for watching sports and movies, but I needed something for the living room that wasn't going to break the bank. The picture on this set is spectacular for the price. Blacks and grays are a little hazy, but that seems to be the case with a lot of LCD TVs. I'd say my only major complaint is that the sound is not impressive at all, so plan to buy a sound bar or stereo if that is important to you.Also, I am using it with my first HTPC, and only realized that DVI is needed to get over 60hz after I bought the set. This set doesn't have a DVI input. Can't fault it for my own ignorance.To sum up: this is a great TV for such a low price!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Sydne Kiester
Reviews.Content: Beautiful picture, love this TV.  I may order the another remote control.  The one the comes with TV is not the best. Easy set up.  Had a great picture in a matter of minutes.

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: fishstyyx
Reviews.Content: TV works really well.  First thing I did was turn off that awful post-processing to up the frame rate (which this does right, but I can't stand it on ANY TV).  TV has been flawless, sufficiently loud, low-power, etc.

Reviews.Title: great pic
Reviews.Author: Milton "mtn biker"
Reviews.Content: this tv has a great picture very small bezel so its not very large and taking up unnecessary space.the smart tv function was not a major selling point for me, but after having it turned on with netflix is very good.the setup is easy and the connection has never died on me while using to watch shows/movies on netflix.I wish there was an Amazon Prime app but maybe someday.  the netflix and crackle apps work very good.JUST A QUICK UPDATE. today 8/25/2013 the tv downloaded and installed an update for the smart TV.Great news there is now an amazon prime app that you can install.I installed it within a few minutes.  It works perfectly and the app looks great, very good layout.Thanks LG

Reviews.Title: Excellent smart TV
Reviews.Author: AshokKumar Chandra Prakasam
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is amazing and it has lot of in built apps. I bought magic remote separately and it makes navigation much easy. Overall very much satisfied with this smart tv

Reviews.Title: A great television.
Reviews.Author: Keith
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with the quality of the picture, television features and ease of use and the price.  I feel that this tv had a better feature/price value than any others that I looked at.  The 120hz refresh rate does make a huge difference over 60hz.

Reviews.Title: Great quality great price
Reviews.Author: J. Moses
Reviews.Content: Purchased for my dad for father's day and he loves it.  Picture is beautiful, sound is great and the sleek design is nice as well.

Reviews.Title: OMG - The picture clarity is wonderful for the 32 inch size.
Reviews.Author: Keith B.
Reviews.Content: The LG 32LN5700 is an LED TV I would highly recommend.  It has an amazing picture, 2 HDMI connections and 1 USB.  It has both wireless & wired network connections.  The price was great from Amazon at under $400 and free shipping.I purchase 2 units.  If you need a TV for the bedroom or guest room  I would recommend LG !!!!

Reviews.Title: Great buy
Reviews.Author: Ysh
Reviews.Content: I love this tv!!!!Delivery was fast, the picture quality is great, the Internet and the apps are very easy to set up, I find my self watching old movies just to see all the details I missed when i watched them the first time..... Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: Awesome television
Reviews.Author: R F Carter
Reviews.Content: I couldn't ask for a better tv.Wonderful color.You can download cool apps too.I would recommend this tv to anyone.Thanks LG.

Reviews.Title: perfect!
Reviews.Author: PhishPhan
Reviews.Content: I know this is just the tip of the iceberg when it comes to smart tvs in the near future, but the picture is amazingly clear, sound is good although I did buy the lg nb3530 sound bar and I couldn t be happier. This tvs wifi with my att uverse wireless receiver is a god send. For $699 through amazon, its a friggin steal. I own all lg tvs, soundbars, washer/dryers etc and have never been let down. Life's Good!

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Adriana
Reviews.Content: The picture is so clear and it is so easy to set up, this is a great product.  I partnered this TV with the LG soundbar and subwoofer, and the sound and picture quality are so great that I have created my own "movie theater" at home.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: J. Dew
Reviews.Content: This TV is easy to set up.  It has many internet app options.  I love Netflix but there are options for educational programs and games for children as well as games for adults.  The magic motion remote is not included with this TV but you can buy it through the set.  It is about $100.00.  I personally like the remote but if you don't plan to use the web browser it might not be worth it to you.  The remote does not have a keyboard but it is easier to navigate the onscreen keyboard with the point and click remote.  Luv the TV.

Reviews.Title: LG 50LN5700 Smart HDTV after 6 weeks (GBay, WI)
Reviews.Author: Dennis A. Mayer
Reviews.Content: I ordered the LG 50LN5700 unit from Amazon via Indianapolis..  TV arrived in 2 days in perfect shape. Box had 1 strapping tear. Most difficult set up item was locating the 120 volt back of set plug hole. Picture quality has been SUPERB!!! I had to turn off the ECO power option due to excessive backlight stepped dimming. As a LG newbie, the tight location of 2 Remote buttons both above & below the OK button caused some early remote mistakes on my part. I got the TV wireless channel to work very well with my AT&T; U-verse wireless router...  Needed just the 10 digit code off the AT&T; residential gateway box.  I even made 2 LG software updates thru the wireless option (not  recommended by LG). My TV & DVD signal feeds all come thru an ONKYO 7.1 Receiver via an LG TV HDMI port. As of yesterday I installed the AN-MR400 Magic Remote via a LG USB port as required on the LN5700 models.  Internet programming is so much easier with the MR400 obtained from Adorama Camera. Both the cable TV picture at 1080i & Internet U-tube screen at 720p HD resolution are wonderful.  Using 1080i U-tube tends to fill up the TV's buffering memory... on occasion. Moving from a 200 Lb Sony 34" CRT HDTV to the modern LG 50LN5700 LED/LCD 40 Lb unit was a wise $868 + $82 MR400 HDTV decision. I'm a very HAPPY TV Camper......

Reviews.Title: Good tv but with some big flaws
Reviews.Author: Gracie
Reviews.Content: I bought this television excited about being able to use the apps and not have to use an HDMI cord to watch Netflix and Amazon videos. However, the wifi chip is very basic aka it doesn't work if you are far away from the router. While your computer may have full wifi bars, the tv will only have 2. And every app is super slow or doesn't work. I couldn't even update my software. Even with a wifi extender it doesn't work. So basically, the ability to connect via wifi is very poor.Also, I have noticed on my family LG5700 that pixels have slowly popped up whenever any fast motion happens. That can get very annoying.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, good sound, easy to set up.
Reviews.Author: AmazonDiva "Keep Calm and Carry On."
Reviews.Content: This LG TV made me change my mind about LCD vs. Plasma TVs. I have a 42 inch Panasonic Plasma and a 37 inch Vizio LCD, and I thought LCDs are just not good enough. However, the LED-LCD TVs are definitely brighter and the picture on this LG is amazing, especially if you configure it in the settings using Picture Wizard.This TV is easy to set up out of the box and the only time you will spend is installing it on the wall or the stand. The rest is plug and play. Once it was connected it guided through the set up on-screen and was up and running in a few minutes. It has the Hulu, Netflix apps but does not have the Amazon Video app yet which was a downer as I have most of my shows on there. However, you can use a Roku box with it.The sound is pretty good for a HDTV. Tweaking the settings make a huge difference for your room. Perfectly adequate for a bedroom TV sound.The internet and apps also run fast on this TV. The remote is very basic but LG offers a Magic Remote or you can use the iPhone app LG provides which is necessary for typing in through the keyboard. The user interface is a bit different from other brands as expected but not too bad.The best part is that this TV is SO much lighter than my plasma. That makes a huge difference in being able to place it on furniture or hang it on a wall. Just carrying it up the stairs was so easy!Overall, it's a nice TV in this price range with an excellent picture and decent sound.

Reviews.Title: So far I have enjoyed this kind of product
Reviews.Author: perry connolly
Reviews.Content: So far I have enjoyed this kind of product. One main reason why I took one star away from five stars rating was that it advertised wrongly about the number.....120Hz. In truth I get 60Hz. Very subtle error that I don't really notice until recently. Just wanted to let viewers know.....

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY THIS TV OR ANY LG PRODUCT
Reviews.Author: Cindy McNatt
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product December 6th of 2012.  Within 5 months of purchase I had to have a repair person because it had sound, but no picture.  It took 4 more repairs between April and June of 2013 to repair the product.  The TV worked okay from June 2013 to January of 2014 when the same problem occurred.  After calling the Customer No Service Line I was asked to send the receipt and they would review my case and MIGHT give me a new TV.  However, after review they said NO because it was out of warranty. Now they are sending m;y case for yet another review to possibly extend the warranty which will allow them to send yet another repair person.  I have had to take time off from work each of the 5 times they have sent repair people before, and I will have to take time off yet again for the 6th repair.  The service from this company is horrible, please do not buy any products from them.

Reviews.Title: Not as advertised
Reviews.Author: Terry
Reviews.Content: From the start,I had some issues with the tv sound. It sounded real tinny.  After a few days of adjusting the sound settings, I got rid of most of the tinny sound.The picture quality wasn't all that good either. The true motion part is a joke. When there is a lot of action ( sports or movies) its still fussy looking no matter how I set the settings.  Over all it was' t as good a product as I thought it would be. I don't think I would recommend this model to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Connectivity
Reviews.Author: dijon99
Reviews.Content: I was unable to connect this TV to my Wi-Fi.  I tried everything, even ran an ethernet cable to the TV, but nothing worked.  Yet my Roku, which sat next to the TV, connected with no problem on Wi-Fi.  So I decided to get a dumb TV and use my Roku to connect to Wi-Fi.  I returned the LG 47LN5700.

Reviews.Title: Picture, sound, vivid sharpness,
Reviews.Author: Jan Robinson
Reviews.Content: we could not be happier! Bought on another site for a great savings, a Samsung like this LG, but it was damaged and we got a full refund and looked on Amazon. I used a gift card account balance and got the best we could ever have dreamed of. My husband may never take me to the walk in movies again!

Reviews.Title: Do not buy if you want to watch livestreaming sports
Reviews.Author: ga-l
Reviews.Content: The main reason I bought this TV was because it has a web browser that supposedly was Flash-friendly--meaning I could watch livestreaming that's Flash-based--i.e., tennis matches.  It has a Linux web browser that has an outdated version of Flash, and it cannot download Flash updates from website. It also cannot block popups.  When I tried to access live matches, I either had a "connection failed" statement on screen or at least 5 popups that I was not able to escape.  When I attempted a workaround by connecting my laptop via HDMI, I still was not able to access the livestreams; even though they appeared on the laptop screen, the connection failed on TV.  Please note I was able to get the livestreams on both my other laptops [that were not connected to the TV] simultaneously; thus I and the multiple technicians I consulted do not believe network strength/connection is the problem.  I'm writing this review so others won't waste time.  If you don't need to use this TV in this manner, then it might be OK for you.  Also I found the Magic Remote to be a nuisance when trying to get/use a cursor on screen; a remote keyboard works much better.

Reviews.Title: It is what it is...
Reviews.Author: Joe Feldhouse
Reviews.Content: I will break this down into 5 categories:Picture: B-Looks/Aesthetics: ASmart TV functionality: C+Sound: B+Value: AOverall this TV is a great value. I was a bit disappointed with the picture quality (even after messing with it a bunch), and the Smart TV part of the set is highly lacking, in my opinion. But for the price I payed ($660) I don't think you'll find a better value.

Reviews.Title: died in 2 weeks
Reviews.Author: J. Haggard
Reviews.Content: UPDATED REVIEWI have had this TV for just under 2 weeks. It worked perfectly and all of a sudden tonight it started to reboot itself constantly. Sometimes it would stay on for 5 minutes, other times it would reboot after seconds and it got stuck in a loop. I tried resetting the TV, I tried unplugging the TV, I tried a number of "tricks" and finally called LG support. They are sending a tech out to my house to check on the TV.This may just be bad luck that this TV died so quick, but I have never had an issue with a TV this soon after receiving it. I appreciate LG sending a tech out, but the fact is I shouldn't have needed to call for support this soon. Also, LG gave me a 4 hour window for a tech to come out. Would be nicer if they could narrow down a time window so I don't have to take off half a day from work.I would consider this TV a don't buy at this point. It is far to expensive and the quality of the unit I received is lacking. Below is my original review where I recommend a different model. LG support is stepping up, but the fact is I have a $600 TV that died in less then 2 weeks and now have to have a tech come to my house.Once the tech arrives I'll update this review.--------------My original reviewLet me start by saying I received a unit to review.The TV arrived via UPS, the box itself was a bit damaged but the TV was not damaged.Upon unpacking there are 3 parts. The Main screen, the bottom of the stand and the bracket that goes on the back of the tv and attaches to the base of the stand.All together it takes 7 screws to put the TV together, make sure you have a philips screwdriver with a medium to long handle.Once the TV is assembled it's sturdy, the TV is replacing an old 32" flat screen that is around 8 years old, this new TV even at 10" bigger screen size weighs 1/3 the weight. This thing is light!The display looks great. Its really clear even in standard def. When first turning the TV on it walks you through a setup process. It actually has a calibration mode it goes through as well where it asks you to tweak settings like sharpness, contrast, brightness, etc.When using the TV in standard mode (non-hd connections) it looks good and sounds great. When hooking it up to the internet to stream video which may be HD the TV has a really fast "motion" to it, almost like the video is fast forwarding while the audio is normal speed. This is not something I observed in standard TV mode, only when using online apps. I tried several video apps on the TV and they all did the same weird effect. I went into settings turned off all motion controls, etc to try to resolve and it still looks weird. I also tried streaming video ranging from SD to HD to the super HD that vudu has.  Now this isn't a router issue, I tested using the onboard speed test app within vudu and it showed I had optimal connections so this has to be a TV issue. Sadly, there was not an Amazon Instant Video app when I looked so I couldn't test that video.So, for standard TV viewing, HD, as well as BluRay it works great. For online, I had a weird video speed issue although the video did start playing very quickly.Also, the app store. Sure this thing has a lot of apps but none I use. I looked for Plex, it wasn't available (but plex is supported through upnp which the TV does have), I looked for NHL game center, not there. Xfinity TV not present. Want to watch amazon instant video? Can't do it here. There really is not a large selection of popular apps I find useful on the TV. I am no gamer so the hundreds of games don't do it for me. I will add though the TV menus and smart app screens are really snappy with almost no lag when moving between them, I'm guessing thanks to the dual core technology. I did have one instance when the entire menu locked up and I let it sit for a few minutes and it finally responded but that was only one time.Also, there is a "magic remote" that will allow you to control your cable box.... But it's sold seperately. For a TV of this size (42") to cost in the $600 range and NOT include this smarter remote is obscene. You can buy the same size TV from Vizio (VIZIO E420i-A1 42-inch 1080p 120Hz LED Smart HDTV) for several hundred less. I will add I have a 60" vizio LED and love it so Vizio is a good brand.I just can't recommend you spend $600+ on this TV from LG. Yes it looks good, yes it is light weight, yes it is "smart" but it doesn't warrant a premium price tag in my opinion. If you are loyal to the LG brand you'll want to get this. If you are looking for a great TV at a reasonable cost then I would recommend you pass on this TV and instead go with the other one mentioned.If LG were to include the smart remote then that would help justify a little of the cost. If there was a larger selection of apps available that would help. Overall though the value just doesn't make sense for me to choose this over a competitor. For the reasons stated above I'm giving it a 3, I like it because it is a good TV, but the price is what really doesn't work for me and makes me knock off a few stars.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: Easy Reader "Berti"
Reviews.Content: Love the price, the picture, the clever smart options.  Easy install.  Best Buy for the size and picture. Yeaaaaaa LG

Reviews.Title: Not as many Apps as I thought
Reviews.Author: D. Ayers
Reviews.Content: I bought the TV for its ability to use apps.  I had hoped it would work like my iPad and I guess I didn't do a good enough job researching because it didn't have the apps that I use a lot like HBO Go, Showtime and Watch ESPN available.  Also if you don't get the special remote control it is very burdensome to navigate around the Smart TV section.  As a regular TV, the picture is good.

Reviews.Title: Great picture.
Reviews.Author: Beachgirl
Reviews.Content: This is my first HD tv.  I was replacing an older analog tv, and wanted great value for the money and I got that.  There is a bit of an issue hooking up an older receiver, but that can be solved with an adapter.  Excellent picture, easy to use, lots of features.

Reviews.Title: Horrible TV
Reviews.Author: angie montes
Reviews.Content: Horrible Tv.  I just got it yesterday and the tv keeps turning off and on by itself. I just did a little research on this and realize many people have the same issue and LG does not take care of it or even care about their customers.  I just wish I had read all this reviews before making the choice of buying this TV.  Do  yourself a favor and buy another brand.

Reviews.Title: Auto reset
Reviews.Author: Manuel-Vzla
Reviews.Content: Any of you had been experienced problems with ln57 smart 47", when I have a los of time with tv on do an auto reset  or turn off, then turn no by itself? I don't know what's happen?

Reviews.Title: LG425700 the Holy Grail of larger TVs. One with a head phone outlet !
Reviews.Author: della sumner
Reviews.Content: I was told it couldn't be found even by LG themselves. In my lengthy internet & telephone search I happened upon a review of the LG5700by Crutchfield electronics who listed the lowly headphone outlet as a feature on this model. To be sure I called and was told it was true, the helpful person even double checked a visual layout of the back of the TV.  I was so grateful I would have bought it from them if I could afford a new one, but I needed to buy used to get this higher end TV with the seemingly extinct outlet.In my research I learned a lot of people would like this option, for many different reasons.I had learned way down the road that there was a solution via an adapter that can be connected to the digital optical/audio output outlet but that required 2 cables and a jack connector to hook it up. Totaling a 4 part purchase and more crap around the TV, on top of which you could not control the volume with the remote. To remedy that you needed wireless headphones with volume control in them (expensive & bulky) or buy small volume controls you plug your headphones or ear buds into. These are only $10.00 at Radio Shack but you have more wires to get tangled in.We had the LG425400 which we returned when by not giving up,I found the 5700 had the headphone outlet. LG claims they are the exact same except for the smart features but there is a difference in the bezel which is a mat finish instead of shiny. The back is a little different in that it has a 3rd HDMI outlet & of course the headphone outlet. So its obvious more has been done than just adding the smart options, the picture seems a little better and the remote is nicer.Set up is more complicated with the wireless because its less familiar but between LG but mainly the cable company it was OK. The big tip was using the ethernet cable way of connectingAfter all I am glad to have the smart TV, less wires and a Roku box we can now use elsewhere , it was a very long journey of hours spent and loads of misinformation to slog through, I know too much about TVs at this point,I sure hope this helps some other poor slob out there in Gizmo Land.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, frate rate isn't ideal for 120Hz
Reviews.Author: seprice
Reviews.Content: This is a really strong 1080p HDTV, the picture looks fantastic with practically every kind of content. With that said, the 120Hz is supposed to help sustain a strong frame rate, but the picture occasionally jags during especially fast-moving scenes, such as during live hockey. Also, the speakers kinda blow, but that's understandable for a mid-level, super-thin HDTV.Samsung probably makes better models within a similar price range, but otherwise, I'd happily recommend this LG TV to a friend.

Reviews.Title: good but not great
Reviews.Author: Damian
Reviews.Content: First off for those of you who say this is better than a plasma you are on crack. I have a Panny in my home theater and there is zero comparison. Ferrari vs Kia. The only thing better is the smart TV apps (Panny does a poor job on this) and brightness which is a better for hockey or bright rooms. My plasma is in a bright room and I have no issues. Hockey does look good though with the LG...but that's it folks.  Everything else is garbage. Colors are blazing like every LED, motion blur blows, and the soap opera affect is super annoying (even with motion smoother turned off the panny kicks butt). Let's just say the TV was free and its in the bedroom, so when my eyes fatigue me I can press power and go to sleep.

Reviews.Title: beautiful tv
Reviews.Author: Will and Carole
Reviews.Content: I'd get another one in a flash! Like it, love it, want it, you get one too now...not later. Good

Reviews.Title: WOW!!
Reviews.Author: Laurie S. Brown
Reviews.Content: This TV is amazing.  Just set it up last night so I haven't had a chance to check out all the features yet.  But Set Up was super easy except that it didn't come with all the screws needed to attach the stand to the TV.Right out of the box, the Picture was perfect! No need to sit and fiddle with that for hours and hours trying to get the right tint, warmth, and what have you.  Now, to see if its got stamina.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for.
Reviews.Author: Hani Esmaeili
Reviews.Content: During the holidays (and now as well), you could have bought a 46-50" TV for the same price as this one. Most people would think, "That's over a foot bigger, why would I pay more for less and buy this LG TV?" Because quality.The display has an IPS panel, which means great viewing angles and better color reproduction/picture quality. The display is so nice, I have actually started using it as a secondary monitor for my laptop (retina MacBook Pro).Aside from that, the TV comes with a lot of built-in applications (e.g. Netflix, Hulu, YouTube, etc.), which means you can stream to your heart's content out of the box.Overall, this is a great TV and I've been very happy with it in the month I've owned it.

Reviews.Title: Very happy
Reviews.Author: EasyE
Reviews.Content: I was torn between this tv and the Samsung 46 inch 6300 series.  I ended up choosing this mainly because of the great price and I couldn't be happier.  The picture is fantastic and can be easily set to your preference using the picture wizard.  Watching blu ray movies on this set is incredible.  Lg also has a great remote control smart phone app which makes navigating through the different features and browsing the web a breeze.  I am very satisfied with this purchase and highly recommend this smart tv!

Reviews.Title: Does NOT pass 5.1 audio
Reviews.Author: Duncan Ross "nature lover"
Reviews.Content: This TV does not pass 5.1 Audio out the optical output if the source is HDMI.  It down mixes it to stereo.  This is not mentioned in any of the ads or the manual.  This makes using it with your receiver very difficult.

Reviews.Title: LG TV works great
Reviews.Author: collegebob
Reviews.Content: Have been using the TV for a month with no problems. Was easy to assemble and hook up. Highly rated by Consumer Reports and worth the price.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't be more pleased!
Reviews.Author: rick aquila
Reviews.Content: This was my first HD TV.  I did a lot of looking and researching before purchasing, I also travel a lot so I've used almost every brand in various hotels. The picture is perfect, clear and bright. Channel changing is fast (no long delay).  Set up was simple (I think), my son set it up for me. I didn't get the smart remote, but the one that came with it works just fine. The smart features let me access the internet, netflix, pandora, and several other sites. The sound is fine, I didn't get a sound bar or special speakers, and for my needs don't need them. Today is NEW Years day, I'm watching the Bowl Games and LIFE IS GOOD...LG

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Kischa Askew
Reviews.Content: The LG 39 inch Smart TV is awesome.  I love the clarity of the picture with the exception that it darkens when the lights are low or turned off.  I would definitely recommend this product to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: Must buy
Reviews.Author: Cy
Reviews.Content: I love this tv, very user friendly and the picture quality is awesome.  To compare my old HDTV to this one, I feel like I've been watching tv through a coke bottle, the new tv is truly high definition.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Smart TV, Brilliant Price
Reviews.Author: Chris Thompson
Reviews.Content: PROS:- Beautiful Image Quality- Multiple options for adjusting color, brightness, picture, etc- SmartTV interface is robust and intuitive- Plenty of HDMI ports- Intuitive UI for feed switching, system updates, options, etcCONS:- Only compatible with LG Webcam for Skyping- HFR option (TruMotion?) is obnoxiously persistent- Mobile App is inconsistent- No RCA audio out

Reviews.Title: good TV
Reviews.Author: Stephen Chiapellone
Reviews.Content: This is a good TV. Plug it in and go. Easy to use remote. Good pitcher. 3 hdmi and 3 subparts. Great. Wish it had more audio in ports.

Reviews.Title: Great picture - Poor audio
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV to replace a Vizio SV470XVT1A, the picture is great on this set, obviously it crushes my old Vizio, it has a very easy setup that only takes a couple of minutes to complete. The built in speakers leave a lot to be desired, the sound will echo & crackle a lot of course from what I've read and observed from comparable TV's. It would be great if the MAGIC Remote was included cause I'm NOT spending $80 on a remote when I have to buy a quality sound bar or home theater system to have passable audio. I'm not a picture snob, I set up a custom profile that works good for TV, Movies & Gaming, yeah sometimes it has to be altered a bit depending what I'm watching or playing but that takes all of 2 or 3 minutes to do. The SMART TV Menu & Apps are great, like everything else out there you get Netflix, Hulu Plus, Amazon, Facebook etc... What I really like is that it's a very easy to navigate, for the past 18 months I had a 42" Vizio M421VT which is a very dumb SMART TV, the menu is extremely rough and takes a while to navigate, thankfully after dealing with many issues with that TV, Square Trade has seen fit to cut me a check for the original purchase price & let me replace it with something new. If I could merge one thing from either of my old Vizio TV's into my LG 50LN5700 it would be the built in speakers.Now that I'm going to be buying a TV to replace the Vizio M421VT (The Master Bedroom TV) I've got to find something that has a great picture and good built in sound cause I'm not putting a surround sound system in my bedroom, it's for this reason that I won't be buying a 42 or 47 inch LN5700. The LN5700 uses Direct LED which so far seems to produce a better picture, I've read lots of pros & cons to both Edge lit & Direct LED, my dead Vizio M421VT was a Edge Lit TV and the picture was good, but it did sometimes have trouble with some finer images.Overall I think the 50LN5700 was the right choice for our family room, it's a little bigger than the previous TV, the picture is much better & we now have the ability to stream video content on the TV without having to power up a gaming console to do so. The WiDi function is also pretty cool, so far I've only used it to do a slide show of vacation pictures from my iPhone, but I understand I can do much more with this feature and will enjoy exploring this further.If necessary I will update my review and rating of this TV as I see fit.I hope this can be of use to someone making a choice on a new TV for the holiday season.

Reviews.Title: LG 50LN5700...bad investment
Reviews.Author: Amresh Singh
Reviews.Content: I got this tv 2 days back but from the movement I switched ON for first time I felt that Sound is not good. I thought it might be some settings so tried changing them but no difference.Good part is picture quality and mobile remote connectivity.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, just a few small issues
Reviews.Author: Lorelei Taylor
Reviews.Content: We love the TV, color and clarity are good.  The only reason I gave it 4 out of 5 is because sometimes we have to select an app multiple times before the "network not connected" warning goes away.  A few clicks and it works, just strange how that happens.  I also wish it came with the motion controller.  Otherwise a fantastic TV with great sound.

Reviews.Title: Great image not great performance
Reviews.Author: Bennett N Walker
Reviews.Content: Has really beautiful macro images, excellent for people who love food channels! Unfortunately, there is a noticeable lag when watching fast action events (such as sports).

Reviews.Title: Mostly Good
Reviews.Author: David Faulkner
Reviews.Content: I bought this 42" LG 42LN5700 as a replacement for an old RCA 32" CRT TV.It arrived pristine within 2 days with free shipping.How things have changed; buying high ticket fragile items online!There was some physical difficulty removing the old RCA 32" CRT TV which was surprisingly heavy.This old TV cost more than $850 when it was purchased almost 20 years ago.The experience of installing the LG Smart TV was positive apart from the remote which has limited capabilities.The LG 42LN5700 TV does not come with the LG Magic Remote.Without the LG Magic Remote many features of the LG Smart TV are unavailable.There are different versions of LG Magic Remote; I have model AN-MR400 for 2013 TVs.The LG Magic Remote is expensive; I paid about $70 but the price ranges from $50 to more than $100.The LG Magic Remote can be programmed through the TV to control a cable box and a Blu-Ray player and probably more.I set up the LG Magic Remote to manage my Comcast cable box and Sony Blu-Ray player.The set up of the cable box uses your ZIP code and gives a rich experience setting up the cable box.I was pleasantly surprised.Of course like many features of this TV, managing multiple devices only works with the LG Magic Remote.The LG Magic Remote is a little short of great; I rate it 4 out of 5.I am disappointed I don't see HBO GO as an available LG SmartTV App. This is not ROKU!I don't like that some 4:3 content such as Star Trek Episodes on Amazon cannot be zoomed to 16:9 as on Samsung and Sharp TVs.This restriction may be only for HD content but there is nothing to tell you that.I rate the TV at 3.5 out of 5;  online most rate the TV at 5 out of 5.DVF

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: S. A. Brown "Avid Reader"
Reviews.Content: It is a great TV. I love it. Color is great. No problem setting it up. I'm enjoying it very much.

Reviews.Title: Great Purchase
Reviews.Author: W. Schuler "Bird Errr"
Reviews.Content: Great design.  It has a beautiful picture and I like that the channels appear quickly between selections.  The dimensions are perfect for our room.

Reviews.Title: Excellent picture quality
Reviews.Author: KD
Reviews.Content: We are very pleased with the picture quality and the features.  The sound is so-so, and needs to be enhanced.

Reviews.Title: Not bad for a second set
Reviews.Author: Barry N. Wilensky
Reviews.Content: Pretty good once you tame the too-hot color palette. I'm actually a plasma fan, but this one went into our bedroom. I'm using it only as a second tv, so all the features are unused. Setup was very easy, and the set has already had two software updates that went through without a hitch. Chose this because of reviews and my bias against Samsung. Also, when I looked at the sets at a big box store, the LG sets all looked more natural than the Samsung.If you are sensitive to motion artifacts, all LCD (and so-called LED) sets may exhibit annoying moments at times. They are more annoying on older tv shows and certain sporting events. All-in-all this set does a good job on most material. It will not outperform a good plasma set, though.

Reviews.Title: Need help with connecting
Reviews.Author: John Hurlbut
Reviews.Content: Great picture, love it as a TV, but still have to use cable box and remote to change channels (although sound is now controlled by the "magic remote").  I have wifi and I think I got that connected but not sure how to access the internet... I am not a technical person (obviously), and wondering if anyone can give me some advice on how to solve these problems?  I tried calling LG but got someone in India who kept telling to get a new cable box (this is not the problem).

Reviews.Title: Great TV, On Time Delivery
Reviews.Author: GTO
Reviews.Content: Great TV.  Easy setup.  Delivered on time as promised by Amazon.  Super picture.  Be aware that like many of the thin LED TVs the speaker quality and sound on this TV is terrible.  Had to buy sound bar to understand program spoken content.  Be aware that while this is SMART TV there are many suppliers that have provided no APP - example Slingbox,  HBOGO, ShowtimeAnywhere, etc.  So make sure TV will do what you want before you buy.

Reviews.Title: smart or not smart enough
Reviews.Author: Clement Rodney "DJANGO"
Reviews.Content: This is the first TV I have ever bought, I didnt brought this tv from Amazon... first off, This TV "32ln5700" was showing great right out of the box, I was seeing all the premium apps netflix etc, then I did the not so smart thing by upgrading the firmware 3.20.12 to 3.20.21 to 4.00.30(this last update causes the TV to have frozen black screen when I tried to access the smartshare functions).SO SAD that you cannot rollback the firmware update.I even tried to flash it over by the flashdrive method, with format optionS from FAT,FAT32 and NTFS, I have also place the unzipped and zip file on the three(3) different DRIVES, With no luck at all because the TV wont recognize the file.First I am no longer seeing the netflix app, I have to select the premium tab then it would go to an other page showing the netflix app and some other apps I wasnt seeing before the update, then when I select it,it would ask me to initialize the app or something like that, then the TV would restart,sometimes I would see the netflix app sometime I don't and if I don't move fast enough to select netflix it would change back to showing the normals apps OR sometimes it would just freeze for about 15 seconds at this time you cannot do anything at all with the TV, there is no response at all,no matter what you do then after the 15 or so seconds, it would restart back to the normal channel viewing.when you select smart button it would ask you to agreed to some user policy if you don't you cannot access the other function of the TV (internet, smartshare and the premium menu etc), other than just watching the programs on the channel,a next thing most of the app that I saw so far are useless and not much either to select from. I hope that in the very very near future that there is a patch that would give consumer abundantly apps to choose from.a very much concerning thing, is the fact that this model is NOT a 3D TV, no problem with that, BUT why must I have to see the "cinema3D HDTV" splash screen every time I select the smartshare option,why would you LG do consumers that, we didn't want a 3D TV, so please I would like a patch that do not show me that splash screen.using the normal remote to access the internet could be a challenge, luckily I have an extra wireless keyboard and mouse..when I tried to download an app it would tell me "before I can purchase the free apps" why would I purchase something that is FREE?let me just say that I like the build its neat and light, the screen image is very clear, vivid and easy on the eyes, the audio is moderateIF there is a patch or firmware update to fix these problems issues then this will be great...

Reviews.Title: Works Fine!!
Reviews.Author: Sheena
Reviews.Content: Remote should have been more easy to use.You might require sound bar while streaming movies since sometimes volume is very very low.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: B. Cox
Reviews.Content: The new tv is a great fit for our livingroom, has clear picture, and, over-all, we have nothing but praise.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: Carl Turk
Reviews.Content: Very good picture quality, easy user interface, lots of features.  Best combination for the price. We love our new TV.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: jess
Reviews.Content: I have had this tv since June. I couldn't be more pleased. The quality is so perfect I can't believe how crisp the picture is. My only complaint is the sound isn't the greatest but we got surround sound for it so that isn't a big deal. Like I said, the picture quality is worth it. I love how its a smart tv and don't have to have to go through my ps3 for Netflix and YouTube. The price I paid for this was a steal. Nobody believes me when I tell them I paid far less than a grand. Thanks!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Spectacular 3D TV
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I had no idea when I bought this tv that it was 3D.  It looks amazing and you don't need any of those hokey glasses either.  This went into the master bedroom along with a Yamaha soundbar and my wife and I find ourselves choosing to watch tv in the bedroom instead of in the living room on our 55" television.  We are very impressed with the picture quality on this LG!  We also love that it is a smart TV that we can watch Netflix or listen to Pandora with.  Setup and connection to our home WiFi was simple.  I have nothing negative to say about this TV.  We bought this size so it would fit into our TV cabinet so if you need a TV this size...buy it!

Reviews.Title: Great TV, overall
Reviews.Author: NMS403
Reviews.Content: Great TV for the price, over all.  Sounds isn't the BEST and we really need to play around with the picture functions when switching between types of programming (reality TV, sitcoms, sporting events, movies, etc.), but its not really a big deal.

Reviews.Title: Bought it for my home office.
Reviews.Author: Douglas A DiNunzio
Reviews.Content: Very good but not great. Certainly good enough for a home office. The audio is a little weak as most flat panel TVs are of this size and price, and for some reason it won't sync up to my laptop when I connect it up to an HDMI port. Other than that... Wi-Fi synced up quickly and easily, already upgraded it from the web which was simple. Good TV for the price.

Reviews.Title: just the right size!
Reviews.Author: Lizzie
Reviews.Content: Great size for small condo, not overwhelming.  My husband can know see the baseball scores in the corner.  color excellent.Clear and bright.  excellent sound levels.

Reviews.Title: WOW
Reviews.Author: Amazon UserOne
Reviews.Content: I bought a 47 inch  TV because it was a smart TV and LED. The APPS and internet are just great. Picture quality is very good, what you can expect from 1080P TVs and sound was good.  Very light, just about 30 lbs.  Remote is fun to use.

Reviews.Title: LG 50LN5700 50-inch Smart TV
Reviews.Author: JB in CLT
Reviews.Content: This TV is great!  It's my fourth flat-screen TV and was by far the easiest to set up.  The picture is amazing when you set it to the "Vivid" setting.  Unbelievable clarity in HD when using an HDMI cable.  The picture is better than my Samsung, RCA and Proscan flat screens.  I've only had it a week now, so not sure how it will perform over time, but love this TV so far.

Reviews.Title: OK picture, poor experience with every other aspect of it.
Reviews.Author: Andrew Jennings
Reviews.Content: If you're going to buy a TV, the panel in this one is decent once you adjust the settings. No problem there.However, every part of the "LG Smart TV" experience is frustrating:* The TV is slow to start up and react to button presses.* There are a lot of garbage apps installed that you cannot remove or even shuffle out of the way in the interface.* Applications are arbitrarily broken into "My Apps" and "Smart Apps". You can't mix and match the two so if you want to make a "card" with just your local file server, Netflix and the few apps you use - tough luck.  My Apps are always at the bottom of the screen and Smart Apps require a button press to load up a web interface (with an ad in it).* The web site for "smart world" is terrible. I haven't been able to log in for a week or even reset my password.  Despite having an email that I used to "verify" my account with a click, I'm always told that my account doesn't exist.* The customer service is slow and comes from a "no-reply" address. Which means you have to use the web site for every issue, dealing with a new person and starting over from scratch with every email.I've had this TV for a week and cannot recommend it.  I thought this would be easier to use than my set-top box/TV setup but it's no where near as convenient, efficient or pleasant as using a "dumb" TV with an Apple TV/Roku/HTPC, etc.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing Product
Reviews.Author: Michael A King
Reviews.Content: I just don't get it. A product for which I had high expectations, is such a disappointing television. LG has a reputation for manufacturing quality electronics and I've had positive experiences in the past. The major issue is that the default screen setting is a picture width far wider than the screen. Why did I purchase a 47" TV for 25 percent of the screen area to have no picture?Under the "Zoom" aspect ratio, the picture nearly fills the screen. But part of the picture is lost (hence the name) and the motion is choppy -- especially with sporting events. I will concede that I'm far from a technology expert. So maybe there is a way to fix this issue. But that's not exactly relevant, since the majority of the purchasers of this product likely have similar skills and knowledge.The sound is terrible. This is not up for discussion. If you intended to purchase speakers or connect it to a surround-sound system, then this is not an issue. However, there are some consumers who expect to use the TV as manufactured. Apparently LG does not understand this.Most of my frustration is derived from the decline in overall quality from previous versions of this TV. A friend owns a similar one that is 1-2 years older. Great product; excellent sound and picture. Consumers expect quality to increase as technology advances. The "smart" features are certainly great. But they are far from worth the decline in sound and picture quality.I suppose the massive discounts offered by Amazon for the product should have been a red flag. Perhaps at the right price point, this TV would offer value. But it better be less than $550 for the 47".

Reviews.Title: SPY MACHINE
Reviews.Author: Sir Prize
Reviews.Content: SPYWARE!Be aware that LG collects all viewing information and names of files from connected devices and sends it to their servers.  LG is acting like the NSA of South Korea.  So if you do not want your personal information collected, either do not buy this TV, or do not connect it to the internet.  That begs the question:why spend more for an internet ready TV?Furthermore, LG sends all TVs out with a configuration setting "Collection of watching info".enabled.  This can be set to either ON or OFF. So you would think setting to off would stop the spying.  The answer is NO!  The same information is collected and sent to LG.  The only difference is a status bit is switched from 1 to 0 but the information is still being sent.According to Mr. Huntley, an IT consultant who published the article, LG's response is that "by using the TV he had accepted LG's terms and conditions, and that any remaining concerns should be directed to the retailer who had sold him the screen."  So for me, that was Amazon and I am contacting them by this review.Without the SPYWARE problem, I would have rated the TV a solid 4 to 5 stars.  Unfortunately, I thought I was buying an internet ready TV, not a spy machine.See the current BBC article: " LG investigates Smart TV 'unauthorised spying' claimBy Leo Kelion, Technology reporter.  This may be currently found using the following link;[...]

Reviews.Title: LG should do better
Reviews.Author: dyw_houston
Reviews.Content: 1. It's not a smart tv. It's a part of smart tv. You have to buy a smart remote control to make it a smart tv. Otherwise it worse than a stupid tv. (I'm talking about internet browser function).2. Remote control not sensitive. You have 20% of chance to misfire your control.3. There's no "Caption" button on the remote control. You may have to push several buttons several times to turn caption function on.4. There's no caption on screen when you mute your tv that is common in most tvs.

Reviews.Title: LG VERY UNRELIABLE  BRAND
Reviews.Author: Guillermo M.
Reviews.Content: I bought a lg smart tv 6 month ago in costco at first I was very impress the look of it the function and the HD picture 6 month later the power supply died on the tv the reason I know cuz I took to a repair man and luck trying to get their manufacturer I year warranty to fix the problem so fa I had not had any luck

Reviews.Title: Test your TVs!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "黒ケビ"
Reviews.Content: In recent weeks, we've seen the amazing issues that happen when you don't write tests for your code. In the case of a certain Cupertino company, this has resulted in an amazingly stupid SSL bug that would have been fixed had they written unit tests.Well, the same applies to hardware. In the case of LG, they failed to do QA testing for audio handling, and it shows.Here's how you can tell if your TV clearly wasn't tested:Step 1: Take a laptop, and search for a site (or video) that does left-right audio channel tests.Step 2: Play the audio back with your laptop speakers or with headphones first just to ensure it's coming out in the correct channel.Step 3: Plug your laptop into one of the HDMI ports (for me it was HDMI2) on the side, and retry the test. The channels will be reversed. Left is coming out on the right side, and right on the left.Step 4: Even worse, now try using optical out. The channels will *still* be reversed. This means that it is altering the signal on the way out.Step 5: Try another HDMI port (I had luck with HDMI3), and you might get different results.Seriously, how does this happen??? How do you mix up this wiring?? (And or the software, which, if the case, everyone has this issue)On the bright side, given how cheap this TV is (and I didn't mean inexpensive here, in light of this stupid issue), I can just pay for a receiver unit and switch my audio via that.By the way, this TV is great in other ways. Just not audio handling.

Reviews.Title: Inferior Picture Quality - no matter how much you mess with the settings
Reviews.Author: Sterling Jones
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV to replace a Panasonic Plasma that died.  Immediately noticeable is the dull color rendition and the very grey presentation of black.  No wrangling with the various adjustments could get the picture as sharp and vibrant as my previous set.  It is passable but this is not an impressive display - very ordinary at best.  All else in terms of smart features is satisfactory and connectivity has been without issue.  Sound quality is also unremarkable so if you don't anticipate connecting this to a surround sound system and need to rely on it for audio then this unit is only acceptable.  Overall I'm disappointed as I was expecting a unit on par with the Panasonic and this is definitely not competing on picture.  Hopefully it will surpass the Panasonic in terms of reliability - that shouldn't take much.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Trann Porter
Reviews.Content: This TV has a beautiful picture. It's like you are the person holding the camera. When using the Netflix app it loads very fast. The only reason that I gave this 4 stars (I would give it 4.5 stars if I could) instead of 5 stars is the sound. The sound is very tinny and it sounds like it is coming out of a laptop or computer. This is nothing that a sound-bar won't fix I'm sure. I agree with others and think that as the technology progresses to allow for thinner TVs it compromises the sound. It's definitely not a deal breaker simply because of the Beautiful picture. I would recommend to anyone. UPDATE I did find out that if you turn off the surround sound setting on the TV the sound is much better. I still think a sound-bar would improve it.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Jeffplaysmoog "jrg611"
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV a few days ago and I am, thus far, very impressed with the quality.  The unit is very light, well built, and has adequate connections (although I wish there were separate composite and component connections - three HDMI ports are very nice).  I echo the complaint about the speakers that I have read in other reviews, however, at the same time, I would say they are decent enough and in line with what I expected (I use optical out to connect to my computer sound card).  The picture is good for the price, and, although there is a bit of judder here and there, I am really enjoying the quality.  The SmartTV functions are also very interesting and the interface is very responsive.  I have used the web browser and the DNLA service to stream movies from my Mac and everything functions well.  I own an Apple TV so I have not tested Netflix, Hulu, etc. but they are readily accessible and it's probably hard to screw up these services.  Overall I give this unit 4 stars and highly recommend it (purchased the unit for around $450).

Reviews.Title: Nice, very nice!
Reviews.Author: Ray-of-Light "Rayolite"
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV to replace a Samsung TV.  I am thrilled by all the features it has to offer.  A bit slow on the Internet, a keyboard would be helpful to facilitate browsing. I still have lots to learn about it.

Reviews.Title: Beware of the "Smart TV" - DHS security update
Reviews.Author: J.M.B.
Reviews.Content: Beware of the "Smart TV"Today's  DHS daily email referred me to this article which states that LG Smart TV's are collecting personal info and sending it back to LG servers… From the article: "However, even if the feature is disabled, information from the LG Smart TV is still sent back to LG's servers."LG's response: " the retailer who sold the TV should have made customers aware of the Terms and Conditions associated with the use of the device."Here is the article: [...]

Reviews.Title: Wireless Keeps Dropping - Smart TV does not work
Reviews.Author: V. Valle "TechGuru"
Reviews.Content: Decent HD picture when connected to Cable, the big problem is the Wireless connection constantly drops - every other device finds the network and accepts the password, had to connect a blu-ray player to get to Internet content like Netflix, Amazon and Hulu - would not recommend, in other words, this Smart TV is a remarkably dumb device.

Reviews.Title: not so smart tv
Reviews.Author: Simone Martin
Reviews.Content: stopped working after 2 months, no power when I try to turn on, return period past, need help! any advice?

Reviews.Title: Unable to control tv with remote
Reviews.Author: Buster
Reviews.Content: Have owned this tv for about 3 months. Now it ceases to respond to the remote after being on for a  few minutes. It flashes a message on the screen "cannot access this service". And the tv sound is terrible, very poor engineering in my opinion. Had to buy a lg sound bar which sometimes fails to come on too. Great engineering lg!

Reviews.Title: perfect product
Reviews.Author: sudi rashid ukondwa
