Reviews.Content: I again the product came in time, but I surprised when I charged tax. I didnt understand the reason why, since I dont how the money will be surrendered to my government.  Otherwise I love the product.

Reviews.Title: Sent it back
Reviews.Author: D. Swan
Reviews.Content: I bought this LG because I have two other LG LCDs and needed a new one for my home theater. My older (two year) LGs are good old basic 1080p 60 HZ LCDs without all this stupid picture smoothing 120HZ bells and whistles and these $400 LGs blew this new one away in picture and sound.  I did like the smart TV features,but that's about it. Sound was poor and I can't stand the true motion feature. It makes everything look like a cheap soap opera, hence the "soap opera effect" term. I tried turning off true motion and still, movies and TV looked weird and artificial. Some people like this I guess, but to me it's so distracting. I ended up getting a 50" 1080p 60 HZ Sceptre, MHL Ready! LED with a free Roku MHL stick at Walmart online, free shipping for $448! The LGs smart TV feature can't be upgraded like a Roku can and with MHL HDMI ports, I can use my smart phone tablet etc. LG is a little behind the game on MHL. Save $400 and get more smart TV features and 60 HZ, with no soap opera effect with a Sceptre.

Reviews.Title: It is okay
Reviews.Author: AnthonyXD
Reviews.Content: Not very user friendly as far as the interface goes.  I bought two TVs from LG in the past couple of months, this is my first "smart" TV.  I am not impressed.  Picture is good, enough inputs.  But Not impressed with the "smart" functions at all.I would rather buy a surround system with damn near all the same options as this thing has as far as connectivity and spend less on a bigger TV and end up the same or ahead as far as value goes.  But hey, I wanted to see what the hype was about.  You gotta pay to play, right?

Reviews.Title: Not a good choice....
Reviews.Author: jroseeng
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is questionable at best.  It has several picture quality choices such as "Standard", "Cinema", "Games".  But I find myself constantly re-setting the choice to get the best picture.  I tried another unit of the same product to insure that I had not received the one in a thousand bad apple.  There was no difference.  I would not buy this product again.

Reviews.Title: LG 39-inch smart tv A ok..great value
Reviews.Author: cedrict
Reviews.Content: Factory supplied remote too hard to use-buy the the optional one that is included in their upper level models.Check out the MR-400 remote and read the tips left by others,they're right.You can buy the US version for approx.$100.00 or the Asian version for approx. $60.00,(volume and channel controls using characters-big deal,learn a little chinese).Hope this helps........

Reviews.Title: it is do a  smart tv
Reviews.Author: Tony
Reviews.Content: it is a smart tv , but I think it still has a large space to  improve. the first one , it should increase its ram, at least it can support to download a whole movie, when you are watching a movie by the internet explorer , after about 30 minutes , the movie has to be stopped because of it can't download so much! why ?? it is just about 1-2gb. that is the smart tv.the second it shoule combine with the android system. and then we can do what we want ! that is the perfect smart tv! but.....in summary, i have a littlt bit disappoint purchasing  the LG smart tv.

Reviews.Title: Only one problem
Reviews.Author: hammodi
Reviews.Content: The TV is great. the picture quality is the best I've seen so far in LED TVs. need some optimization. change power saver to medium. don't put it on auto. it will ruin your life. picture dimming back and fourth every 10 seconds. also. you need to adjust the voice audio to max. this is the problem with this tv. sound effects are great. loud enough. but you barely hear the voices of the characters (speaking). I set the Clear Voice option on max to get good enough results. but. I might need to get a soundbar or something. Though I think its a software Issue. They need to fix it. overall. Great picture and video quality. the Smart tv features are awesome. the DLNA is the best in any smart tv. access multiple file types from any connected PC (to your router). I also recommend wired internet connection. WIFI speeds are not good enough for streaming. as it is 2.4 GHZ. not 5 GHZ.(even then. wouldn't be good enough). little sound problem that can be partially solved with some optimization. and you've good yourself a big screen. don't go with other brands. I've always bought LG  TV's. they're the best. gaming is great. my PS3 is 1080P on this thing. they could have added  DVI-SUB or a VGA connector for PC. would have been very very useful. I also used this keyboard with a touchpad. I recommend it for SMART TV users.  http://www.amazon.com/Logitech-Wireless-Keyboard-Built-In-Multi-Touch/dp/B005DKZTMG/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid;=1392356414&sr;=8-1&keywords;=K400  .  there are better models. but I don't think it will make a difference until you get the 3rd better model after this. this is good value.UPDATEanother sound issue. speakers are in the bottom of the screen facing the ground. you'll notice that you can hear the sounds better from the room behind the wall that the TV is behind. most of the sound won't be heard by you. you will have to turn the volume high to be able to listen well. bad sound mechanics. and engineering.What to do.Cancel ECO mode. absolutely off. it will automatically dim your screen to lower brightness and backlit. it will be very annoying (if set on auto). I recommend to completely shut it off and then adjust the brightness and backlit as you desire. I have them both at 50. while i had them at 90/100 with minimal Eco. thats why i shut them off.this TV is great for streaming. no need for a streaming device. after all. its a smart TV. the sharing is awesome. I can acess digital videos, music , photos on other PCs in my network. web browsing is great. the main purpose of it is as a TV and its great for that alone. but as a smart TV. you don'y have to connect a PC to it to view all the content you have. one thing they could have done is more Inputs.  An extra HDMI jack would on the other side would have been great. but 3 isn't bad after all. am currently using 2 of them. you might want to look to other options if you have a gaming console, HDTV box and a gaming console. this will be good for 3 devices. but you never know if you need an extra one.by the way. it has an 3.5 MM audio output + the digital toslink output. but you need a receiver for the digital output. if you have a speaker set that has a 3.5 mm aux input. it will be good for this. as the sound on this TV has some problems. not big problems. but some " i can deal with it" problems.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Kelley O'Brien
Reviews.Content: I really love this TV! Picture and color look wonderful. Only thing is it comes with the trumotion on which makes everything look like a soap opera. You just have to turn that off. The trumotion makes everything smooth by making the frame rate 60. For me, it just doesn't look real. Besides that though the tv is seriously worth the money!

Reviews.Title: Absolutely Stunning!
Reviews.Author: Guy from Michigan
Reviews.Content: Upgraded from a LCD sony 32" TV. This is by far the most beautiful picture I've ever had or seen on a TV. I am absolutely amazed. This TV is 600 dollars at Best buy, got it on Amazon for $519! I couldn't be any happier with my purchase!

Reviews.Title: A lazy Smart TV
Reviews.Author: themoni
Reviews.Content: Why? Because the Smart features are awesome only as long as the TV decides to connect to your Wi-Fi. After quite a bit of frustrating time spent on getting the TV to recognize the router plus multiple times inputting the same password over and over ... nada. So it's back to the Blu-ray functioning as the smart part of my TV. Shame. Really. Considering the TV is only four months old.

Reviews.Title: TV fine
Reviews.Author: steve weintraub
Reviews.Content: The remote control is the only issue.  The one sold with it is awkward.  The "Magic" remote is okay, but doesn't replace the original.  Now, including cable, I need 3 remotes to make things work.

Reviews.Title: The LG Smart TV the Good and Bad.
Reviews.Author: Juan O.
Reviews.Content: Well at first I had nothing to complain about, the TV worked amazingly well with my PS4 and with my regular TV antenna. The Quality and the Really when it come to watching my shows where amazing. It was so clear it felt like I was right there in the shows. The sound is great as well. I could hear what was going on my TV even in the other room, it could be very loud at times or in a range of how low you want it to sound. However, that being said, the HDMi inputs work when they want to. The first HDMi works all the time about the other two only want to work when they want to. I feel like this is an update issue, however, theirs is no update available yet. I am shore it I had the smart remote things would be a lot easier as well if you have the extra 80 to 90 dollars to buy the remote you should invest in it as well. I have the regular remote with is ok don't get me wrong whoever, when it comes to using the arrows sometimes your fingers clip the wrong bottom, this get really annoying at times because all you want to do is go up or down when you in the app section of your TV interface and you will be sent back and forth which sucks. other then that its a pretty good TV.

Reviews.Title: LG 47 inch TV
Reviews.Author: Pearl Johnson
Reviews.Content: I love this TV; however, I have some questions as to how to make a picture come full sreen from various DVD'S

Reviews.Title: Beautiful picture
Reviews.Author: TuxedoCat "TuxedoCat"
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV...really easy to set up and configure.  Great picture...even got $20 back on the low price guarantee 10 days later...

Reviews.Title: The 5-star ratings are not inflated!
Reviews.Author: Mickey D
Reviews.Content: I relied on the bulk of the 5-star ratings to give me confidence in buying this smart TV. I was not disappointed - especially the brilliance of the color!!!

Reviews.Title: Love it.
Reviews.Author: Molly
Reviews.Content: Best purchase I've made in a long time.  Couldn't be happier.  Love to listen to Pandora on my new TV.

Reviews.Title: Great!! Better than expectations.
Reviews.Author: David Turner
Reviews.Content: The LG 47LN5700 has an awe inspiring picture. The picture is so clear seems to be in 3D all the time when watching HD shows. My girl and I were watching an Indiana Jones movie last night, she said it felt like the characters were coming into our living room.I'm not exactly a tech whiz, in fact far from it. I have found navigating through and learning as I go with the Smart TV features is fairly simple. Only set back I see is when having to use the on-screen key board with the remote... then again, it is Bluetooth enabled and I'm sure there is a Bluetooth keyboard that is compatible... looking forward to growing in my knowledge of this technical marvel!!

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: Quillo
Reviews.Content: This TV does just everything I imagine and a lot more. Amazing picture and great wireless connectivity with all my different devices!

Reviews.Title: Nice TV, but...
Reviews.Author: Parman E Reynolds "REAI14"
Reviews.Content: The LG TV has a lot of neat features, especially for an online experience.  However, I found the picture quality initially difficult to adjust properly until I buried down into the present menus and then adjusted from there.  It's quite easy to mess up the brightness/contrast combination so that you get weird visuals.  The TV has a built-in showroom display option, so it's likely that the screen is overdriven in the store to make it look brighter than it will appear in your house.  Second, there is some haloing and pixelation around finer details on the screen, which are much more obvious up close (the hands of talking heads are a good example), though this may be typical for all larger HDTVs.  The display also occasionally has a bit of a surreal look to it--almost like you are watching a stage play with not quite correct lighting, which produces more of a flattened two-dimensional look.  Overall, not a bad TV, but I miss my previous Samsung's brightness and vivid colors, but not its continuing starting problems (I have had three Samsungs, all with the same problem, so it wasn't an isolated incident).

Reviews.Title: LG 32" LED
Reviews.Author: Benjamin
Reviews.Content: Very nice and smooth interface, easy to set up, and connects/syncs all the apps we need!  I recommend this for anyone looking for a wireless TV to run NetFlix, Youtube, Pandora, etc. in their home with ease of use and quick set up

Reviews.Title: timeless
Reviews.Author: Matthew Downes
Reviews.Content: ever since we got this been watching over all the HD movies, it perfect, fit well in spaces, well done LG, jus need a wall mount now

Reviews.Title: Very nice TV - pulls in more channels than the RCA digital to analog tuner
Reviews.Author: MulyCat
Reviews.Content: I am pleased with this TV except for the fact that the optical out doesn't seem to work with my Bose amp. (The old LG did work).

Reviews.Title: Great tv!!
Reviews.Author: Karina Romney
Reviews.Content: It is a great tv with good quality however audio isn't all that great. I still have it a 5 because it's not the worst.

Reviews.Title: LG 42" Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Craig Watts
Reviews.Content: A very good value for a TV we wanted to be not "too big". This is the first product that We purchased that was cutting edge technology.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Amparo Supelano
Reviews.Content: The TV is very thin, was easy to install, only thing we had a problem was, that it doesn't look too good, unless you happen to have HD TV, which we didn't' have at the beginning, so HD cable TV is pretty much a must, if you want to get the most out of this TV. Which I now have, and it looks clean, sharp, and crystal clear.Also a good thing is this TV gives you the ability to go into settings, and not have the "Soap Opera Effect" when viewing a movie, if you have a problem, check the settings, Picture->Picture-Options->TruMotion  off.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV
Reviews.Author: RAD
Reviews.Content: This was a Christmas gift for my husband. He absolutely loves it. It has everything he wants and awesome picture. Just the right size for our room. Very clear in all lighting. I recommend the magic remote for the LG Smart T.V. to go along with it.

Reviews.Title: VERY NICE TV
Reviews.Author: BIGJIM
Reviews.Content: SO FAR SO GOOD AFTER CHECKING AROUND AT OTHER AND FINDING OUT ABOUT OTHER BRANDS OF TVS, I FOUND THAT THE LG TVS WERE TOP OF THE LINE FOR THIS CLASS OF TELEVISONS AT AROUND 50 TO 75 DOLLARS LESS THE OTHER BRANDS, TO DATE AT A ROUND OF HAVING THE 42" LG SMART TV WE LOVE IT, BUT DONT KNOW NOW TO WORD ALL THE BELLS YET IT IS WORTH THE MONEY !

Reviews.Title: Pretty good so far!!!
Reviews.Author: Getting a Arsenal
Reviews.Content: Everything is good, but wish it would of came with a keyboard for the tv. My dad purchased a smart tv a year or so ago and his came with one.

Reviews.Title: TV wooks goood
Reviews.Author: Tim
Reviews.Content: TV work good. I like the idea of having a protection plan but won't know how good it is until it breaks.

Reviews.Title: First one I ordered was broke, busted and I was Disgusted!!!
Reviews.Author: I. L. Edwards
Reviews.Content: The first one I received was a Amazon Warehouse Deals item (about $60 less than current Amazon price) that was represented as being in it's "original pristine packaging" - Wrong, it was clearly a return item that was repacked into a Warehouse Deals box which was too big and was not properly packed and secure.  The packing materials were used incorrectly and the result was that the bottom front bezel was broken - it was sitting on the bottom of the box (not in foam supports) and the screen was against the side of the box.  The remote was missing, the owner manual was a photocopy and the wrong screws were included for mounting the base stand to the TV itself.  When plugged in it operated normally for maybe five minutes then started cycling on and off - the only way to make it stop was to unplug the TV since the power button was not functional.  The TV has been returned and I have ordered a replacement from normal Amazon stock.  No question in my mind that a truly NEW TV will be great as I purchased a 32" version of the same model about a month ago.

Reviews.Title: Lemon box and nightmare service - UPDATE
Reviews.Author: Draw player
Reviews.Content: We bought the TV in mid May, and it failed completely at the start of October.  The "Best Buy" warranty offers replacement for a month only, so we were forced to deal with the LG service people.  What a nightmare.Service means they refer you to the closest subcontractor;  that is it.  In Nova Scotia they have one contractor, a two man shop an hour (plus) from my home.  They ordered the mother board.  A week later it had not arrived.  I had to call LG to complain and managed to get a board shipped out Purolator, in time for Thanksgiving.  I was irked by the fact that (again) the onus was on me to determine that the part had not been delivered, and to initiate a special delivery.Now I am dealing with the repair guys' vacation schedules.  That may seem to be a separate issue, although I still contend that LG should be the ones to ensure availability and delivery of prompt service (even if that means having two shops in the province).I bought the unit because it was highly rated high for reliability.  Sadly I got the lemon, and have learned that LG's definition of "service" differs greatly from mine.  I feel that on a 4.5 month old TV they should be the ones to coordinate and supply quality service, and promptly.  The earliest we will see the repair guy will be at the 3.5 week point.If they are unable to deliver that service perhaps there should be an option to get a new box or a refund.Based on this experience I can never buy another LG product.November 30.  We finally had the motherboard replaced October 24, after being down over three weeks.  It went again tonight.  Three weeks down.  Five weeks up.  Sigh

Reviews.Title: ArsTEchnica says thiis TV spies on you!
Reviews.Author: Roka2 "mmx"
Reviews.Content: It seems that this television spies on you and sends your viewing data and more over the internet.For details See:[...]"The unidentified blogger, whose twitter profile described him as a "developer, tweaker and Linux enthusiast" living in UK county of Yorkshire, said the LG Smart TV model is LG 42LN575V and was manufactured May 2013. He provided screenshots of data packets he said he captured showing the information his TV sent unencrypted over the Internet. The data appeared to show a device ID unique to his set, along with the name of the channel it was tuned to. In his tests, the information was sent in the clear every time the channel was changed. Even more remarkable, he said, the smart TV sent the data even after he waded through the system preferences and set the "Collection of watching info" setting to "off" (it was on by default).But the logging didn't stop there. Included in the traffic sent over the Internet were the names of files stored on a USB drive connected to the LG television. For dramatic purposes and to ensure he chose a file name not likely used by the firmware, he created a mock video file called Midget_Porn_2013.avi, loaded it onto a USB drive and plugged it into his TV. Sure enough, the file name was transmitted unencrypted in HTTP traffic sent to the address GB.smartshare.lgtvsdp.com. In some cases, he said, file names for an entire folder were transmitted, and other times nothing at all was sent. He never determined the rules that controlled when data was or wasn't sent."much more in articlearstechnica.com/security/2013/11/smart-tv-from-lg-phones-home-with-users-viewing-habits-usb-file-names/

Reviews.Author: Richard Hagen
Reviews.Content: I would suggest buying this TV new and not through Warehouse deals. I bought this Television through Warehouse deals and once I received it, it was like the TV had never been opened, the box was brand new, everything was in tip top shape.. until I turned it on.The panel was bad and I was receiving no picture after about an hour of use. I decided to return the television, I spent the extra 100 and bought one from Amazon brand new.I have not received the New Television yet but from just the hour that I had the working one, I can tell that I will be very happy with my  purchase. I shouldn't of cheaped out to begin with.

Reviews.Title: LG  55ln5700
Reviews.Author: Kevin Priddy
Reviews.Content: I must say that I was extremely disappointed in this tv.  I just spent about 3 weekends remodeling my living room.  My reward for all my hard work was a tv.  I have been saving my cash for a couple years, waiting for the best deal and for the tvs to improve . After reading the reviews I had narrowed it down to 3 tvs.  The LG 55 inch went on sale and it was several hundred dollars cheaper than my number 1 and about the same as my number two so I bought it. Got it home, hooked it up and mounted it to the wall.  Spent the next couple days adjusting the picture, sound etc.... Can you say buyers remorse.  I HATED IT.  I had saved up my money and this is what I got.  I would rather cut a hole in my wall and install my 10 yr old toshiba.  The picture had very bad judder with normal drama tv shows, oh yes I did research and did the trumotion off, and adjusted the other settings, also the sound, my cell phone has better sound than this tv.  On the 3rd day I decided I could not and would not keep this tv. I returned it and got a Sony.  MUCH happier!!!! So in the end if you are blind and deaf and don't mind throwing your money away buy this tv.  If you value your money buy something of better quality, sony,samsung,panasonic, anything else than this LG.  Also I think a company selling this tv and advertising it as 120hz should be sued. It would not pass as a 50 hz if there were such a tv. I hope I got my point across. Future buyer you were warned.  I wish others would have been honest in there reviews and I would not have spent a day taking my tv down, repackaging it and driving 60 miles to return it!!!!

Reviews.Title: WOULD APPRECIATE MORE AUDIO OUT PROVISIONS.
Reviews.Author: EDWARD J. HOVAN
Reviews.Content: I use wireless headphones frequently. If connecting to dvr audio all is fine. However, when using smart tv feature, I would like to connect the wireless system to a TV out audio. The connection supplied (called headphones) seems inadequate.

Reviews.Title: Mostly wonderful, partially concerning
Reviews.Author: Pamela Hanford "redding cat lover"
Reviews.Content: The setup was relatively easy, but we had to run out and purchase the proper hdmi cord.  The setup was easy and user-friendly.  The wifi took several attempts to connect, but then we easily accessed our Netflix account and YouTube.  I haven't tried other services so far.The picture is overwhelmingly beautiful.  Try watching the sweeping panoramic shots of the English coastline and countryside in "Kingdom."I love that I can pair my Nook and use it to search for videos on my YouTube account instead of fiddling with the magic remote.Negatives:I've had to re-connect with my network several times.  I did a reset with the Costco concierge people and that may have helped.The Nook (or the TV) spontaneously disconnect in the middle of something and I need to start over.  This means going back to the pairing process -- possibly.  Last night with some fiddling I was able to re-start a video without re-pairing.  Something is hinky here and I'm not sure what it is.We really hope this issue will sort itself out.  The setup was easy, but repacking this and taking it back to the store would be a nightmare.If anyone else has suggestions or fixes, I would love to know about them!Later edit:I forgot to mention that we were sad to discover that high def closed captions are not available using the cable box.  We can choose a co-axial cable and then use the television's more sophisticated closed-caption system (but lose high def), OR use the cable-box caption system, which includes the nasty black box over the picture.  I'm kind of stunned to discover that with all of the high technology in these two systems that this is the case.I'm not sure this is an LG issue -- it is likely all TV's in this category.  But this is a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: magic remote not included
Reviews.Author: whynot
Reviews.Content: the magic remote is needed for almost every bit of the games in the Apps. LG not worth the money if you need to buy something that is needed to operate all the features of the TV! Will never buy another LG product for that very reason,how many of they're other lines of products are being sold the same way.

Reviews.Title: This is a 60Hz TV and NOT 120Hz.  MISSADVERTIZED!!!
Reviews.Author: OK
Reviews.Content: Advertized as 120Hz but in actuality it is a 60Hz TV so I was pretty bummed when I brought it home.  You can download the manual here and find out for your selves.[...].  and go to Specks Page 34.  60Hz for all models listed in this manual including this one.Also the magic remote, well I personally don't like it, best way to describe it is it is just like the "Wii" remote,  has very few buttons, can't dial the channels so if you want to change a channel you have to either scroll up/down or if you want to dial a channel # when you press a button on the remote a little dial pad comes up on the TV screen and you have to point at it to dial the numbers and requires a very steady hand to do that.

Reviews.Title: Meh...
Reviews.Author: RjB
Reviews.Content: The setup was easy, the picture is good and the wifi is very good. The sound was horrible, though, I had to shell out for a sound bar. The "magic" remote is a pain in the neck; as pointing devices go it's only barely adequate in most cases for the smart TV functions (including browsing) and it makes the simplest functions (like going to a specific channel) ridiculously hard so I tend to avoid most of the "smart" capabilities the TV has. For that matter, a number of the usual functions/capabilities I've come to expect from a TV are not supported; you can only consistently get program information if you use a "cable box" (I get program info for 2 channels out of nearly 100), the channels are laid out based on source (TV/DTV) so 2.0 is 70 channels away from 2.1, and there is no "back" capability to go back to the last channel viewed (my previous TV allowed setting up to 4 channels for surf/back capability, which worked great for college football Saturday). so, generally, I'm hoping this LG dies soon so I can justify going back to a Sony Bravia to my wife.

Reviews.Title: Not the same tv as in the store
Reviews.Author: Carlos J. Melendez
Reviews.Content: The TV is a little thick for the times.  The TV comes out almost 6 inches from the wall.  I look at almost everything except the actual dimensions.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: jarg
Reviews.Content: I never thought when purchasing a Smart TV that it would not support iOS MAC software.  I bought an Apple TV thinking that would solve the problem.  It did not.  The techs at LG said they guarantee nothing when it comes to MAC.  I am returning the TV.

Reviews.Title: Get the whole story
Reviews.Author: M.R. Peters
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV based on positive "top" reviews here and elsewhere - only later to find that there's a particular quirk related to power supply that people all over the net have complained about, but that doesn't appear unless you're doing some trouble shooting-type Google searching.The moment I plugged in the set, it began rebooting in a continuous loop and the only thing that remotely worked to get it to remain on was to tap it on the back of the set near the power supply. In addition to the constant re-boot at start-up, it would shut off and restart every time we tried to connect to wireless/smart TV functions. I connected it to cable internet (avg. 50 Mbps) directly via ethernet cable and that didn't help. Others online have theorized that it's the lack of a cooling fan inside the unit and have gone so far as to install a computer-like fan upon removing the back of the television. That was all too complicated for me, especially considering that I paid a not-insignificant sum for this TV.In sum, I sent it back and got another set that works perfectly (different brand!), so I know the issue was not user error. The thing was just possessed. My recommendation to everyone? AVOID AVOID AVOID!

Reviews.Title: Near perfect smart TV.
Reviews.Author: Mark Chad
Reviews.Content: Great TV and everything on it works wonderfully with one exception. The Wi-Fi connection could have been thought out better. I found it constantly disconnecting as I was watching Netflix. The problem was solved with an Ethernet cable, but that might not work if your router isn't near by. The picture and build quality is superb!

Reviews.Title: For the savvy consumer
Reviews.Author: Samuel cassidy
Reviews.Content: Trumotion is kinda hard to find in the settings and it looks OK when it's on it's clear but the frame rate drops so it had a lagging effect. I would say the smart tv functions are cool IF you use them I don't. Wait a few months and you will be able to get a 4k tv for the same price already I saw a 55" seiki 4k 120hz tv for just 200$ more than what I paid for this 47" food for thought!

Reviews.Title: Everything is awesome, except Wi-Di
Reviews.Author: Rehman
Reviews.Content: PROS:The TV is awesome. It's more awesome than how they say it is. The remote is not a pain (as some people say), and you could even connect a wireless keyboard and mouse!!!If you're using the home network, is shows all storage devices for easy file sharing (including mobines, if the settings are right).You could pair YouTube with any device, and then play em on the TV (via internet).CONS:The Wi-Di is very buggy. It identifies, but does not successfully connect to either of my Lenovo E420 3rd Gen Intel laptops. I was really looking forward to the wireless display (Wi-Di), hence the missing star. If not for this, the TV is 101% epic.

Reviews.Title: Love the Picture, Hate the Sound
Reviews.Author: thatsme63
Reviews.Content: Extremely disappointed in the sound quality out of this unit, particularly after having a previous LG TV that sounded great.  I added a sound bar and now I'm happy again.

Reviews.Title: Perfect bedroom tv
Reviews.Author: Kevin M G
Reviews.Content: It's the perfect bedroom tv especially being a smart tv. Needs a lighted remote and six more words to complete the review

Reviews.Title: 60Hz
Reviews.Author: Ray Jernberg
Reviews.Content: It was advertised as 120Hz ---Was actually a 60Hz set ----(Over priced for 60Hz but a good T.V.set )  Just hope it will play fast games .

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Alison Watt
Reviews.Content: I love everything about this tv. There is not anything I do not like. I would recommend this TV for anyone.

Reviews.Title: summary
Reviews.Author: Paul Martinek
Reviews.Content: The picture seems to be too dark and using the remote and brightness setting was unable to be satisfied to my satisfaction

Reviews.Title: tv was difficult to assemble for a grandmother
Reviews.Author: gramma "frugal gramma"
Reviews.Content: difficult to assemble, I had problems getting it to work, smart part still not working, but good picture quality after I figured it out. Sometimes picture goes off without warning and makes a loud (weird) noise, not sure if it's a Comcast issue or LG TV.

Reviews.Title: You Get what you pay for!
Reviews.Author: murfonline
Reviews.Content: Folks let start out by saying I'm not telling you to not buy the LG tv, it's simply you get what you pay for. Guess What the LG smart TV that will let you skype DOES NOT have a camera!  Yes it's an optional add on you have to buy!  And guess what else... Well they couldn't very well not give you any sound, but they can give you sound quality so poor you are forced to buy..you guessed it, the optional Sound Bar from LG.  I could have spent the additional 200 dollars on an Samsung that has excellent sound quality, built in camera I know because that's what  I have. Should have never tried to cheap out on this gift for my parents. We were all sadly disappointed.  I can tell you this; between the LG TV I bought and LG Microwave (a real piece of trash) I will never purchase ANY LG products. I"M done with LG.. JUNK JUNK JUNK.  If you buy this tv you will soon buy the sound bar if you want to listen to it.My recommendation is just purchase something of good quality like a Samsung. Hope this helps. Dave

Reviews.Title: LG spying - an update
Reviews.Author: R. Tatum "eBookNut"
Reviews.Content: About the LG spying issue, I just received this from LG's chat support:"LG:  Information such as channel, TV platform, broadcast source, etc. that is collected by certain LG Smart TVs is not personal but viewing information. This information is collected as part of the Smart TV platform to deliver more relevant advertisements and to offer recommendations to viewers based on what other LG Smart TV owners are watching. We have verified that even when this function is turned off by the viewers, it continues to transmit viewing information although the data is not retained by the server. A firmware update is being prepared for immediate rollout that will correct this problem on all affected LG Smart TVs so when this feature is disabled, no data will be transmitted. It has also been reported that the names of media files stored on external drives such as USB flash devices are being collected by LG Smart TVs. While the file names are not stored, the transmission of such file names was part of a new feature being readied to search for data from the internet (metadata) related to the program being watched in order to deliver a better viewing experience. This feature, however, was never fully implemented and no personal data was ever collected or retained. This feature will also be removed from affected LG Smart TVs with the firmware update. LG regrets any concerns these reports may have caused and will continue to strive to meet the expectations of all our customers and the public. We hope this update clears up any confusion.LG: It will be taken off soon."I disagree that this is not personal information.  If one registers their TV with LG, they can connect the serial number to the data received.  In other words, they will know who owns the TV that is sending the data.Caveat emptor.

Reviews.Title: TV Delivered with Shattered Screen
Reviews.Author: Kate
Reviews.Content: I received this television 15 minutes ago and once I turned it out I immediately realized that the screen was shattered. Badly. The TV will not even turn on. To make matter worse I have been on the phone with customer service for over thirty minutes and have been on hold for most of this time. I am beyond disappointed by Amazon's response to my rather expensive purchase. It's clear to see by the packing that they did not care how the TV withstood delivery. I will never purchase electronics from them again. They are careless and it's not worth the discount.

Reviews.Title: my 3rd update on the review
Reviews.Author: jeff
Reviews.Content: Since the tv software was updated and I get Amazon on demand I am pretty happy with it.  One complaint is that the remote to the tv does not work with my lg soundbar.  Minor gripe.  Sometimes amazon video on demand will just cut off or pause and I have to restart the tv.  Also when my phone is connected to the tv (awesome) sometimes it will freeze or not load up youtube videos properly (not awesome).  Overall not a bad tv but could be improved.  I am not a video buff so the quality is good to me.  *edit 1/20/2014 the tv is making me pretty mad because the video pauses maybe once every 30 seconds, while my phone in the same wifi plays the same hulu program no problem... gonna save up and get a better tv

Reviews.Title: Great picture after calibration
Reviews.Author: J. Hig
Reviews.Content: I never give TV's a five so be aware of that. This is a great TV and the only negative I have is that it does have Amazon Prime support built into the Smart feature. Picture quality was great right out of the box and outstanding after I used my Disney WOW disk to calibrate it. Sound is marginally acceptable but who uses the built in speakers. I paired mine with a Vizio 425 sound bar and it rocks.

Reviews.Title: Smart compaired to what or whom?
Reviews.Author: Jamie
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong, I bought this set because I wanted LED in a larger size and I got everything I was expecting as a TV. The picture and sound are perfect from my viewing standpoint with setup being a snap and I considered the 'Smart' portion an add on that might or might not be useful. Understand that I am not a 'gamer' and have no peripherals added except a desktop with WiFi, and a media card added which allows for viewing Amazon Prime on my new set. I chose Prime over Netflix because of available program selection and annual price.I tried Netflix free for a month but found that instead of presenting lists like they do with mailed DVD's they offer a bunch of stuff that they think I'd want to see. How do they know? Of course I could always use search. I tried that, I wanted to see 'The Three Musketeers' with Charlie Sheen and I got of list of several versions, some in B&W;, none included Charlie. Netflix charges $7.99/mo. while the annual charge for Prime is $79.00 a year with a much larger selection of DVD's, free two day shipping and one book a month from Kindle.Anyway, I'm a happy camper ignoring the Smart features and without the Smart, the TV alone would rate five stars.Oh, I almost bought the new optional remote and am glad I didn't, I'm hearing that it needs some more perfecting plus I don't think LG is very proud of it either because emailed them for a source and they answered promptly with a video that I'd already seen on Amazon but no local source for a hands on check.

Reviews.Title: It's ok.
Reviews.Author: Martha Strickland
Reviews.Content: Setting it up was more complicated than I expected. Attaching the base required a special tool or more strength than I have. The picture is distorted somewhat: wider than natural.

Reviews.Title: So far it doesn't work
Reviews.Author: Matthew Zuck
Reviews.Content: The UPS guy actually had seen enough defective units that he warned me not to be surprised if the screen was damaged and I had to send it back.  I appreciated the warning.  Just an FYI -- good chance you'll have to send this one back.  We'll see if the next one I get works.

Reviews.Title: Screen broke
Reviews.Author: coco
Reviews.Content: TV was working perfectly until my daughter hit the screen and a crack is showing. The technician asked me to get this part, BUSYLJR Screen for TV Year 201X. Serial no 306 RMHR 3E265. Where can i get that?

Reviews.Title: LG TV SOMEWHAT FRUSTRATING.
Reviews.Author: Marvin
Reviews.Content: WRITTEN OPERATING  INSTRUCTIONS ARE INADEQUATE. BASE WAS WOBBLY AND LG SENT A REPLACEMENT WITH LONGER SCREWS BUT INSTALLING IT OVER AGAIN WAS A NUISANCE.  CAPTIONS WITH 'MUTE ON' OPTION DOESN'T WORK AND LG SAYS IT'S THE CABLE COMPANY'S FAULT AND VICE VERSA. ACCESS TO CAPTIONS (ON-OFF) IS COMPICATED .PICTURE IN HI DEF IS EXCELLENT BUT ONLY FAIR IN STANDARD DEF.  LG NEEDS MORE WRITTEN OPERATING INSTRUCTIONS BECAUSE ON SCREEN INSTRUCTIONS DON'T  COVER EVERYTHING THEY SHOULD.  SMART TV INSTRUCTIONS ARE VAGUE.AMAZON'S SERVICE IS EXEMPLARY.

Reviews.Title: LG Smart tv
Reviews.Author: Chip Keckler
Reviews.Content: The picture is great, easy to set upSound is really lackluster needs a soundboard to say the least.I have a Samsung I the family room 6 years old it still doesn't compare to that , butIt was not near the cost of a Samsung either,Overall except for the tin can sound I like it

Reviews.Title: No amazon instant video app
Reviews.Author: marphil
Reviews.Content: This stinks! Bought for my husband for Father's Day and now have to return it because the stupid thing does not do Amazon Instant Video. Big area on amazon about LG 2012  having it but apparently not the 2013!!!! Not Happy!!!

Reviews.Title: TVs Great, However
Reviews.Author: Nichin
Reviews.Content: I never actually plugged the TV in, for some reason the product dimensions are wrong. I think the listed sizes are for the shipping box. I should have realized the discrepancy when a 42 in TV was listed as 45 in wide.

Reviews.Title: Remote stopped working after two days of use.
Reviews.Author: andrew Petersimes
Reviews.Content: Installed very easy, but after 2 days the remote does not work? Only to turn on and off. LG is sending new remote, been 5 days no remote yet. Nice picture though.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY any LG products!
Reviews.Author: John W.
Reviews.Content: We bought the 47" LG Smart TV, at another retailer b/c of price, and the SOFTWARE IS TERRIBLE.  The Smart TV apps don't work well, and when they crash they take hours of time and all sorts of hoop-jumping to get back working.And if you want support from LG, FORGET IT!  They have an Indian call center where they read from a script and offer simple "workarounds" - not real fixes.The TV may seem GREAT at first, but ours is two years old and they stopped doing software updates 6 months ago.  That means the buggy crapplications running on it will never get fixed!BOOOO LG!I gave it 2 stars because it has a great picture when it works.  but we bought it to stream digital content and that's the big PITA.

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware
Reviews.Author: kelly devenney wood
Reviews.Content: Ordered suggested add on wall mount and based on order confirmation was getting both....to my dismay- no mount came, went rounds with amazon to no avail. So I ended up paying more for the tv than quoted. Then go to set up and the main 3 screws to mount the tv on the stand ....weren't there. Amazon said go buy the screws we will reimburse you. Lol. I'll rethink my next big buy.

Reviews.Title: lcd tv
Reviews.Author: discodj "dj man"
Reviews.Content: pros nonecons picture lag, speaker volume not loud enough poor quaity, biggets complaint it does not have a rca line output for powered speakers, worst it does not even have a headphone jack to connect power or pc speakers, how cheap can LG be not to install any connector tv waste of money

Reviews.Title: You THINK you're watching your LG smart TV but IT's WATCHING YOU, baby
Reviews.Author: smtips "smtips"
Reviews.Content: You THINK you're watching your LG smart TV - but IT's WATCHING YOU, baby. I think I will pass on this.Do a search on the subject line and see what you come up with. Unbelievable but apparently true.

Reviews.Title: All 3 LG42LN5700 TV's will not work
Reviews.Author: stephen Bowes
Reviews.Content: We purchased 3 = 42" TV's. None of the three remains operable at this date.The first one was made inoperable on 6/13/13 along with our phone system, a 21.5" iMac and it's attendent equipment,due to a near lightning strike. We replaced everything and installed surge protection on everything. We had another lightning strike and lost the new TV. We replaced it and installed a new copper coated ground rod 8 feet long. A near lightning strike left the new one (the 3rd) inoperable 2days after installation.We have had a licensed electrition out to evaluate the situation.After 3 Lg units we doubt the reliability of their products.

Reviews.Title: LED tv
Reviews.Author: DANNY CONWAY
Reviews.Content: nothing wrong with tv, just don't like LED TVS, prefer Plasma. Will not buy another LED tv. Plasma has a much better picture in my opinion
